definition_or_explanation: With respect to an index, the individual securities within an index.

original_glossary_extracted: Consumer surplus  The difference between the value that a consumer places on units purchased and the amount of money that was required to pay for them.
definition_or_explanation: The difference between the value that a consumer places on units purchased and the amount of money that was required to pay for them.

original_glossary_extracted: Contingency provision  Clause in a legal document that allows for some action if a specific event or circumstance occurs.
definition_or_explanation: Clause in a legal document that allows for some action if a specific event or circumstance occurs.

original_glossary_extracted: Contingent claims  Derivatives in which the payoffs occur if a specific event occurs; generally referred to as options.
definition_or_explanation: Derivatives in which the payoffs occur if a specific event occurs; generally referred to as options.

original_glossary_extracted: Contingent convertible bonds  Bonds that automatically convert into equity if a specific event or circumstance occurs, such as the issuer's equity capital falling below the minimum requirement set by the regulators. Also called CoCos.
definition_or_explanation: Bonds that automatically convert into equity if a specific event or circumstance occurs, such as the issuer's equity capital falling below the minimum requirement set by the regulators. Also called CoCos.

original_glossary_extracted: Continuation patterns  A type of pattern used in technical analysis to predict the resumption of a market trend that was in place prior to the formation of a pattern.
definition_or_explanation: A type of pattern used in technical analysis to predict the resumption of a market trend that was in place prior to the formation of a pattern.

original_glossary_extracted: Continuous random variable  A random variable for which the range of possible outcomes is the real line (all real num-bers between −∞ and +∞ or some subset of the real line).
definition_or_explanation: A random variable for which the range of possible outcomes is the real line (all real num-bers between −∞ and +∞ or some subset of the real line).

original_glossary_extracted: Continuous time  Time thought of as advancing in extremely small increments.
definition_or_explanation: Time thought of as advancing in extremely small increments.

original_glossary_extracted: Continuous trading market  A market in which trades can be arranged and executed any time the market is open.
definition_or_explanation: A market in which trades can be arranged and executed any time the market is open.

original_glossary_extracted: Continuously compounded return  The natural logarithm of 1 plus the holding period return, or equivalently, the natural logarithm of the ending price over the beginning price.
definition_or_explanation: The natural logarithm of 1 plus the holding period return, or equivalently, the natural logarithm of the ending price over the beginning price.

original_glossary_extracted: Contra account  An account that offsets another account.
definition_or_explanation: An account that offsets another account.

original_glossary_extracted: Contract rate  See mortgage rate.
definition_or_explanation: See mortgage rate.

original_glossary_extracted: Contraction  The period of a business cycle after the peak and before the trough; often called a recession or, if exceptionally severe, called a depression.
definition_or_explanation: The period of a business cycle after the peak and before the trough; often called a recession or, if exceptionally severe, called a depression.

original_glossary_extracted: Contraction risk  The risk that when interest rates decline, the security will have a shorter maturity than was anticipated at the time of purchase because borrowers refinance at the new, lower interest rates.
definition_or_explanation: The risk that when interest rates decline, the security will have a shorter maturity than was anticipated at the time of purchase because borrowers refinance at the new, lower interest rates.

original_glossary_extracted: Contractionary  Tending to cause the real economy to contract.
definition_or_explanation: Tending to cause the real economy to contract.

original_glossary_extracted: Contractionary fiscal policy  A fiscal policy that has the objec-tive to make the real economy contract.
definition_or_explanation: A fiscal policy that has the objec-tive to make the real economy contract.

original_glossary_extracted: Contracts for differences  See non-deliverable forwards.
definition_or_explanation: See non-deliverable forwards.

original_glossary_extracted: Contribution margin  The amount available for fixed costs and profit after paying variable costs; revenue minus variable costs.
definition_or_explanation: The amount available for fixed costs and profit after paying variable costs; revenue minus variable costs.

original_glossary_extracted: Controlling shareholders  A particular shareholder or block of shareholders holding a percentage of shares that gives them significant voting power.
definition_or_explanation: A particular shareholder or block of shareholders holding a percentage of shares that gives them significant voting power.

original_glossary_extracted: Convenience yield  A non-monetary advantage of holding an asset.
definition_or_explanation: A non-monetary advantage of holding an asset.

original_glossary_extracted: Conventional bond  See plain vanilla bond.
definition_or_explanation: See plain vanilla bond.

original_glossary_extracted: Conventional cash flow  A conventional cash flow pattern is one with an initial outflow followed by a series of inflows.
definition_or_explanation: A conventional cash flow pattern is one with an initial outflow followed by a series of inflows.

original_glossary_extracted: Convergence  The tendency for differences in output per capita across countries to diminish over time; in technical analysis, a term that describes the case when an indicator moves in the same manner as the security being analyzed.
definition_or_explanation: The tendency for differences in output per capita across countries to diminish over time; in technical analysis, a term that describes the case when an indicator moves in the same manner as the security being analyzed.

original_glossary_extracted: Conversion price  For a convertible bond, the price per share at which the bond can be converted into shares.
definition_or_explanation: For a convertible bond, the price per share at which the bond can be converted into shares.

original_glossary_extracted: Conversion ratio  For a convertible bond, the number of common shares that each bond can be converted into.
definition_or_explanation: For a convertible bond, the number of common shares that each bond can be converted into.

original_glossary_extracted: Conversion value  For a convertible bond, the current share price multiplied by the conversion ratio.
definition_or_explanation: For a convertible bond, the current share price multiplied by the conversion ratio.

original_glossary_extracted: Convertible bond  Bond that gives the bondholder the right to exchange the bond for a specified number of common shares in the issuing company.
definition_or_explanation: Bond that gives the bondholder the right to exchange the bond for a specified number of common shares in the issuing company.

original_glossary_extracted: Convertible preference shares  A type of equity security that entitles shareholders to convert their shares into a specified number of common shares.
definition_or_explanation: A type of equity security that entitles shareholders to convert their shares into a specified number of common shares.

original_glossary_extracted: Convexity adjustment  For a bond, one half of the annual or approximate convexity statistic multiplied by the change in the yield-to-maturity squared.
definition_or_explanation: For a bond, one half of the annual or approximate convexity statistic multiplied by the change in the yield-to-maturity squared.

original_glossary_extracted: Core inflation  The inflation rate calculated based on a price index of goods and services except food and energy.
definition_or_explanation: The inflation rate calculated based on a price index of goods and services except food and energy.

original_glossary_extracted: Corporate governance  The system of internal controls and procedures by which individual companies are managed.
definition_or_explanation: The system of internal controls and procedures by which individual companies are managed.

original_glossary_extracted: Correlation  A number between −1 and +1 that measures the comovement (linear association) between two random variables.
definition_or_explanation: A number between −1 and +1 that measures the comovement (linear association) between two random variables.

original_glossary_extracted: Correlation coefficient  A number between −1 and +1 that measures the consistency or tendency for two investments to act in a similar way. It is used to determine the effect on portfolio risk when two assets are combined.
definition_or_explanation: A number between −1 and +1 that measures the consistency or tendency for two investments to act in a similar way. It is used to determine the effect on portfolio risk when two assets are combined.

original_glossary_extracted: Cost averaging  The periodic investment of a fixed amount of money.
definition_or_explanation: The periodic investment of a fixed amount of money.

original_glossary_extracted: Cost of capital  The rate of return that suppliers of capital require as compensation for their contribution of capital.
definition_or_explanation: The rate of return that suppliers of capital require as compensation for their contribution of capital.

original_glossary_extracted: Cost of carry  See carry.
definition_or_explanation: See carry.

original_glossary_extracted: Cost of debt  The cost of debt financing to a company, such as when it issues a bond or takes out a bank loan.
definition_or_explanation: The cost of debt financing to a company, such as when it issues a bond or takes out a bank loan.

original_glossary_extracted: Cost of preferred stock  The cost to a company of issuing preferred stock; the dividend yield that a company must commit to pay preferred stockholders.
definition_or_explanation: The cost to a company of issuing preferred stock; the dividend yield that a company must commit to pay preferred stockholders.

original_glossary_extracted: Cost-push  Type of inflation in which rising costs, usually wages, compel businesses to raise prices generally.
definition_or_explanation: Type of inflation in which rising costs, usually wages, compel businesses to raise prices generally.

original_glossary_extracted: Cost recovery method  A method of revenue recognition in which the seller does not report any profit until the cash amounts paid by the buyer-including principal and interest on any financing from the seller-are greater than all the seller's costs for the merchandise sold.
definition_or_explanation: A method of revenue recognition in which the seller does not report any profit until the cash amounts paid by the buyer-including principal and interest on any financing from the seller-are greater than all the seller's costs for the merchandise sold.

original_glossary_extracted: Cost structure  The mix of a company's variable costs and fixed costs.
definition_or_explanation: The mix of a company's variable costs and fixed costs.

original_glossary_extracted: Counterparty risk  The risk that the other party to a contract will fail to honor the terms of the contract.
definition_or_explanation: The risk that the other party to a contract will fail to honor the terms of the contract.

original_glossary_extracted: Coupon rate  The interest rate promised in a contract; this is the rate used to calculate the periodic interest payments.
definition_or_explanation: The interest rate promised in a contract; this is the rate used to calculate the periodic interest payments.

original_glossary_extracted: Cournot assumption  Assumption in which each firm deter-mines its profit-maximizing production level assuming that the other firms' output will not change.
definition_or_explanation: Assumption in which each firm deter-mines its profit-maximizing production level assuming that the other firms' output will not change.

original_glossary_extracted: Covariance  A measure of the co-movement (linear association) between two random variables.
definition_or_explanation: A measure of the co-movement (linear association) between two random variables.

original_glossary_extracted: Covariance matrix  A matrix or square array whose entries are covariances; also known as a variance-covariance matrix.
definition_or_explanation: A matrix or square array whose entries are covariances; also known as a variance-covariance matrix.

original_glossary_extracted: Covenants  The terms and conditions of lending agreements that the issuer must comply with; they specify the actions that an issuer is obligated to perform (affirmative covenant) or prohibited from performing (negative covenant).
definition_or_explanation: The terms and conditions of lending agreements that the issuer must comply with; they specify the actions that an issuer is obligated to perform (affirmative covenant) or prohibited from performing (negative covenant).

original_glossary_extracted: Covered bond  Debt obligation secured by a segregated pool of assets called the cover pool. The issuer must maintain the value of the cover pool. In the event of default, bondholders have recourse against both the issuer and the cover pool.
definition_or_explanation: Debt obligation secured by a segregated pool of assets called the cover pool. The issuer must maintain the value of the cover pool. In the event of default, bondholders have recourse against both the issuer and the cover pool.

original_glossary_extracted: Credit analysis  The evaluation of credit risk; the evaluation of the creditworthiness of a borrower or counterparty.
definition_or_explanation: The evaluation of credit risk; the evaluation of the creditworthiness of a borrower or counterparty.

original_glossary_extracted: Credit curve  A curve showing the relationship between time to maturity and yield spread for an issuer with comparable bonds of various maturities outstanding, usually upward sloping.
definition_or_explanation: A curve showing the relationship between time to maturity and yield spread for an issuer with comparable bonds of various maturities outstanding, usually upward sloping.

original_glossary_extracted: Credit default swap (CDS)  A type of credit derivative in which one party, the credit protection buyer who is seeking credit protection against a third party, makes a series of regularly scheduled payments to the other party, the credit protection seller. The seller makes no payments until a credit event occurs.
definition_or_explanation: A type of credit derivative in which one party, the credit protection buyer who is seeking credit protection against a third party, makes a series of regularly scheduled payments to the other party, the credit protection seller. The seller makes no payments until a credit event occurs.

original_glossary_extracted: Credit derivatives  A contract in which one party has the right to claim a payment from another party in the event that a specific credit event occurs over the life of the contract.
definition_or_explanation: A contract in which one party has the right to claim a payment from another party in the event that a specific credit event occurs over the life of the contract.

original_glossary_extracted: Credit enhancements  Provisions that may be used to reduce the credit risk of a bond issue.
definition_or_explanation: Provisions that may be used to reduce the credit risk of a bond issue.

original_glossary_extracted: Credit-linked coupon bond  Bond for which the coupon changes when the bond's credit rating changes.
definition_or_explanation: Bond for which the coupon changes when the bond's credit rating changes.

original_glossary_extracted: Credit-linked note (CLN)  Fixed-income security in which the holder of the security has the right to withhold payment of the full amount due at maturity if a credit event occurs.
definition_or_explanation: Fixed-income security in which the holder of the security has the right to withhold payment of the full amount due at maturity if a credit event occurs.

original_glossary_extracted: Credit migration risk  The risk that a bond issuer's creditwor-thiness deteriorates, or migrates lower, leading investors to believe the risk of default is higher. Also called down-grade risk.
definition_or_explanation: The risk that a bond issuer's creditwor-thiness deteriorates, or migrates lower, leading investors to believe the risk of default is higher. Also called down-grade risk.

original_glossary_extracted: Credit risk  The risk of loss caused by a counterparty's or debtor's failure to make a promised payment. Also called default risk.
definition_or_explanation: The risk of loss caused by a counterparty's or debtor's failure to make a promised payment. Also called default risk.

original_glossary_extracted: Credit scoring model  A statistical model used to classify borrowers according to creditworthiness.
definition_or_explanation: A statistical model used to classify borrowers according to creditworthiness.

original_glossary_extracted: Credit spread option  An option on the yield spread on a bond.
definition_or_explanation: An option on the yield spread on a bond.

original_glossary_extracted: Credit tranching  A structure used to redistribute the credit risk associated with the collateral; a set of bond classes created to allow investors a choice in the amount of credit risk that they prefer to bear.
definition_or_explanation: A structure used to redistribute the credit risk associated with the collateral; a set of bond classes created to allow investors a choice in the amount of credit risk that they prefer to bear.

original_glossary_extracted: Credit-worthiness  The perceived ability of the borrower to pay what is owed on the borrowing in a timely manner; it represents the ability of a company to withstand adverse impacts on its cash flows.
definition_or_explanation: The perceived ability of the borrower to pay what is owed on the borrowing in a timely manner; it represents the ability of a company to withstand adverse impacts on its cash flows.

original_glossary_extracted: Cross-default provisions  Provisions whereby events of default such as non-payment of interest on one bond trigger default on all outstanding debt; implies the same default probability for all issues.
definition_or_explanation: Provisions whereby events of default such as non-payment of interest on one bond trigger default on all outstanding debt; implies the same default probability for all issues.

original_glossary_extracted: Cross-price elasticity of demand  The percentage change in quantity demanded for a given percentage change in the price of another good; the responsiveness of the demand for Product A that is associated with the change in price of Product B.
definition_or_explanation: The percentage change in quantity demanded for a given percentage change in the price of another good; the responsiveness of the demand for Product A that is associated with the change in price of Product B.

original_glossary_extracted: Cross-sectional analysis  Analysis that involves comparisons across individuals in a group over a given time period or at a given point in time.
definition_or_explanation: Analysis that involves comparisons across individuals in a group over a given time period or at a given point in time.

original_glossary_extracted: Cross-sectional data  Observations over individual units at a point in time, as opposed to time-series data.
definition_or_explanation: Observations over individual units at a point in time, as opposed to time-series data.

original_glossary_extracted: Crossing networks  Trading systems that match buyers and sellers who are willing to trade at prices obtained from other markets.
definition_or_explanation: Trading systems that match buyers and sellers who are willing to trade at prices obtained from other markets.

original_glossary_extracted: Crowding out  The thesis that government borrowing may divert private sector investment from taking place.
definition_or_explanation: The thesis that government borrowing may divert private sector investment from taking place.

original_glossary_extracted: Cryptocurrency  An electronic medium of exchange that lacks physical form.
definition_or_explanation: An electronic medium of exchange that lacks physical form.

original_glossary_extracted: Cryptography  An algorithmic process to encrypt data, mak-ing the data unusable if received by unauthorized parties.
definition_or_explanation: An algorithmic process to encrypt data, mak-ing the data unusable if received by unauthorized parties.

original_glossary_extracted: Cumulative distribution function  A function giving the probability that a random variable is less than or equal to a specified value.
definition_or_explanation: A function giving the probability that a random variable is less than or equal to a specified value.

original_glossary_extracted: Cumulative preference shares  Preference shares for which any dividends that are not paid accrue and must be paid in full before dividends on common shares can be paid.
definition_or_explanation: Preference shares for which any dividends that are not paid accrue and must be paid in full before dividends on common shares can be paid.

original_glossary_extracted: Cumulative relative frequency  For data grouped into inter-vals, the fraction of total observations that are less than the value of the upper limit of a stated interval.
definition_or_explanation: For data grouped into inter-vals, the fraction of total observations that are less than the value of the upper limit of a stated interval.

original_glossary_extracted: Cumulative voting  A voting process whereby each shareholder can accumulate and vote all his or her shares for a single candidate in an election, as opposed to having to allocate their voting rights evenly among all candidates.
definition_or_explanation: A voting process whereby each shareholder can accumulate and vote all his or her shares for a single candidate in an election, as opposed to having to allocate their voting rights evenly among all candidates.

original_glossary_extracted: Currencies  Monies issued by national monetary authorities.
definition_or_explanation: Monies issued by national monetary authorities.

original_glossary_extracted: Currency option bonds  Bonds that give the bondholder the right to choose the currency in which he or she wants to receive interest payments and principal repayments.
definition_or_explanation: Bonds that give the bondholder the right to choose the currency in which he or she wants to receive interest payments and principal repayments.

original_glossary_extracted: Currency swap  A swap in which each party makes interest payments to the other in different currencies.
definition_or_explanation: A swap in which each party makes interest payments to the other in different currencies.

original_glossary_extracted: Current account  A component of the balance of payments account that measures the flow of goods and services.
definition_or_explanation: A component of the balance of payments account that measures the flow of goods and services.

original_glossary_extracted: Current assets  Assets that are expected to be consumed or converted into cash in the near future, typically one year or less. Also called liquid assets.
definition_or_explanation: Assets that are expected to be consumed or converted into cash in the near future, typically one year or less. Also called liquid assets.

original_glossary_extracted: Current cost  With reference to assets, the amount of cash or cash equivalents that would have to be paid to buy the same or an equivalent asset today; with reference to liabilities, the undiscounted amount of cash or cash equivalents that would be required to settle the obligation today.
definition_or_explanation: With reference to assets, the amount of cash or cash equivalents that would have to be paid to buy the same or an equivalent asset today; with reference to liabilities, the undiscounted amount of cash or cash equivalents that would be required to settle the obligation today.

original_glossary_extracted: Current government spending  With respect to government expenditures, spending on goods and services that are provided on a regular, recurring basis including health, education, and defense.
definition_or_explanation: With respect to government expenditures, spending on goods and services that are provided on a regular, recurring basis including health, education, and defense.

original_glossary_extracted: Current liabilities  Short-term obligations, such as accounts payable, wages payable, or accrued liabilities, that are expected to be settled in the near future, typically one year or less.
definition_or_explanation: Short-term obligations, such as accounts payable, wages payable, or accrued liabilities, that are expected to be settled in the near future, typically one year or less.

original_glossary_extracted: Current ratio  A liquidity ratio calculated as current assets divided by current liabilities.
definition_or_explanation: A liquidity ratio calculated as current assets divided by current liabilities.

original_glossary_extracted: Current yield  The sum of the coupon payments received over the year divided by the flat price; also called the income or interest yield or running yield.
definition_or_explanation: The sum of the coupon payments received over the year divided by the flat price; also called the income or interest yield or running yield.

original_glossary_extracted: Curve duration  The sensitivity of the bond price (or the market value of a financial asset or liability) with respect to a benchmark yield curve.
definition_or_explanation: The sensitivity of the bond price (or the market value of a financial asset or liability) with respect to a benchmark yield curve.

original_glossary_extracted: Customs union  Extends the free trade area (FTA) by not only allowing free movement of goods and services among members, but also creating a common trade policy against nonmembers.
definition_or_explanation: Extends the free trade area (FTA) by not only allowing free movement of goods and services among members, but also creating a common trade policy against nonmembers.

original_glossary_extracted: CVaR  Conditional VaR, a tail loss measure. The weighted average of all loss outcomes in the statistical distribution that exceed the VaR loss.
definition_or_explanation: Conditional VaR, a tail loss measure. The weighted average of all loss outcomes in the statistical distribution that exceed the VaR loss.

original_glossary_extracted: Cyclical  See cyclical companies.
definition_or_explanation: See cyclical companies.

original_glossary_extracted: Cyclical companies  Companies with sales and profits that regularly expand and contract with the business cycle or state of economy.
definition_or_explanation: Companies with sales and profits that regularly expand and contract with the business cycle or state of economy.

original_glossary_extracted: Daily settlement  See mark to market and marking to market.
definition_or_explanation: See mark to market and marking to market.

original_glossary_extracted: Dark pools  Alternative trading systems that do not display the orders that their clients send to them.
definition_or_explanation: Alternative trading systems that do not display the orders that their clients send to them.

original_glossary_extracted: Data mining  The practice of determining a model by extensive searching through a dataset for statistically significant patterns. Also called data snooping.
definition_or_explanation: The practice of determining a model by extensive searching through a dataset for statistically significant patterns. Also called data snooping.

original_glossary_extracted: Data science  An interdisciplinary field that brings computer science, statistics, and other disciplines together to analyze and produce insights from Big Data.
definition_or_explanation: An interdisciplinary field that brings computer science, statistics, and other disciplines together to analyze and produce insights from Big Data.

original_glossary_extracted: Data snooping  See data mining.
definition_or_explanation: See data mining.

original_glossary_extracted: Day order  An order that is good for the day on which it is submitted. If it has not been filled by the close of business, the order expires unfilled.
definition_or_explanation: An order that is good for the day on which it is submitted. If it has not been filled by the close of business, the order expires unfilled.

original_glossary_extracted: Day's sales outstanding  Estimate of the average number of days it takes to collect on credit accounts.
definition_or_explanation: Estimate of the average number of days it takes to collect on credit accounts.

original_glossary_extracted: Days in receivables  Estimate of the average number of days it takes to collect on credit accounts.
definition_or_explanation: Estimate of the average number of days it takes to collect on credit accounts.

original_glossary_extracted: Days of inventory on hand  An activity ratio equal to the number of days in the period divided by inventory turnover over the period.
definition_or_explanation: An activity ratio equal to the number of days in the period divided by inventory turnover over the period.

original_glossary_extracted: Dead cross  A technical analysis term that describes a situation where a short-term moving average crosses from above a longer-term moving average to below it; this movement is considered bearish.
definition_or_explanation: A technical analysis term that describes a situation where a short-term moving average crosses from above a longer-term moving average to below it; this movement is considered bearish.

original_glossary_extracted: Dealers  A financial intermediary that acts as a principal in trades.
definition_or_explanation: A financial intermediary that acts as a principal in trades.

original_glossary_extracted: Dealing securities  Securities held by banks or other financial intermediaries for trading purposes.
definition_or_explanation: Securities held by banks or other financial intermediaries for trading purposes.

original_glossary_extracted: Debentures  Type of bond that can be secured or unsecured.
definition_or_explanation: Type of bond that can be secured or unsecured.

original_glossary_extracted: Debt incurrence test  A financial covenant made in conjunc-tion with existing debt that restricts a company's ability to incur additional debt at the same seniority based on one or more financial tests or conditions.
definition_or_explanation: A financial covenant made in conjunc-tion with existing debt that restricts a company's ability to incur additional debt at the same seniority based on one or more financial tests or conditions.

original_glossary_extracted: Debt-rating approach  A method for estimating a company's before-tax cost of debt based upon the yield on comparably rated bonds for maturities that closely match that of the company's existing debt.
definition_or_explanation: A method for estimating a company's before-tax cost of debt based upon the yield on comparably rated bonds for maturities that closely match that of the company's existing debt.

original_glossary_extracted: Debt-to-assets ratio  A solvency ratio calculated as total debt divided by total assets.
definition_or_explanation: A solvency ratio calculated as total debt divided by total assets.

original_glossary_extracted: Debt-to-capital ratio  A solvency ratio calculated as total debt divided by total debt plus total shareholders' equity.
definition_or_explanation: A solvency ratio calculated as total debt divided by total debt plus total shareholders' equity.

original_glossary_extracted: Debt-to-equity ratio  A solvency ratio calculated as total debt divided by total shareholders' equity.
definition_or_explanation: A solvency ratio calculated as total debt divided by total shareholders' equity.

original_glossary_extracted: Declaration date  The day that the corporation issues a state-ment declaring a specific dividend.
definition_or_explanation: The day that the corporation issues a state-ment declaring a specific dividend.

original_glossary_extracted: Decreasing returns to scale  When a production process leads to increases in output that are proportionately smaller than the increase in inputs.
definition_or_explanation: When a production process leads to increases in output that are proportionately smaller than the increase in inputs.

original_glossary_extracted: Deductible temporary differences  Temporary differences that result in a reduction of or deduction from taxable income in a future period when the balance sheet item is recovered or settled.
definition_or_explanation: Temporary differences that result in a reduction of or deduction from taxable income in a future period when the balance sheet item is recovered or settled.

original_glossary_extracted: Deep learning  Machine learning using neural networks with many hidden layers.
definition_or_explanation: Machine learning using neural networks with many hidden layers.

original_glossary_extracted: Deep learning nets  Machine learning using neural networks with many hidden layers.
definition_or_explanation: Machine learning using neural networks with many hidden layers.

original_glossary_extracted: Default probability  The probability that a borrower defaults or fails to meet its obligation to make full and timely pay-ments of principal and interest, according to the terms of the debt security. Also called default risk.
definition_or_explanation: The probability that a borrower defaults or fails to meet its obligation to make full and timely pay-ments of principal and interest, according to the terms of the debt security. Also called default risk.

original_glossary_extracted: Default risk  The probability that a borrower defaults or fails to meet its obligation to make full and timely payments of principal and interest, according to the terms of the debt security. Also called default probability.
definition_or_explanation: The probability that a borrower defaults or fails to meet its obligation to make full and timely payments of principal and interest, according to the terms of the debt security. Also called default probability.

original_glossary_extracted: Default risk premium  An extra return that compensates investors for the possibility that the borrower will fail to make a promised payment at the contracted time and in the contracted amount.
definition_or_explanation: An extra return that compensates investors for the possibility that the borrower will fail to make a promised payment at the contracted time and in the contracted amount.

original_glossary_extracted: Defensive companies  Companies with sales and profits that have little sensitivity to the business cycle or state of the economy.
definition_or_explanation: Companies with sales and profits that have little sensitivity to the business cycle or state of the economy.

original_glossary_extracted: Defensive interval ratio  A liquidity ratio that estimates the number of days that an entity could meet cash needs from liquid assets; calculated as (cash + short-term mar-ketable investments + receivables) divided by daily cash expenditures.
definition_or_explanation: A liquidity ratio that estimates the number of days that an entity could meet cash needs from liquid assets; calculated as (cash + short-term mar-ketable investments + receivables) divided by daily cash expenditures.

original_glossary_extracted: Deferred coupon bond  Bond that pays no coupons for its first few years but then pays a higher coupon than it otherwise normally would for the remainder of its life. Also called split coupon bond.
definition_or_explanation: Bond that pays no coupons for its first few years but then pays a higher coupon than it otherwise normally would for the remainder of its life. Also called split coupon bond.

original_glossary_extracted: Deferred income  A liability account for money that has been collected for goods or services that have not yet been delivered; payment received in advance of providing a good or service.
definition_or_explanation: A liability account for money that has been collected for goods or services that have not yet been delivered; payment received in advance of providing a good or service.

original_glossary_extracted: Deferred revenue  A liability account for money that has been collected for goods or services that have not yet been delivered; payment received in advance of providing a good or service.
definition_or_explanation: A liability account for money that has been collected for goods or services that have not yet been delivered; payment received in advance of providing a good or service.

original_glossary_extracted: Deferred tax assets  A balance sheet asset that arises when an excess amount is paid for income taxes relative to account-ing profit. The taxable income is higher than accounting profit and income tax payable exceeds tax expense. The company expects to recover the difference during the course of future operations when tax expense exceeds income tax payable.
definition_or_explanation: A balance sheet asset that arises when an excess amount is paid for income taxes relative to account-ing profit. The taxable income is higher than accounting profit and income tax payable exceeds tax expense. The company expects to recover the difference during the course of future operations when tax expense exceeds income tax payable.

original_glossary_extracted: Deferred tax liabilities  A balance sheet liability that arises when a deficit amount is paid for income taxes relative to accounting profit. The taxable income is less than the accounting profit and income tax payable is less than tax expense. The company expects to eliminate the liability over the course of future operations when income tax payable exceeds tax expense.
definition_or_explanation: A balance sheet liability that arises when a deficit amount is paid for income taxes relative to accounting profit. The taxable income is less than the accounting profit and income tax payable is less than tax expense. The company expects to eliminate the liability over the course of future operations when income tax payable exceeds tax expense.

original_glossary_extracted: Defined benefit pension plans  Plans in which the company promises to pay a certain annual amount (defined benefit) to the employee after retirement. The company bears the investment risk of the plan assets.
definition_or_explanation: Plans in which the company promises to pay a certain annual amount (defined benefit) to the employee after retirement. The company bears the investment risk of the plan assets.

original_glossary_extracted: Defined contribution pension plans  Individual accounts to which an employee and typically the employer makes contributions, generally on a tax-advantaged basis. The amounts of contributions are defined at the outset, but the future value of the benefit is unknown. The employee bears the investment risk of the plan assets.
definition_or_explanation: Individual accounts to which an employee and typically the employer makes contributions, generally on a tax-advantaged basis. The amounts of contributions are defined at the outset, but the future value of the benefit is unknown. The employee bears the investment risk of the plan assets.

original_glossary_extracted: Deflation  Negative inflation.
definition_or_explanation: Negative inflation.

original_glossary_extracted: Degree of confidence  The probability that a confidence inter-val includes the unknown population parameter.
definition_or_explanation: The probability that a confidence inter-val includes the unknown population parameter.

original_glossary_extracted: Degree of financial leverage  (DFL) The ratio of the per-centage change in net income to the percentage change in operating income; the sensitivity of the cash flows available to owners when operating income changes.
definition_or_explanation: The ratio of the per-centage change in net income to the percentage change in operating income; the sensitivity of the cash flows available to owners when operating income changes.

original_glossary_extracted: Degree of operating leverage  (DOL) The ratio of the per-centage change in operating income to the percentage change in units sold; the sensitivity of operating income to changes in units sold.
definition_or_explanation: The ratio of the per-centage change in operating income to the percentage change in units sold; the sensitivity of operating income to changes in units sold.

original_glossary_extracted: Degree of total leverage  The ratio of the percentage change in net income to the percentage change in units sold; the sensitivity of the cash flows to owners to changes in the number of units produced and sold.
definition_or_explanation: The ratio of the percentage change in net income to the percentage change in units sold; the sensitivity of the cash flows to owners to changes in the number of units produced and sold.

original_glossary_extracted: Degrees of freedom (df)  The number of independent obser-vations used.
definition_or_explanation: The number of independent obser-vations used.

original_glossary_extracted: Delta  The sensitivity of the derivative price to a small change in the value of the underlying asset.
definition_or_explanation: The sensitivity of the derivative price to a small change in the value of the underlying asset.

original_glossary_extracted: Demand curve  Graph of the inverse demand function. A graph showing the demand relation, either the highest quantity willingly purchased at each price or the highest price willingly paid for each quantity.
definition_or_explanation: Graph of the inverse demand function. A graph showing the demand relation, either the highest quantity willingly purchased at each price or the highest price willingly paid for each quantity.

original_glossary_extracted: Demand function  A relationship that expresses the quantity demanded of a good or service as a function of own-price and possibly other variables.
definition_or_explanation: A relationship that expresses the quantity demanded of a good or service as a function of own-price and possibly other variables.

original_glossary_extracted: Demand-pull  Type of inflation in which increasing demand raises prices generally, which then are reflected in a busi-ness's costs as workers demand wage hikes to catch up with the rising cost of living.
definition_or_explanation: Type of inflation in which increasing demand raises prices generally, which then are reflected in a busi-ness's costs as workers demand wage hikes to catch up with the rising cost of living.

original_glossary_extracted: Demand shock  A typically unexpected disturbance to demand, such as an unexpected interruption in trade or transportation.
definition_or_explanation: A typically unexpected disturbance to demand, such as an unexpected interruption in trade or transportation.

original_glossary_extracted: Dependent  With reference to events, the property that the probability of one event occurring depends on (is related to) the occurrence of another event.
definition_or_explanation: With reference to events, the property that the probability of one event occurring depends on (is related to) the occurrence of another event.

original_glossary_extracted: Depository bank  A bank that raises funds from depositors and other investors and lends it to borrowers.
definition_or_explanation: A bank that raises funds from depositors and other investors and lends it to borrowers.

original_glossary_extracted: Depository institutions  Commercial banks, savings and loan banks, credit unions, and similar institutions that raise funds from depositors and other investors and lend it to borrowers.
definition_or_explanation: Commercial banks, savings and loan banks, credit unions, and similar institutions that raise funds from depositors and other investors and lend it to borrowers.

original_glossary_extracted: Depository receipt  A security that trades like an ordinary share on a local exchange and represents an economic interest in a foreign company.
definition_or_explanation: A security that trades like an ordinary share on a local exchange and represents an economic interest in a foreign company.

original_glossary_extracted: Depreciation  The process of systematically allocating the cost of long-lived (tangible) assets to the periods during which the assets are expected to provide economic benefits.
definition_or_explanation: The process of systematically allocating the cost of long-lived (tangible) assets to the periods during which the assets are expected to provide economic benefits.

original_glossary_extracted: Depression  See contraction.
definition_or_explanation: See contraction.

original_glossary_extracted: Derivative pricing rule  A pricing rule used by crossing net-works in which a price is taken (derived) from the price that is current in the asset's primary market.
definition_or_explanation: A pricing rule used by crossing net-works in which a price is taken (derived) from the price that is current in the asset's primary market.

original_glossary_extracted: Derivatives  A financial instrument whose value depends on the value of some underlying asset or factor (e.g., a stock price, an interest rate, or exchange rate).
definition_or_explanation: A financial instrument whose value depends on the value of some underlying asset or factor (e.g., a stock price, an interest rate, or exchange rate).

original_glossary_extracted: Descriptive statistics  The study of how data can be summa-rized effectively.
definition_or_explanation: The study of how data can be summa-rized effectively.

original_glossary_extracted: Development capital  Minority equity investments in more-mature companies that are seeking capital to expand or restructure operations, enter new markets, or finance major acquisitions.
definition_or_explanation: Minority equity investments in more-mature companies that are seeking capital to expand or restructure operations, enter new markets, or finance major acquisitions.

original_glossary_extracted: Diffuse prior  The assumption of equal prior probabilities.
definition_or_explanation: The assumption of equal prior probabilities.

original_glossary_extracted: Diffusion index  Reflects the proportion of the index's com-ponents that are moving in a pattern consistent with the overall index.
definition_or_explanation: Reflects the proportion of the index's com-ponents that are moving in a pattern consistent with the overall index.

original_glossary_extracted: Diluted EPS  The EPS that would result if all dilutive securities were converted into common shares.
definition_or_explanation: The EPS that would result if all dilutive securities were converted into common shares.

original_glossary_extracted: Diluted shares  The number of shares that would be outstand-ing if all potentially dilutive claims on common shares (e.g., convertible debt, convertible preferred stock, and employee stock options) were exercised.
definition_or_explanation: The number of shares that would be outstand-ing if all potentially dilutive claims on common shares (e.g., convertible debt, convertible preferred stock, and employee stock options) were exercised.

original_glossary_extracted: Diminishing balance method  An accelerated depreciation method, i.e., one that allocates a relatively large propor-tion of the cost of an asset to the early years of the asset's useful life.
definition_or_explanation: An accelerated depreciation method, i.e., one that allocates a relatively large propor-tion of the cost of an asset to the early years of the asset's useful life.

original_glossary_extracted: Diminishing marginal productivity  Describes a state in which each additional unit of input produces less output than previously.
definition_or_explanation: Describes a state in which each additional unit of input produces less output than previously.

original_glossary_extracted: Direct debit program  An arrangement whereby a customer authorizes a debit to a demand account; typically used by companies to collect routine payments for services.
definition_or_explanation: An arrangement whereby a customer authorizes a debit to a demand account; typically used by companies to collect routine payments for services.

original_glossary_extracted: Direct financing leases  A type of finance lease, from a lessor perspective, where the present value of the lease payments (lease receivable) equals the carrying value of the leased asset. The revenues earned by the lessor are financing in nature.
definition_or_explanation: A type of finance lease, from a lessor perspective, where the present value of the lease payments (lease receivable) equals the carrying value of the leased asset. The revenues earned by the lessor are financing in nature.

original_glossary_extracted: Direct format  With reference to the cash flow statement, a format for the presentation of the statement in which cash flow from operating activities is shown as operating cash receipts less operating cash disbursements. Also called direct method.
definition_or_explanation: With reference to the cash flow statement, a format for the presentation of the statement in which cash flow from operating activities is shown as operating cash receipts less operating cash disbursements. Also called direct method.

original_glossary_extracted: Direct method  See direct format.
definition_or_explanation: See direct format.

original_glossary_extracted: Direct taxes  Taxes levied directly on income, wealth, and corporate profits.
definition_or_explanation: Taxes levied directly on income, wealth, and corporate profits.

original_glossary_extracted: Direct write-off method  An approach to recognizing credit losses on customer receivables in which the company waits until such time as a customer has defaulted and only then recognizes the loss.
definition_or_explanation: An approach to recognizing credit losses on customer receivables in which the company waits until such time as a customer has defaulted and only then recognizes the loss.

original_glossary_extracted: Disbursement float  The amount of time between check issu-ance and a check's clearing back against the company's account.
definition_or_explanation: The amount of time between check issu-ance and a check's clearing back against the company's account.

original_glossary_extracted: Discount  To reduce the value of a future payment in allowance for how far away it is in time; to calculate the present value of some future amount. Also, the amount by which an instrument is priced below its face (par) value.
definition_or_explanation: To reduce the value of a future payment in allowance for how far away it is in time; to calculate the present value of some future amount. Also, the amount by which an instrument is priced below its face (par) value.

original_glossary_extracted: Discount interest  A procedure for determining the interest on a loan or bond in which the interest is deducted from the face value in advance.
definition_or_explanation: A procedure for determining the interest on a loan or bond in which the interest is deducted from the face value in advance.

original_glossary_extracted: Discount margin  See required margin.
definition_or_explanation: See required margin.

original_glossary_extracted: Discount rates  In general, the interest rate used to calculate a present value. In the money market, however, discount rate is a specific type of quoted rate.
definition_or_explanation: In general, the interest rate used to calculate a present value. In the money market, however, discount rate is a specific type of quoted rate.

original_glossary_extracted: Discounted cash flow models  Valuation models that estimate the intrinsic value of a security as the present value of the future benefits expected to be received from the security.
definition_or_explanation: Valuation models that estimate the intrinsic value of a security as the present value of the future benefits expected to be received from the security.

original_glossary_extracted: Discouraged worker  A person who has stopped looking for a job or has given up seeking employment.
definition_or_explanation: A person who has stopped looking for a job or has given up seeking employment.

original_glossary_extracted: Discrete random variable  A random variable that can take on at most a countable number of possible values.
definition_or_explanation: A random variable that can take on at most a countable number of possible values.

original_glossary_extracted: Discriminatory pricing rule  A pricing rule used in continuous markets in which the limit price of the order or quote that first arrived determines the trade price.
definition_or_explanation: A pricing rule used in continuous markets in which the limit price of the order or quote that first arrived determines the trade price.

original_glossary_extracted: Diseconomies of scale  Increase in cost per unit resulting from increased production.
definition_or_explanation: Increase in cost per unit resulting from increased production.

original_glossary_extracted: Dispersion  The variability around the central tendency.
definition_or_explanation: The variability around the central tendency.

original_glossary_extracted: Display size  The size of an order displayed to public view.
definition_or_explanation: The size of an order displayed to public view.

original_glossary_extracted: Distressed investing  Investing in securities of companies in financial difficulties. Private equity funds that specialize in distressed investing typically buy the debt of mature companies in financial difficulties.
definition_or_explanation: Investing in securities of companies in financial difficulties. Private equity funds that specialize in distressed investing typically buy the debt of mature companies in financial difficulties.

original_glossary_extracted: Distributed ledger  A type of database that may be shared among entities in a network.
definition_or_explanation: A type of database that may be shared among entities in a network.

original_glossary_extracted: Distributed ledger technology  Technology based on a dis-tributed ledger.
definition_or_explanation: Technology based on a dis-tributed ledger.

original_glossary_extracted: Divergence  In technical analysis, a term that describes the case when an indicator moves differently from the security being analyzed.
definition_or_explanation: In technical analysis, a term that describes the case when an indicator moves differently from the security being analyzed.

original_glossary_extracted: Diversification ratio  The ratio of the standard deviation of an equally weighted portfolio to the standard deviation of a randomly selected security.
definition_or_explanation: The ratio of the standard deviation of an equally weighted portfolio to the standard deviation of a randomly selected security.

original_glossary_extracted: Dividend  A distribution paid to shareholders based on the number of shares owned.
definition_or_explanation: A distribution paid to shareholders based on the number of shares owned.

original_glossary_extracted: Dividend discount model  (DDM) A present value model that estimates the intrinsic value of an equity share based on the present value of its expected future dividends.
definition_or_explanation: A present value model that estimates the intrinsic value of an equity share based on the present value of its expected future dividends.

original_glossary_extracted: Dividend discount model based approach  An approach for estimating a country's equity risk premium. The market rate of return is estimated as the sum of the dividend yield and the growth rate in dividends for a market index. Subtracting the risk-free rate of return from the estimated market return produces an estimate for the equity risk premium.
definition_or_explanation: An approach for estimating a country's equity risk premium. The market rate of return is estimated as the sum of the dividend yield and the growth rate in dividends for a market index. Subtracting the risk-free rate of return from the estimated market return produces an estimate for the equity risk premium.

original_glossary_extracted: Dividend payout ratio  The ratio of cash dividends paid to earnings for a period.
definition_or_explanation: The ratio of cash dividends paid to earnings for a period.

original_glossary_extracted: Divisor  A number (denominator) used to determine the value of a price return index. It is initially chosen at the incep-tion of an index and subsequently adjusted by the index provider, as necessary, to avoid changes in the index value that are unrelated to changes in the prices of its constit-uent securities.
definition_or_explanation: A number (denominator) used to determine the value of a price return index. It is initially chosen at the incep-tion of an index and subsequently adjusted by the index provider, as necessary, to avoid changes in the index value that are unrelated to changes in the prices of its constit-uent securities.

original_glossary_extracted: Domestic content provisions  Stipulate that some percentage of the value added or components used in production should be of domestic origin.
definition_or_explanation: Stipulate that some percentage of the value added or components used in production should be of domestic origin.

original_glossary_extracted: Double bottoms  In technical analysis, a reversal pattern that is formed when the price reaches a low, rebounds, and then sells off back to the first low level; used to predict a change from a downtrend to an uptrend.
definition_or_explanation: In technical analysis, a reversal pattern that is formed when the price reaches a low, rebounds, and then sells off back to the first low level; used to predict a change from a downtrend to an uptrend.

original_glossary_extracted: Double coincidence of wants  A prerequisite to barter trades, in particular that both economic agents in the transaction want what the other is selling.
definition_or_explanation: A prerequisite to barter trades, in particular that both economic agents in the transaction want what the other is selling.

original_glossary_extracted: Double declining balance depreciation  An accelerated depreciation method that involves depreciating the asset at double the straight-line rate. This rate is multiplied by the book value of the asset at the beginning of the period (a declining balance) to calculate depreciation expense.
definition_or_explanation: An accelerated depreciation method that involves depreciating the asset at double the straight-line rate. This rate is multiplied by the book value of the asset at the beginning of the period (a declining balance) to calculate depreciation expense.

original_glossary_extracted: Double top  In technical analysis, a reversal pattern that is formed when an uptrend reverses twice at roughly the same high price level; used to predict a change from an uptrend to a downtrend.
definition_or_explanation: In technical analysis, a reversal pattern that is formed when an uptrend reverses twice at roughly the same high price level; used to predict a change from an uptrend to a downtrend.

original_glossary_extracted: Down transition probability  The probability that an asset's value moves down in a model of asset price dynamics.
definition_or_explanation: The probability that an asset's value moves down in a model of asset price dynamics.

original_glossary_extracted: Downgrade risk  The risk that a bond issuer's creditworthiness deteriorates, or migrates lower, leading investors to believe the risk of default is higher. Also called credit migration risk.
definition_or_explanation: The risk that a bond issuer's creditworthiness deteriorates, or migrates lower, leading investors to believe the risk of default is higher. Also called credit migration risk.

original_glossary_extracted: Drag on liquidity  When receipts lag, creating pressure from the decreased available funds.
definition_or_explanation: When receipts lag, creating pressure from the decreased available funds.

original_glossary_extracted: Drawdown  A percentage peak-to-trough reduction in net asset value.
definition_or_explanation: A percentage peak-to-trough reduction in net asset value.

original_glossary_extracted: Dual-currency bonds  Bonds that make coupon payments in one currency and pay the par value at maturity in another currency.
definition_or_explanation: Bonds that make coupon payments in one currency and pay the par value at maturity in another currency.

original_glossary_extracted: DuPont analysis  An approach to decomposing return on investment, e.g., return on equity, as the product of other financial ratios.
definition_or_explanation: An approach to decomposing return on investment, e.g., return on equity, as the product of other financial ratios.

original_glossary_extracted: Duration  A measure of the approximate sensitivity of a secu-rity to a change in interest rates (i.e., a measure of interest rate risk).
definition_or_explanation: A measure of the approximate sensitivity of a secu-rity to a change in interest rates (i.e., a measure of interest rate risk).

original_glossary_extracted: Duration gap  A bond's Macaulay duration minus the invest-ment horizon.
definition_or_explanation: A bond's Macaulay duration minus the invest-ment horizon.

original_glossary_extracted: Dutch Book theorem  A result in probability theory stating that inconsistent probabilities create profit opportunities.
definition_or_explanation: A result in probability theory stating that inconsistent probabilities create profit opportunities.

original_glossary_extracted: Early repayment option  See prepayment option.
definition_or_explanation: See prepayment option.

original_glossary_extracted: Earnings per share  The amount of income earned during a period per share of common stock.
definition_or_explanation: The amount of income earned during a period per share of common stock.

original_glossary_extracted: Earnings surprise  The portion of a company's earnings that is unanticipated by investors and, according to the efficient market hypothesis, merits a price adjustment.
definition_or_explanation: The portion of a company's earnings that is unanticipated by investors and, according to the efficient market hypothesis, merits a price adjustment.

original_glossary_extracted: Economic costs  All the remuneration needed to keep a pro-ductive resource in its current employment or to acquire the resource for productive use; the sum of total accounting costs and implicit opportunity costs.
definition_or_explanation: All the remuneration needed to keep a pro-ductive resource in its current employment or to acquire the resource for productive use; the sum of total accounting costs and implicit opportunity costs.

original_glossary_extracted: Economic indicator  A variable that provides information on the state of the overall economy.
definition_or_explanation: A variable that provides information on the state of the overall economy.

original_glossary_extracted: Economic loss  The amount by which accounting profit is less than normal profit.
definition_or_explanation: The amount by which accounting profit is less than normal profit.

original_glossary_extracted: Economic order quantity-reorder point (EOQ-ROP)  An approach to managing inventory based on expected demand and the predictability of demand; the ordering point for new inventory is determined based on the costs of ordering and carrying inventory, such that the total cost associated with inventory is minimized.
definition_or_explanation: An approach to managing inventory based on expected demand and the predictability of demand; the ordering point for new inventory is determined based on the costs of ordering and carrying inventory, such that the total cost associated with inventory is minimized.

original_glossary_extracted: Economic profit  Equal to accounting profit less the implicit opportunity costs not included in total accounting costs; the difference between total revenue (TR) and total cost (TC). Also called abnormal profit or supernormal profit.
definition_or_explanation: Equal to accounting profit less the implicit opportunity costs not included in total accounting costs; the difference between total revenue (TR) and total cost (TC). Also called abnormal profit or supernormal profit.

original_glossary_extracted: Economic stabilization  Reduction of the magnitude of eco-nomic fluctuations.
definition_or_explanation: Reduction of the magnitude of eco-nomic fluctuations.

original_glossary_extracted: Economic union  Incorporates all aspects of a common market and in addition requires common economic institutions and coordination of economic policies among members.
definition_or_explanation: Incorporates all aspects of a common market and in addition requires common economic institutions and coordination of economic policies among members.

original_glossary_extracted: Economies of scale  Reduction in cost per unit resulting from increased production.
definition_or_explanation: Reduction in cost per unit resulting from increased production.

original_glossary_extracted: Effective annual rate  The amount by which a unit of currency will grow in a year with interest on interest included.
definition_or_explanation: The amount by which a unit of currency will grow in a year with interest on interest included.

original_glossary_extracted: Effective annual yield (EAY)  An annualized return that accounts for the effect of interest on interest; EAY is com-puted by compounding 1 plus the holding period yield forward to one year, then subtracting 1.
definition_or_explanation: An annualized return that accounts for the effect of interest on interest; EAY is com-puted by compounding 1 plus the holding period yield forward to one year, then subtracting 1.

original_glossary_extracted: Effective convexity  A curve convexity statistic that measures the secondary effect of a change in a benchmark yield curve on a bond's price.
definition_or_explanation: A curve convexity statistic that measures the secondary effect of a change in a benchmark yield curve on a bond's price.

original_glossary_extracted: Effective duration  The sensitivity of a bond's price to a change in a benchmark yield curve.
definition_or_explanation: The sensitivity of a bond's price to a change in a benchmark yield curve.

original_glossary_extracted: Effective interest rate  The borrowing rate or market rate that a company incurs at the time of issuance of a bond.
definition_or_explanation: The borrowing rate or market rate that a company incurs at the time of issuance of a bond.

original_glossary_extracted: Efficient market  A market in which asset prices reflect new information quickly and rationally.
definition_or_explanation: A market in which asset prices reflect new information quickly and rationally.

original_glossary_extracted: Elastic  Said of a good or service when the magnitude of elas-ticity is greater than one.
definition_or_explanation: Said of a good or service when the magnitude of elas-ticity is greater than one.

original_glossary_extracted: Elasticity  The percentage change in one variable for a per-centage change in another variable; a general measure of how sensitive one variable is to a change in the value of another variable.
definition_or_explanation: The percentage change in one variable for a per-centage change in another variable; a general measure of how sensitive one variable is to a change in the value of another variable.

original_glossary_extracted: Elasticity of demand  A measure of the sensitivity of quan-tity demanded to a change in a product's own price: %∆QD/%∆P.
definition_or_explanation: A measure of the sensitivity of quan-tity demanded to a change in a product's own price: %∆QD/%∆P.

original_glossary_extracted: Elasticity of supply  A measure of the sensitivity of quantity supplied to a change in price: %∆QS/%∆P.
definition_or_explanation: A measure of the sensitivity of quantity supplied to a change in price: %∆QS/%∆P.

original_glossary_extracted: Electronic communications networks  See alternative trading systems.
definition_or_explanation: See alternative trading systems.

original_glossary_extracted: Electronic funds transfer (EFT)  The use of computer networks to conduct financial transactions electronically.
definition_or_explanation: The use of computer networks to conduct financial transactions electronically.

original_glossary_extracted: Elliott wave theory  A technical analysis theory that claims that the market follows regular, repeated waves or cycles.
definition_or_explanation: A technical analysis theory that claims that the market follows regular, repeated waves or cycles.

original_glossary_extracted: Embedded option  Contingency provisions that provide the issuer or the bondholders the right, but not the obligation, to take action. These options are not part of the security and cannot be traded separately.
definition_or_explanation: Contingency provisions that provide the issuer or the bondholders the right, but not the obligation, to take action. These options are not part of the security and cannot be traded separately.

original_glossary_extracted: Empirical probability  The probability of an event estimated as a relative frequency of occurrence.
definition_or_explanation: The probability of an event estimated as a relative frequency of occurrence.

original_glossary_extracted: Employed  The number of people with a job.
definition_or_explanation: The number of people with a job.

original_glossary_extracted: Enterprise risk management  An overall assessment of a company's risk position. A centralized approach to risk management sometimes called firmwide risk management.
definition_or_explanation: An overall assessment of a company's risk position. A centralized approach to risk management sometimes called firmwide risk management.

original_glossary_extracted: Enterprise value  A measure of a company's total market value from which the value of cash and short-term investments have been subtracted.
definition_or_explanation: A measure of a company's total market value from which the value of cash and short-term investments have been subtracted.

original_glossary_extracted: Equal weighting  An index weighting method in which an equal weight is assigned to each constituent security at inception.
definition_or_explanation: An index weighting method in which an equal weight is assigned to each constituent security at inception.

original_glossary_extracted: Equipment trust certificates  Bonds secured by specific types of equipment or physical assets.
definition_or_explanation: Bonds secured by specific types of equipment or physical assets.

original_glossary_extracted: Equity  Assets less liabilities; the residual interest in the assets after subtracting the liabilities.
definition_or_explanation: Assets less liabilities; the residual interest in the assets after subtracting the liabilities.

original_glossary_extracted: Equity risk premium  The expected return on equities minus the risk-free rate; the premium that investors demand for investing in equities.
definition_or_explanation: The expected return on equities minus the risk-free rate; the premium that investors demand for investing in equities.

original_glossary_extracted: Equity swap  A swap transaction in which at least one cash flow is tied to the return to an equity portfolio position, often an equity index.
definition_or_explanation: A swap transaction in which at least one cash flow is tied to the return to an equity portfolio position, often an equity index.

original_glossary_extracted: ESG  An acronym that encompasses environmental, social and governance.
definition_or_explanation: An acronym that encompasses environmental, social and governance.

original_glossary_extracted: ESG incorporation  The integration of qualitative and quanti-tative environmental, social, and governance factors into traditional security and industry analysis; also known as ESG integration.
definition_or_explanation: The integration of qualitative and quanti-tative environmental, social, and governance factors into traditional security and industry analysis; also known as ESG integration.

original_glossary_extracted: ESG integration  The integration of qualitative and quanti-tative environmental, social, and governance factors into traditional security and industry analysis; also known as ESG incorporation.
definition_or_explanation: The integration of qualitative and quanti-tative environmental, social, and governance factors into traditional security and industry analysis; also known as ESG incorporation.

original_glossary_extracted: ESG investing  The consideration of environmental, social, and governance factors in the investment process.
definition_or_explanation: The consideration of environmental, social, and governance factors in the investment process.

original_glossary_extracted: Estimate  The particular value calculated from sample obser-vations using an estimator.
definition_or_explanation: The particular value calculated from sample obser-vations using an estimator.

original_glossary_extracted: Estimation  With reference to statistical inference, the sub-division dealing with estimating the value of a population parameter.
definition_or_explanation: With reference to statistical inference, the sub-division dealing with estimating the value of a population parameter.

original_glossary_extracted: Estimator  An estimation formula; the formula used to com-pute the sample mean and other sample statistics are examples of estimators.
definition_or_explanation: An estimation formula; the formula used to com-pute the sample mean and other sample statistics are examples of estimators.

original_glossary_extracted: Ethical principles  Beliefs regarding what is good, acceptable, or obligatory behavior and what is bad, unacceptable, or forbidden behavior.
definition_or_explanation: Beliefs regarding what is good, acceptable, or obligatory behavior and what is bad, unacceptable, or forbidden behavior.

original_glossary_extracted: Ethics  The study of moral principles or of making good choices. Ethics encompasses a set of moral principles and rules of conduct that provide guidance for our behavior.
definition_or_explanation: The study of moral principles or of making good choices. Ethics encompasses a set of moral principles and rules of conduct that provide guidance for our behavior.

original_glossary_extracted: Eurobonds  Type of bond issued internationally, outside the jurisdiction of the country in whose currency the bond is denominated.
definition_or_explanation: Type of bond issued internationally, outside the jurisdiction of the country in whose currency the bond is denominated.

original_glossary_extracted: European option  An option that can only be exercised on its expiration date.
definition_or_explanation: An option that can only be exercised on its expiration date.

original_glossary_extracted: European-style  Said of an option contract that can only be exercised on the option's expiration date.
definition_or_explanation: Said of an option contract that can only be exercised on the option's expiration date.

original_glossary_extracted: Event  Any outcome or specified set of outcomes of a random variable.
definition_or_explanation: Any outcome or specified set of outcomes of a random variable.

original_glossary_extracted: Ex-dividend date  The first date that a share trades without (i.e., "ex") the dividend.
definition_or_explanation: The first date that a share trades without (i.e., "ex") the dividend.

original_glossary_extracted: Excess kurtosis  Degree of kurtosis (fatness of tails) in excess of the kurtosis of the normal distribution.
definition_or_explanation: Degree of kurtosis (fatness of tails) in excess of the kurtosis of the normal distribution.

original_glossary_extracted: Exchanges  Places where traders can meet to arrange their trades.
definition_or_explanation: Places where traders can meet to arrange their trades.

original_glossary_extracted: Exclusionary screening  An ESG implementation approach that excludes certain sectors or companies that deviate from an investor's accepted standards. Also called negative screening or norms-based screening.
definition_or_explanation: An ESG implementation approach that excludes certain sectors or companies that deviate from an investor's accepted standards. Also called negative screening or norms-based screening.

original_glossary_extracted: Execution instructions  Instructions that indicate how to fill an order.
definition_or_explanation: Instructions that indicate how to fill an order.

original_glossary_extracted: Exercise  The process of using an option to buy or sell the underlying.
definition_or_explanation: The process of using an option to buy or sell the underlying.

original_glossary_extracted: Exercise price  The fixed price at which an option holder can buy or sell the underlying. Also called strike price, striking price, or strike.
definition_or_explanation: The fixed price at which an option holder can buy or sell the underlying. Also called strike price, striking price, or strike.

original_glossary_extracted: Exercise value  The value obtained if an option is exercised based on current conditions. Also known as intrinsic value.
definition_or_explanation: The value obtained if an option is exercised based on current conditions. Also known as intrinsic value.

original_glossary_extracted: Exhaustive  Covering or containing all possible outcomes.
definition_or_explanation: Covering or containing all possible outcomes.

original_glossary_extracted: Expansion  The period of a business cycle after its lowest point and before its highest point.
definition_or_explanation: The period of a business cycle after its lowest point and before its highest point.

original_glossary_extracted: Expansionary  Tending to cause the real economy to grow.
definition_or_explanation: Tending to cause the real economy to grow.

original_glossary_extracted: Expansionary fiscal policy  Fiscal policy aimed at achieving real economic growth.
definition_or_explanation: Fiscal policy aimed at achieving real economic growth.

original_glossary_extracted: Expected inflation  The level of inflation that economic agents expect in the future.
definition_or_explanation: The level of inflation that economic agents expect in the future.

original_glossary_extracted: Expected loss  Default probability times Loss severity given default.
definition_or_explanation: Default probability times Loss severity given default.

original_glossary_extracted: Expected value  The probability-weighted average of the pos-sible outcomes of a random variable.
definition_or_explanation: The probability-weighted average of the pos-sible outcomes of a random variable.
