original_glossary_extracted: Expenses  Outflows of economic resources or increases in liabilities that result in decreases in equity (other than decreases because of distributions to owners); reductions in net assets associated with the creation of revenues.
definition_or_explanation: Outflows of economic resources or increases in liabilities that result in decreases in equity (other than decreases because of distributions to owners); reductions in net assets associated with the creation of revenues.

original_glossary_extracted: Experience curve  A curve that shows the direct cost per unit of good or service produced or delivered as a typically declining function of cumulative output.
definition_or_explanation: A curve that shows the direct cost per unit of good or service produced or delivered as a typically declining function of cumulative output.

original_glossary_extracted: Export subsidy  Paid by the government to the firm when it exports a unit of a good that is being subsidized.
definition_or_explanation: Paid by the government to the firm when it exports a unit of a good that is being subsidized.

original_glossary_extracted: Exports  Goods and services that an economy sells to other countries.
definition_or_explanation: Goods and services that an economy sells to other countries.

original_glossary_extracted: Extension risk  The risk that when interest rates rise, fewer prepayments will occur because homeowners are reluctant to give up the benefits of a contractual interest rate that now looks low. As a result, the security becomes longer in maturity than anticipated at the time of purchase.
definition_or_explanation: The risk that when interest rates rise, fewer prepayments will occur because homeowners are reluctant to give up the benefits of a contractual interest rate that now looks low. As a result, the security becomes longer in maturity than anticipated at the time of purchase.

original_glossary_extracted: Externality  An effect of a market transaction that is borne by parties other than those who transacted.
definition_or_explanation: An effect of a market transaction that is borne by parties other than those who transacted.

original_glossary_extracted: Extra dividend  A dividend paid by a company that does not pay dividends on a regular schedule, or a dividend that supplements regular cash dividends with an extra payment.
definition_or_explanation: A dividend paid by a company that does not pay dividends on a regular schedule, or a dividend that supplements regular cash dividends with an extra payment.

original_glossary_extracted: Extreme value theory  A branch of statistics that focuses primarily on extreme outcomes.
definition_or_explanation: A branch of statistics that focuses primarily on extreme outcomes.

original_glossary_extracted: Face value  The amount of cash payable by a company to the bondholders when the bonds mature; the promised payment at maturity separate from any coupon payment.
definition_or_explanation: The amount of cash payable by a company to the bondholders when the bonds mature; the promised payment at maturity separate from any coupon payment.

original_glossary_extracted: Factor  A common or underlying element with which several variables are correlated.
definition_or_explanation: A common or underlying element with which several variables are correlated.

original_glossary_extracted: Fair value  The amount at which an asset could be exchanged, or a liability settled, between knowledgeable, willing parties in an arm's-length transaction; the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants.
definition_or_explanation: The amount at which an asset could be exchanged, or a liability settled, between knowledgeable, willing parties in an arm's-length transaction; the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants.

original_glossary_extracted: Fed funds rate  The US interbank lending rate on overnight borrowings of reserves.
definition_or_explanation: The US interbank lending rate on overnight borrowings of reserves.

original_glossary_extracted: Federal funds rate  The US interbank lending rate on overnight borrowings of reserves.
definition_or_explanation: The US interbank lending rate on overnight borrowings of reserves.

original_glossary_extracted: Fiat money  Money that is not convertible into any other commodity.
definition_or_explanation: Money that is not convertible into any other commodity.

original_glossary_extracted: Fibonacci sequence  A sequence of numbers starting with 0 and 1, and then each subsequent number in the sequence is the sum of the two preceding numbers. In Elliott Wave Theory, it is believed that market waves follow patterns that are the ratios of the numbers in the Fibonacci sequence.
definition_or_explanation: A sequence of numbers starting with 0 and 1, and then each subsequent number in the sequence is the sum of the two preceding numbers. In Elliott Wave Theory, it is believed that market waves follow patterns that are the ratios of the numbers in the Fibonacci sequence.

original_glossary_extracted: Fiduciary call  A combination of a European call and a risk-free bond that matures on the option expiration day and has a face value equal to the exercise price of the call.
definition_or_explanation: A combination of a European call and a risk-free bond that matures on the option expiration day and has a face value equal to the exercise price of the call.

original_glossary_extracted: FIFO method  The first in, first out, method of accounting for inventory, which matches sales against the costs of items of inventory in the order in which they were placed in inventory.
definition_or_explanation: The first in, first out, method of accounting for inventory, which matches sales against the costs of items of inventory in the order in which they were placed in inventory.

original_glossary_extracted: Fill or kill  See immediate or cancel order.
definition_or_explanation: See immediate or cancel order.

original_glossary_extracted: Finance lease  Essentially, the purchase of some asset by the buyer (lessee) that is directly financed by the seller (lessor). Also called capital lease.
definition_or_explanation: Essentially, the purchase of some asset by the buyer (lessee) that is directly financed by the seller (lessor). Also called capital lease.

original_glossary_extracted: Financial account  A component of the balance of payments account that records investment flows.
definition_or_explanation: A component of the balance of payments account that records investment flows.

original_glossary_extracted: Financial flexibility  The ability to react and adapt to financial adversities and opportunities.
definition_or_explanation: The ability to react and adapt to financial adversities and opportunities.

original_glossary_extracted: Financial leverage  The extent to which a company can effect, through the use of debt, a proportional change in the return on common equity that is greater than a given proportional change in operating income; also, short for the financial leverage ratio.
definition_or_explanation: The extent to which a company can effect, through the use of debt, a proportional change in the return on common equity that is greater than a given proportional change in operating income; also, short for the financial leverage ratio.

original_glossary_extracted: Financial leverage ratio  A measure of financial leverage calcu-lated as average total assets divided by average total equity.
definition_or_explanation: A measure of financial leverage calcu-lated as average total assets divided by average total equity.

original_glossary_extracted: Financial risk  The risk that environmental, social, or gover-nance risk factors will result in significant costs or other losses to a company and its shareholders; the risk arising from a company's obligation to meet required payments under its financing agreements.
definition_or_explanation: The risk that environmental, social, or gover-nance risk factors will result in significant costs or other losses to a company and its shareholders; the risk arising from a company's obligation to meet required payments under its financing agreements.

original_glossary_extracted: Financing activities  Activities related to obtaining or repaying capital to be used in the business (e.g., equity and long-term debt).
definition_or_explanation: Activities related to obtaining or repaying capital to be used in the business (e.g., equity and long-term debt).

original_glossary_extracted: Fintech  Technological innovation in the design and delivery of financial services and products in the financial industry.
definition_or_explanation: Technological innovation in the design and delivery of financial services and products in the financial industry.

original_glossary_extracted: Firm commitment offering  See underwritten offering.
definition_or_explanation: See underwritten offering.

original_glossary_extracted: First-degree price discrimination  Where a monopolist is able to charge each customer the highest price the customer is willing to pay.
definition_or_explanation: Where a monopolist is able to charge each customer the highest price the customer is willing to pay.

original_glossary_extracted: First lien debt  Debt secured by a pledge of certain assets that could include buildings, but may also include property and equipment, licenses, patents, brands, etc.
definition_or_explanation: Debt secured by a pledge of certain assets that could include buildings, but may also include property and equipment, licenses, patents, brands, etc.

original_glossary_extracted: First mortgage debt  Debt secured by a pledge of a specific property.
definition_or_explanation: Debt secured by a pledge of a specific property.

original_glossary_extracted: Fiscal multiplier  The ratio of a change in national income to a change in government spending.
definition_or_explanation: The ratio of a change in national income to a change in government spending.

original_glossary_extracted: Fiscal policy  The use of taxes and government spending to affect the level of aggregate expenditures.
definition_or_explanation: The use of taxes and government spending to affect the level of aggregate expenditures.

original_glossary_extracted: Fisher effect  The thesis that the real rate of interest in an economy is stable over time so that changes in nominal interest rates are the result of changes in expected inflation.
definition_or_explanation: The thesis that the real rate of interest in an economy is stable over time so that changes in nominal interest rates are the result of changes in expected inflation.

original_glossary_extracted: Fisher index  The geometric mean of the Laspeyres index.
definition_or_explanation: The geometric mean of the Laspeyres index.

original_glossary_extracted: Fixed charge coverage  A solvency ratio measuring the num-ber of times interest and lease payments are covered by operating income, calculated as (EBIT + lease payments) divided by (interest payments + lease payments).
definition_or_explanation: A solvency ratio measuring the num-ber of times interest and lease payments are covered by operating income, calculated as (EBIT + lease payments) divided by (interest payments + lease payments).

original_glossary_extracted: Fixed costs  Costs that remain at the same level regardless of a company's level of production and sales.
definition_or_explanation: Costs that remain at the same level regardless of a company's level of production and sales.

original_glossary_extracted: Fixed-for-floating interest rate swap  An interest rate swap in which one party pays a fixed rate and the other pays a floating rate, with both sets of payments in the same currency. Also called plain vanilla swap or vanilla swap.
key_phrase: Fixed for floating interest rate swap
definition_or_explanation: An interest rate swap in which one party pays a fixed rate and the other pays a floating rate, with both sets of payments in the same currency. Also called plain vanilla swap or vanilla swap.

original_glossary_extracted: Fixed rate perpetual preferred stock  Nonconvertible, non-callable preferred stock that has a fixed dividend rate and no maturity date.
definition_or_explanation: Nonconvertible, non-callable preferred stock that has a fixed dividend rate and no maturity date.

original_glossary_extracted: Flags  A technical analysis continuation pattern formed by parallel trendlines, typically over a short period.
definition_or_explanation: A technical analysis continuation pattern formed by parallel trendlines, typically over a short period.

original_glossary_extracted: Flat price  The full price of a bond minus the accrued interest; also called the quoted or clean price.
definition_or_explanation: The full price of a bond minus the accrued interest; also called the quoted or clean price.

original_glossary_extracted: Float  In the context of customer receipts, the amount of money that is in transit between payments made by customers and the funds that are usable by the company.
definition_or_explanation: In the context of customer receipts, the amount of money that is in transit between payments made by customers and the funds that are usable by the company.

original_glossary_extracted: Float-adjusted market-capitalization weighting  An index weighting method in which the weight assigned to each constituent security is determined by adjusting its market capitalization for its market float.
definition_or_explanation: An index weighting method in which the weight assigned to each constituent security is determined by adjusting its market capitalization for its market float.

original_glossary_extracted: Float factor  An estimate of the average number of days it takes deposited checks to clear; average daily float divided by average daily deposit.
definition_or_explanation: An estimate of the average number of days it takes deposited checks to clear; average daily float divided by average daily deposit.

original_glossary_extracted: Floaters  See floating-rate notes.
definition_or_explanation: See floating-rate notes.

original_glossary_extracted: Floating-rate notes  A note on which interest payments are not fixed, but instead vary from period to period depending on the current level of a reference interest rate.
definition_or_explanation: A note on which interest payments are not fixed, but instead vary from period to period depending on the current level of a reference interest rate.

original_glossary_extracted: Flotation cost  Fees charged to companies by investment bankers and other costs associated with raising new capital.
definition_or_explanation: Fees charged to companies by investment bankers and other costs associated with raising new capital.

original_glossary_extracted: Foreclosure  Allows the lender to take possession of a mort-gaged property if the borrower defaults and then sell it to recover funds.
definition_or_explanation: Allows the lender to take possession of a mort-gaged property if the borrower defaults and then sell it to recover funds.

original_glossary_extracted: Foreign currency reserves  Holding by the central bank of non-domestic currency deposits and non-domestic bonds.
definition_or_explanation: Holding by the central bank of non-domestic currency deposits and non-domestic bonds.

original_glossary_extracted: Foreign direct investment  Direct investment by a firm in one country (the source country) in productive assets in a foreign country (the host country).
definition_or_explanation: Direct investment by a firm in one country (the source country) in productive assets in a foreign country (the host country).

original_glossary_extracted: Foreign exchange gains (or losses)  Gains (or losses) that occur when the exchange rate changes between the inves-tor's currency and the currency that foreign securities are denominated in.
definition_or_explanation: Gains (or losses) that occur when the exchange rate changes between the inves-tor's currency and the currency that foreign securities are denominated in.

original_glossary_extracted: Foreign portfolio investment  Shorter-term investment by individuals, firms, and institutional investors (e.g., pension funds) in foreign financial instruments such as foreign stocks and foreign government bonds.
definition_or_explanation: Shorter-term investment by individuals, firms, and institutional investors (e.g., pension funds) in foreign financial instruments such as foreign stocks and foreign government bonds.

original_glossary_extracted: Forward commitments  Class of derivatives that provides the ability to lock in a price to transact in the future at a previously agreed-upon price.
definition_or_explanation: Class of derivatives that provides the ability to lock in a price to transact in the future at a previously agreed-upon price.

original_glossary_extracted: Forward contract  An agreement between two parties in which one party, the buyer, agrees to buy from the other party, the seller, an underlying asset at a later date for a price established at the start of the contract.
definition_or_explanation: An agreement between two parties in which one party, the buyer, agrees to buy from the other party, the seller, an underlying asset at a later date for a price established at the start of the contract.

original_glossary_extracted: Forward curve  A series of forward rates, each having the same timeframe.
definition_or_explanation: A series of forward rates, each having the same timeframe.

original_glossary_extracted: Forward market  For future delivery, beyond the usual settle-ment time period in the cash market.
definition_or_explanation: For future delivery, beyond the usual settle-ment time period in the cash market.

original_glossary_extracted: Forward price  The fixed price or rate at which the transaction scheduled to occur at the expiration of a forward contract will take place. This price is agreed on at the initiation date of the contract.
definition_or_explanation: The fixed price or rate at which the transaction scheduled to occur at the expiration of a forward contract will take place. This price is agreed on at the initiation date of the contract.

original_glossary_extracted: Forward rate  The interest rate on a bond or money market instrument traded in a forward market. A forward rate can be interpreted as an incremental, or marginal, return for extending the time-to-maturity for an additional time period.
definition_or_explanation: The interest rate on a bond or money market instrument traded in a forward market. A forward rate can be interpreted as an incremental, or marginal, return for extending the time-to-maturity for an additional time period.

original_glossary_extracted: Forward rate agreements  A forward contract calling for one party to make a fixed interest payment and the other to make an interest payment at a rate to be determined at the contract expiration.
definition_or_explanation: A forward contract calling for one party to make a fixed interest payment and the other to make an interest payment at a rate to be determined at the contract expiration.

original_glossary_extracted: Fractile  A value at or below which a stated fraction of the data lies.
definition_or_explanation: A value at or below which a stated fraction of the data lies.

original_glossary_extracted: Fractional reserve banking  Banking in which reserves con-stitute a fraction of deposits.
definition_or_explanation: Banking in which reserves con-stitute a fraction of deposits.

original_glossary_extracted: Free cash flow  The actual cash that would be available to the company's investors after making all investments necessary to maintain the company as an ongoing enterprise (also referred to as free cash flow to the firm); the internally generated funds that can be distributed to the company's investors (e.g., shareholders and bondholders) without impairing the value of the company.
definition_or_explanation: The actual cash that would be available to the company's investors after making all investments necessary to maintain the company as an ongoing enterprise (also referred to as free cash flow to the firm); the internally generated funds that can be distributed to the company's investors (e.g., shareholders and bondholders) without impairing the value of the company.

original_glossary_extracted: Free cash flow to equity (FCFE)  The cash flow available to a company's common shareholders after all operating expenses, interest, and principal payments have been made, and necessary investments in working and fixed capital have been made.
definition_or_explanation: The cash flow available to a company's common shareholders after all operating expenses, interest, and principal payments have been made, and necessary investments in working and fixed capital have been made.

original_glossary_extracted: Free-cash-flow-to-equity models  Valuation models based on discounting expected future free cash flow to equity.
key_phrase: Free cash flow to equity models
definition_or_explanation: Valuation models based on discounting expected future free cash flow to equity.

original_glossary_extracted: Free cash flow to the firm (FCFF)  The cash flow available to the company's suppliers of capital after all operating expenses have been paid and necessary investments in working capital and fixed capital have been made.
key_phrase: Free cash flow to the firm
definition_or_explanation: The cash flow available to the company's suppliers of capital after all operating expenses have been paid and necessary investments in working capital and fixed capital have been made.

original_glossary_extracted: Free float  The number of shares that are readily and freely tradable in the secondary market.
definition_or_explanation: The number of shares that are readily and freely tradable in the secondary market.

original_glossary_extracted: Free trade  When there are no government restrictions on a country's ability to trade.
definition_or_explanation: When there are no government restrictions on a country's ability to trade.

original_glossary_extracted: Free trade areas  One of the most prevalent forms of regional integration, in which all barriers to the flow of goods and services among members have been eliminated.
definition_or_explanation: One of the most prevalent forms of regional integration, in which all barriers to the flow of goods and services among members have been eliminated.

original_glossary_extracted: Frequency distribution  A tabular display of data summarized into a relatively small number of intervals.
definition_or_explanation: A tabular display of data summarized into a relatively small number of intervals.

original_glossary_extracted: Frequency polygon  A graph of a frequency distribution obtained by drawing straight lines joining successive points representing the class frequencies.
definition_or_explanation: A graph of a frequency distribution obtained by drawing straight lines joining successive points representing the class frequencies.

original_glossary_extracted: Full price  The price of a security with accrued interest; also called the invoice or dirty price.
definition_or_explanation: The price of a security with accrued interest; also called the invoice or dirty price.

original_glossary_extracted: Fundamental analysis  The examination of publicly available information and the formulation of forecasts to estimate the intrinsic value of assets.
definition_or_explanation: The examination of publicly available information and the formulation of forecasts to estimate the intrinsic value of assets.

original_glossary_extracted: Fundamental value  The underlying or true value of an asset based on an analysis of its qualitative and quantitative characteristics. Also called intrinsic value.
definition_or_explanation: The underlying or true value of an asset based on an analysis of its qualitative and quantitative characteristics. Also called intrinsic value.

original_glossary_extracted: Fundamental weighting  An index weighting method in which the weight assigned to each constituent security is based on its underlying company's size. It attempts to address the disadvantages of market-capitalization weighting by using measures that are independent of the constituent security's price.
definition_or_explanation: An index weighting method in which the weight assigned to each constituent security is based on its underlying company's size. It attempts to address the disadvantages of market-capitalization weighting by using measures that are independent of the constituent security's price.

original_glossary_extracted: Funds of funds  Funds that hold a portfolio of hedge funds.
definition_or_explanation: Funds that hold a portfolio of hedge funds.

original_glossary_extracted: Funds of hedge funds  Funds that hold a portfolio of hedge funds.
definition_or_explanation: Funds that hold a portfolio of hedge funds.

original_glossary_extracted: Future value (FV)  The amount to which a payment or series of payments will grow by a stated future date.
definition_or_explanation: The amount to which a payment or series of payments will grow by a stated future date.

original_glossary_extracted: Futures contract  A variation of a forward contract that has essentially the same basic definition but with some addi-tional features, such as a clearinghouse guarantee against credit losses, a daily settlement of gains and losses, and an organized electronic or floor trading facility.
definition_or_explanation: A variation of a forward contract that has essentially the same basic definition but with some addi-tional features, such as a clearinghouse guarantee against credit losses, a daily settlement of gains and losses, and an organized electronic or floor trading facility.

original_glossary_extracted: Futures price  The agreed-upon price of a futures contract.
definition_or_explanation: The agreed-upon price of a futures contract.

original_glossary_extracted: FX swap  The combination of a spot and a forward FX transaction.
definition_or_explanation: The combination of a spot and a forward FX transaction.

original_glossary_extracted: G-spread  The yield spread in basis points over an actual or interpolated government bond.
definition_or_explanation: The yield spread in basis points over an actual or interpolated government bond.

original_glossary_extracted: Gains  Asset inflows not directly related to the ordinary activ-ities of the business.
definition_or_explanation: Asset inflows not directly related to the ordinary activ-ities of the business.

original_glossary_extracted: Game theory  The set of tools decision makers use to incorpo-rate responses by rival decision makers into their strategies.
definition_or_explanation: The set of tools decision makers use to incorpo-rate responses by rival decision makers into their strategies.

original_glossary_extracted: Gamma  A numerical measure of how sensitive an option's delta (the sensitivity of the derivative's price) is to a change in the value of the underlying.
definition_or_explanation: A numerical measure of how sensitive an option's delta (the sensitivity of the derivative's price) is to a change in the value of the underlying.

original_glossary_extracted: GDP deflator  A gauge of prices and inflation that measures the aggregate changes in prices across the overall economy.
definition_or_explanation: A gauge of prices and inflation that measures the aggregate changes in prices across the overall economy.

original_glossary_extracted: General partner  (GP) The partner that runs the business and theoretically bears unlimited liability.
definition_or_explanation: The partner that runs the business and theoretically bears unlimited liability.

original_glossary_extracted: Geometric mean  A measure of central tendency computed by taking the nth root of the product of n non-negative values.
definition_or_explanation: A measure of central tendency computed by taking the nth root of the product of n non-negative values.

original_glossary_extracted: Giffen goods  Goods that are consumed more as the price of the good rises because it is a very inferior good whose income effect overwhelms its substitution effect when price changes.
definition_or_explanation: Goods that are consumed more as the price of the good rises because it is a very inferior good whose income effect overwhelms its substitution effect when price changes.

original_glossary_extracted: Gilts  Bonds issued by the UK government.
definition_or_explanation: Bonds issued by the UK government.

original_glossary_extracted: Giro system  An electronic payment system used widely in Europe and Japan.
definition_or_explanation: An electronic payment system used widely in Europe and Japan.

original_glossary_extracted: Global depository receipt  A depository receipt that is issued outside of the company's home country and outside of the United States.
definition_or_explanation: A depository receipt that is issued outside of the company's home country and outside of the United States.

original_glossary_extracted: Global minimum-variance portfolio  The portfolio on the minimum-variance frontier with the smallest variance of return.
definition_or_explanation: The portfolio on the minimum-variance frontier with the smallest variance of return.

original_glossary_extracted: Global registered share  A common share that is traded on different stock exchanges around the world in different currencies.
definition_or_explanation: A common share that is traded on different stock exchanges around the world in different currencies.

original_glossary_extracted: Gold standard  With respect to a currency, if a currency is on the gold standard a given amount can be converted into a prespecified amount of gold.
definition_or_explanation: With respect to a currency, if a currency is on the gold standard a given amount can be converted into a prespecified amount of gold.

original_glossary_extracted: Golden cross  A technical analysis term that describes a situa-tion where a short-term moving average crosses from below a longer-term moving average to above it; this movement is considered bullish.
definition_or_explanation: A technical analysis term that describes a situa-tion where a short-term moving average crosses from below a longer-term moving average to above it; this movement is considered bullish.

original_glossary_extracted: Good-on-close  An execution instruction specifying that an order can only be filled at the close of trading. Also called market on close.
definition_or_explanation: An execution instruction specifying that an order can only be filled at the close of trading. Also called market on close.

original_glossary_extracted: Good-on-open  An execution instruction specifying that an order can only be filled at the opening of trading.
definition_or_explanation: An execution instruction specifying that an order can only be filled at the opening of trading.

original_glossary_extracted: Good-till-cancelled order  An order specifying that it is valid until the entity placing the order has cancelled it (or, com-monly, until some specified amount of time such as 60 days has elapsed, whichever comes sooner).
definition_or_explanation: An order specifying that it is valid until the entity placing the order has cancelled it (or, com-monly, until some specified amount of time such as 60 days has elapsed, whichever comes sooner).

original_glossary_extracted: Goodwill  An intangible asset that represents the excess of the purchase price of an acquired company over the value of the net assets acquired.
definition_or_explanation: An intangible asset that represents the excess of the purchase price of an acquired company over the value of the net assets acquired.

original_glossary_extracted: Government equivalent yield  A yield that restates a yield-to-maturity based on 30/360 day-count to one based on actual/actual.
definition_or_explanation: A yield that restates a yield-to-maturity based on 30/360 day-count to one based on actual/actual.

original_glossary_extracted: Green bonds  A bond used in green finance whereby the proceeds are earmarked towards environmental-related products.
definition_or_explanation: A bond used in green finance whereby the proceeds are earmarked towards environmental-related products.

original_glossary_extracted: Green finance  A type of finance that addresses environmental concerns while achieving economic growth.
definition_or_explanation: A type of finance that addresses environmental concerns while achieving economic growth.

original_glossary_extracted: Grey market  The forward market for bonds about to be issued. Also called "when issued" market.
definition_or_explanation: The forward market for bonds about to be issued. Also called "when issued" market.

original_glossary_extracted: Gross domestic product  The market value of all final goods and services produced within the economy in a given period of time (output definition) or, equivalently, the aggregate income earned by all households, all companies, and the government within the economy in a given period of time (income definition).
definition_or_explanation: The market value of all final goods and services produced within the economy in a given period of time (output definition) or, equivalently, the aggregate income earned by all households, all companies, and the government within the economy in a given period of time (income definition).

original_glossary_extracted: Gross margin  Sales minus the cost of sales (i.e., the cost of goods sold for a manufacturing company).
definition_or_explanation: Sales minus the cost of sales (i.e., the cost of goods sold for a manufacturing company).

original_glossary_extracted: Gross profit  Sales minus the cost of sales (i.e., the cost of goods sold for a manufacturing company).
definition_or_explanation: Sales minus the cost of sales (i.e., the cost of goods sold for a manufacturing company).

original_glossary_extracted: Gross profit margin  The ratio of gross profit to revenues.
definition_or_explanation: The ratio of gross profit to revenues.

original_glossary_extracted: Grouping by function  With reference to the presentation of expenses in an income statement, the grouping together of expenses serving the same function, e.g. all items that are costs of goods sold.
definition_or_explanation: With reference to the presentation of expenses in an income statement, the grouping together of expenses serving the same function, e.g. all items that are costs of goods sold.

original_glossary_extracted: Grouping by nature  With reference to the presentation of expenses in an income statement, the grouping together of expenses by similar nature, e.g., all depreciation expenses.
definition_or_explanation: With reference to the presentation of expenses in an income statement, the grouping together of expenses by similar nature, e.g., all depreciation expenses.

original_glossary_extracted: Growth cyclical  A term sometimes used to describe companies that are growing rapidly on a long-term basis but that still experience above-average fluctuation in their revenues and profits over the course of a business cycle.
definition_or_explanation: A term sometimes used to describe companies that are growing rapidly on a long-term basis but that still experience above-average fluctuation in their revenues and profits over the course of a business cycle.

original_glossary_extracted: Growth investors  With reference to equity investors, investors who seek to invest in high-earnings-growth companies.
definition_or_explanation: With reference to equity investors, investors who seek to invest in high-earnings-growth companies.

original_glossary_extracted: Guarantee certificate  A type of structured financial instru-ment that provides investors capital protection. It combines a zero-coupon bond and a call option on some underlying asset.
definition_or_explanation: A type of structured financial instru-ment that provides investors capital protection. It combines a zero-coupon bond and a call option on some underlying asset.

original_glossary_extracted: Haircut  See repo margin.
definition_or_explanation: See repo margin.

original_glossary_extracted: Harmonic mean  A type of weighted mean computed by averaging the reciprocals of the observations, then taking the reciprocal of that average.
definition_or_explanation: A type of weighted mean computed by averaging the reciprocals of the observations, then taking the reciprocal of that average.

original_glossary_extracted: Head and shoulders pattern  In technical analysis, a rever-sal pattern that is formed in three parts: a left shoulder, head, and right shoulder; used to predict a change from an uptrend to a downtrend.
definition_or_explanation: In technical analysis, a rever-sal pattern that is formed in three parts: a left shoulder, head, and right shoulder; used to predict a change from an uptrend to a downtrend.

original_glossary_extracted: Headline inflation  The inflation rate calculated based on the price index that includes all goods and services in an economy.
definition_or_explanation: The inflation rate calculated based on the price index that includes all goods and services in an economy.

original_glossary_extracted: Hedge funds  Private investment vehicles that typically use leverage, derivatives, and long and short investment strategies.
definition_or_explanation: Private investment vehicles that typically use leverage, derivatives, and long and short investment strategies.

original_glossary_extracted: Hedge portfolio  A hypothetical combination of the derivative and its underlying that eliminates risk.
definition_or_explanation: A hypothetical combination of the derivative and its underlying that eliminates risk.

original_glossary_extracted: Held for trading  Debt or equity financial assets bought with the intention to sell them in the near term, usually less than three months; securities that a company intends to trade. Also called trading securities.
definition_or_explanation: Debt or equity financial assets bought with the intention to sell them in the near term, usually less than three months; securities that a company intends to trade. Also called trading securities.

original_glossary_extracted: Held-to-maturity  Debt (fixed-income) securities that a com-pany intends to hold to maturity; these are presented at their original cost, updated for any amortization of dis-counts or premiums.
definition_or_explanation: Debt (fixed-income) securities that a com-pany intends to hold to maturity; these are presented at their original cost, updated for any amortization of dis-counts or premiums.

original_glossary_extracted: Herding  Clustered trading that may or may not be based on information.
definition_or_explanation: Clustered trading that may or may not be based on information.

original_glossary_extracted: Hidden order  An order that is exposed not to the public but only to the brokers or exchanges that receive it.
definition_or_explanation: An order that is exposed not to the public but only to the brokers or exchanges that receive it.

original_glossary_extracted: High-frequency trading  A form of algorithmic trading that makes use of vast quantities of data to execute trades on ultra-high-speed networks in fractions of a second.
definition_or_explanation: A form of algorithmic trading that makes use of vast quantities of data to execute trades on ultra-high-speed networks in fractions of a second.

original_glossary_extracted: High-water marks  The highest value, net of fees, that a fund has reached in history. It reflects the highest cumulative return used to calculate an incentive fee.
definition_or_explanation: The highest value, net of fees, that a fund has reached in history. It reflects the highest cumulative return used to calculate an incentive fee.

original_glossary_extracted: Histogram  A bar chart of data that have been grouped into a frequency distribution.
definition_or_explanation: A bar chart of data that have been grouped into a frequency distribution.

original_glossary_extracted: Historical cost  In reference to assets, the amount paid to purchase an asset, including any costs of acquisition and/or preparation; with reference to liabilities, the amount of proceeds received in exchange in issuing the liability.
definition_or_explanation: In reference to assets, the amount paid to purchase an asset, including any costs of acquisition and/or preparation; with reference to liabilities, the amount of proceeds received in exchange in issuing the liability.

original_glossary_extracted: Historical equity risk premium approach  An estimate of a country's equity risk premium that is based upon the his-torical averages of the risk-free rate and the rate of return on the market portfolio.
definition_or_explanation: An estimate of a country's equity risk premium that is based upon the his-torical averages of the risk-free rate and the rate of return on the market portfolio.

original_glossary_extracted: Historical simulation  Another term for the historical method of estimating VaR. This term is somewhat misleading in that the method involves not a simulation of the past but rather what actually happened in the past, sometimes adjusted to reflect the fact that a different portfolio may have existed in the past than is planned for the future.
definition_or_explanation: Another term for the historical method of estimating VaR. This term is somewhat misleading in that the method involves not a simulation of the past but rather what actually happened in the past, sometimes adjusted to reflect the fact that a different portfolio may have existed in the past than is planned for the future.

original_glossary_extracted: Holder-of-record date  The date that a shareholder listed on the corporation's books will be deemed to have owner-ship of the shares for purposes of receiving an upcoming dividend.
definition_or_explanation: The date that a shareholder listed on the corporation's books will be deemed to have owner-ship of the shares for purposes of receiving an upcoming dividend.

original_glossary_extracted: Holding period return  The return that an investor earns during a specified holding period; a synonym for total return.
definition_or_explanation: The return that an investor earns during a specified holding period; a synonym for total return.

original_glossary_extracted: Holding period yield (HPY)  The return that an investor earns during a specified holding period; holding period return with reference to a fixed-income instrument.
definition_or_explanation: The return that an investor earns during a specified holding period; holding period return with reference to a fixed-income instrument.

original_glossary_extracted: Homogeneity of expectations  The assumption that all inves-tors have the same economic expectations and thus have the same expectations of prices, cash flows, and other investment characteristics.
definition_or_explanation: The assumption that all inves-tors have the same economic expectations and thus have the same expectations of prices, cash flows, and other investment characteristics.

original_glossary_extracted: Horizon yield  The internal rate of return between the total return (the sum of reinvested coupon payments and the sale price or redemption amount) and the purchase price of the bond.
definition_or_explanation: The internal rate of return between the total return (the sum of reinvested coupon payments and the sale price or redemption amount) and the purchase price of the bond.

original_glossary_extracted: Horizontal analysis  Common-size analysis that involves com-paring a specific financial statement with that statement in prior or future time periods; also, cross-sectional analysis of one company with another.
definition_or_explanation: Common-size analysis that involves com-paring a specific financial statement with that statement in prior or future time periods; also, cross-sectional analysis of one company with another.

original_glossary_extracted: Horizontal demand schedule  Implies that at a given price, the response in the quantity demanded is infinite.
definition_or_explanation: Implies that at a given price, the response in the quantity demanded is infinite.

original_glossary_extracted: Hostile takeover  An attempt by one entity to acquire a com-pany without the consent of the company's management.
definition_or_explanation: An attempt by one entity to acquire a com-pany without the consent of the company's management.

original_glossary_extracted: Household  A person or a group of people living in the same residence, taken as a basic unit in economic analysis.
definition_or_explanation: A person or a group of people living in the same residence, taken as a basic unit in economic analysis.

original_glossary_extracted: Human capital  The accumulated knowledge and skill that workers acquire from education, training, or life experience and the corresponding present value of future earnings to be generated by said skilled individual.
definition_or_explanation: The accumulated knowledge and skill that workers acquire from education, training, or life experience and the corresponding present value of future earnings to be generated by said skilled individual.

original_glossary_extracted: Hurdle rate  The rate of return that must be met for a project to be accepted.
definition_or_explanation: The rate of return that must be met for a project to be accepted.

original_glossary_extracted: Hypothesis  With reference to statistical inference, a statement about one or more populations.
definition_or_explanation: With reference to statistical inference, a statement about one or more populations.

original_glossary_extracted: Hypothesis testing  With reference to statistical inference, the subdivision dealing with the testing of hypotheses about one or more populations.
definition_or_explanation: With reference to statistical inference, the subdivision dealing with the testing of hypotheses about one or more populations.

original_glossary_extracted: I-spread  The yield spread of a specific bond over the standard swap rate in that currency of the same tenor.
definition_or_explanation: The yield spread of a specific bond over the standard swap rate in that currency of the same tenor.

original_glossary_extracted: Iceberg order  An order in which the display size is less than the order's full size.
definition_or_explanation: An order in which the display size is less than the order's full size.

original_glossary_extracted: If-converted method  A method for accounting for the effect of convertible securities on earnings per share (EPS) that specifies what EPS would have been if the convertible secu-rities had been converted at the beginning of the period, taking account of the effects of conversion on net income and the weighted average number of shares outstanding.
definition_or_explanation: A method for accounting for the effect of convertible securities on earnings per share (EPS) that specifies what EPS would have been if the convertible secu-rities had been converted at the beginning of the period, taking account of the effects of conversion on net income and the weighted average number of shares outstanding.

original_glossary_extracted: Immediate or cancel order  An order that is valid only upon receipt by the broker or exchange. If such an order can-not be filled in part or in whole upon receipt, it cancels immediately. Also called fill or kill.
definition_or_explanation: An order that is valid only upon receipt by the broker or exchange. If such an order can-not be filled in part or in whole upon receipt, it cancels immediately. Also called fill or kill.

original_glossary_extracted: Impact investing  Investing that seeks to achieve targeted social or environmental objectives along with measurable financial returns through engagement with a company or by direct investment in projects or companies.
definition_or_explanation: Investing that seeks to achieve targeted social or environmental objectives along with measurable financial returns through engagement with a company or by direct investment in projects or companies.

original_glossary_extracted: Impact lag  The lag associated with the result of actions affect-ing the economy with delay.
definition_or_explanation: The lag associated with the result of actions affect-ing the economy with delay.

original_glossary_extracted: Implicit price deflator for GDP  A gauge of prices and inflation that measures the aggregate changes in prices across the overall economy.
definition_or_explanation: A gauge of prices and inflation that measures the aggregate changes in prices across the overall economy.

original_glossary_extracted: Implied forward rates  Calculated from spot rates, an implied forward rate is a break-even reinvestment rate that links the return on an investment in a shorter-term zero-coupon bond to the return on an investment in a longer-term zero-coupon bond.
definition_or_explanation: Calculated from spot rates, an implied forward rate is a break-even reinvestment rate that links the return on an investment in a shorter-term zero-coupon bond to the return on an investment in a longer-term zero-coupon bond.

original_glossary_extracted: Implied volatility  The volatility that option traders use to price an option, implied by the price of the option and a particular option-pricing model.
definition_or_explanation: The volatility that option traders use to price an option, implied by the price of the option and a particular option-pricing model.

original_glossary_extracted: Import license  Specifies the quantity of a good that can be imported into a country.
definition_or_explanation: Specifies the quantity of a good that can be imported into a country.

original_glossary_extracted: Imports  Goods and services that a domestic economy (i.e., house-holds, firms, and government) purchases from other countries.
definition_or_explanation: Goods and services that a domestic economy (i.e., house-holds, firms, and government) purchases from other countries.

original_glossary_extracted: In the money  Options that, if exercised, would result in the value received being worth more than the payment required to exercise.
definition_or_explanation: Options that, if exercised, would result in the value received being worth more than the payment required to exercise.

original_glossary_extracted: Incentive fee  Fees paid to the general partner from the limited partner(s) based on realized profits.
definition_or_explanation: Fees paid to the general partner from the limited partner(s) based on realized profits.

original_glossary_extracted: Income  Increases in economic benefits in the form of inflows or enhancements of assets, or decreases of liabilities that result in an increase in equity (other than increases result-ing from contributions by owners).
definition_or_explanation: Increases in economic benefits in the form of inflows or enhancements of assets, or decreases of liabilities that result in an increase in equity (other than increases result-ing from contributions by owners).

original_glossary_extracted: Income elasticity of demand  A measure of the responsiveness of demand to changes in income, defined as the percentage change in quantity demanded divided by the percentage change in income.
definition_or_explanation: A measure of the responsiveness of demand to changes in income, defined as the percentage change in quantity demanded divided by the percentage change in income.

original_glossary_extracted: Income tax paid  The actual amount paid for income taxes in the period; not a provision, but the actual cash outflow.
definition_or_explanation: The actual amount paid for income taxes in the period; not a provision, but the actual cash outflow.

original_glossary_extracted: Income tax payable  The income tax owed by the company on the basis of taxable income.
definition_or_explanation: The income tax owed by the company on the basis of taxable income.

original_glossary_extracted: Income trust  A type of equity ownership vehicle established as a trust issuing ownership shares known as units.
definition_or_explanation: A type of equity ownership vehicle established as a trust issuing ownership shares known as units.

original_glossary_extracted: Increasing marginal returns  When the marginal product of a resource increases as additional units of that input are employed.
definition_or_explanation: When the marginal product of a resource increases as additional units of that input are employed.

original_glossary_extracted: Increasing returns to scale  When a production process leads to increases in output that are proportionately larger than the increase in inputs.
definition_or_explanation: When a production process leads to increases in output that are proportionately larger than the increase in inputs.

original_glossary_extracted: Incremental cash flow  The cash flow that is realized because of a decision; the changes or increments to cash flows resulting from a decision or action.
definition_or_explanation: The cash flow that is realized because of a decision; the changes or increments to cash flows resulting from a decision or action.

original_glossary_extracted: Indenture  Legal contract that describes the form of a bond, the obligations of the issuer, and the rights of the bondholders. Also called the trust deed.
definition_or_explanation: Legal contract that describes the form of a bond, the obligations of the issuer, and the rights of the bondholders. Also called the trust deed.

original_glossary_extracted: Independent  With reference to events, the property that the occurrence of one event does not affect the probability of another event occurring.
definition_or_explanation: With reference to events, the property that the occurrence of one event does not affect the probability of another event occurring.

original_glossary_extracted: Independent projects  Independent projects are projects whose cash flows are independent of each other.
definition_or_explanation: Independent projects are projects whose cash flows are independent of each other.

original_glossary_extracted: Independently and identically distributed (IID)  With respect to random variables, the property of random variables that are independent of each other but follow the identical probability distribution.
definition_or_explanation: With respect to random variables, the property of random variables that are independent of each other but follow the identical probability distribution.

original_glossary_extracted: Index-linked bond  Bond for which coupon payments and/or principal repayment are linked to a specified index.
definition_or_explanation: Bond for which coupon payments and/or principal repayment are linked to a specified index.

original_glossary_extracted: Index of Leading Economic Indicators  A composite of eco-nomic variables used by analysts to predict future economic conditions.
definition_or_explanation: A composite of eco-nomic variables used by analysts to predict future economic conditions.

original_glossary_extracted: Indexing  An investment strategy in which an investor con-structs a portfolio to mirror the performance of a specified index.
definition_or_explanation: An investment strategy in which an investor con-structs a portfolio to mirror the performance of a specified index.

original_glossary_extracted: Indifference curve  A curve representing all the combinations of two goods or attributes such that the consumer is entirely indifferent among them.
definition_or_explanation: A curve representing all the combinations of two goods or attributes such that the consumer is entirely indifferent among them.

original_glossary_extracted: Indirect format  With reference to cash flow statements, a format for the presentation of the statement which, in the operating cash flow section, begins with net income then shows additions and subtractions to arrive at operating cash flow. Also called indirect method.
definition_or_explanation: With reference to cash flow statements, a format for the presentation of the statement which, in the operating cash flow section, begins with net income then shows additions and subtractions to arrive at operating cash flow. Also called indirect method.

original_glossary_extracted: Indirect method  See indirect format.
definition_or_explanation: See indirect format.

original_glossary_extracted: Indirect taxes  Taxes such as taxes on spending, as opposed to direct taxes.
definition_or_explanation: Taxes such as taxes on spending, as opposed to direct taxes.

original_glossary_extracted: Industry  A group of companies offering similar products and/or services.
definition_or_explanation: A group of companies offering similar products and/or services.

original_glossary_extracted: Industry analysis  The analysis of a specific branch of manu-facturing, service, or trade.
definition_or_explanation: The analysis of a specific branch of manu-facturing, service, or trade.

original_glossary_extracted: Inelastic  Said of a good or service when the magnitude of elasticity is less than one. Insensitive to price changes.
definition_or_explanation: Said of a good or service when the magnitude of elasticity is less than one. Insensitive to price changes.

original_glossary_extracted: Inferior goods  A good whose consumption decreases as income increases.
definition_or_explanation: A good whose consumption decreases as income increases.

original_glossary_extracted: Inflation  The percentage increase in the general price level from one period to the next; a sustained rise in the overall level of prices in an economy.
definition_or_explanation: The percentage increase in the general price level from one period to the next; a sustained rise in the overall level of prices in an economy.

original_glossary_extracted: Inflation-linked bond  Type of index-linked bond that offers investors protection against inflation by linking the bond's coupon payments and/or the principal repayment to an index of consumer prices. Also called linkers.
definition_or_explanation: Type of index-linked bond that offers investors protection against inflation by linking the bond's coupon payments and/or the principal repayment to an index of consumer prices. Also called linkers.

original_glossary_extracted: Inflation premium  An extra return that compensates investors for expected inflation.
definition_or_explanation: An extra return that compensates investors for expected inflation.

original_glossary_extracted: Inflation rate  The percentage change in a price index-that is, the speed of overall price level movements.
definition_or_explanation: The percentage change in a price index-that is, the speed of overall price level movements.

original_glossary_extracted: Inflation Reports  A type of economic publication put out by many central banks.
definition_or_explanation: A type of economic publication put out by many central banks.

original_glossary_extracted: Inflation uncertainty  The degree to which economic agents view future rates of inflation as difficult to forecast.
definition_or_explanation: The degree to which economic agents view future rates of inflation as difficult to forecast.

original_glossary_extracted: Information cascade  The transmission of information from those participants who act first and whose decisions influ-ence the decisions of others.
definition_or_explanation: The transmission of information from those participants who act first and whose decisions influ-ence the decisions of others.

original_glossary_extracted: Information-motivated traders  Traders that trade to profit from information that they believe allows them to predict future prices.
definition_or_explanation: Traders that trade to profit from information that they believe allows them to predict future prices.

original_glossary_extracted: Informationally efficient market  A market in which asset prices reflect new information quickly and rationally.
definition_or_explanation: A market in which asset prices reflect new information quickly and rationally.

original_glossary_extracted: Initial coin offering  An unregulated process whereby com-panies raise capital by selling crypto tokens to inves-tors in exchange for fiat money or another agreed-upon cryptocurrency.
definition_or_explanation: An unregulated process whereby com-panies raise capital by selling crypto tokens to inves-tors in exchange for fiat money or another agreed-upon cryptocurrency.

original_glossary_extracted: Initial margin  The amount that must be deposited in a clear-inghouse account when entering into a futures contract.
definition_or_explanation: The amount that must be deposited in a clear-inghouse account when entering into a futures contract.

original_glossary_extracted: Initial margin requirement  The margin requirement on the first day of a transaction as well as on any day in which additional margin funds must be deposited.
definition_or_explanation: The margin requirement on the first day of a transaction as well as on any day in which additional margin funds must be deposited.

original_glossary_extracted: Initial public offering  (IPO) The first issuance of common shares to the public by a formerly private corporation.
definition_or_explanation: The first issuance of common shares to the public by a formerly private corporation.

original_glossary_extracted: Input productivity  The amount of output produced by work-ers in a given period of time-for example, output per hour worked; measures the efficiency of labor.
definition_or_explanation: The amount of output produced by work-ers in a given period of time-for example, output per hour worked; measures the efficiency of labor.

original_glossary_extracted: Installment method  With respect to revenue recognition, a method that specifies that the portion of the total profit of the sale that is recognized in each period is determined by the percentage of the total sales price for which the seller has received cash.
definition_or_explanation: With respect to revenue recognition, a method that specifies that the portion of the total profit of the sale that is recognized in each period is determined by the percentage of the total sales price for which the seller has received cash.

original_glossary_extracted: Installment sales  With respect to revenue recognition, a method that specifies that the portion of the total profit of the sale that is recognized in each period is determined by the percentage of the total sales price for which the seller has received cash.
definition_or_explanation: With respect to revenue recognition, a method that specifies that the portion of the total profit of the sale that is recognized in each period is determined by the percentage of the total sales price for which the seller has received cash.

original_glossary_extracted: Intangible assets  Assets lacking physical substance, such as patents and trademarks.
definition_or_explanation: Assets lacking physical substance, such as patents and trademarks.

original_glossary_extracted: Interbank market  The market of loans and deposits between banks for maturities ranging from overnight to one year.
definition_or_explanation: The market of loans and deposits between banks for maturities ranging from overnight to one year.

original_glossary_extracted: Interbank money market  The market of loans and deposits between banks for maturities ranging from overnight to one year.
definition_or_explanation: The market of loans and deposits between banks for maturities ranging from overnight to one year.

original_glossary_extracted: Interest  Payment for lending funds.
definition_or_explanation: Payment for lending funds.

original_glossary_extracted: Interest coverage  A solvency ratio calculated as EBIT divided by interest payments.
definition_or_explanation: A solvency ratio calculated as EBIT divided by interest payments.

original_glossary_extracted: Interest-only mortgage  A loan in which no scheduled prin-cipal repayment is specified for a certain number of years.
definition_or_explanation: A loan in which no scheduled prin-cipal repayment is specified for a certain number of years.

original_glossary_extracted: Interest rate  A rate of return that reflects the relationship between differently dated cash flows; a discount rate.
definition_or_explanation: A rate of return that reflects the relationship between differently dated cash flows; a discount rate.

original_glossary_extracted: Interest rate swap  A swap in which the underlying is an interest rate. Can be viewed as a currency swap in which both currencies are the same and can be created as a combination of currency swaps.
definition_or_explanation: A swap in which the underlying is an interest rate. Can be viewed as a currency swap in which both currencies are the same and can be created as a combination of currency swaps.

original_glossary_extracted: Intergenerational data mining  A form of data mining that applies information developed by previous researchers using a dataset to guide current research using the same or a related dataset.
definition_or_explanation: A form of data mining that applies information developed by previous researchers using a dataset to guide current research using the same or a related dataset.

original_glossary_extracted: Intermarket analysis  A field within technical analysis that combines analysis of major categories of securities-namely, equities, bonds, currencies, and commodities-to identify market trends and possible inflections in a trend.
definition_or_explanation: A field within technical analysis that combines analysis of major categories of securities-namely, equities, bonds, currencies, and commodities-to identify market trends and possible inflections in a trend.

original_glossary_extracted: Internal rate of return  (IRR) The discount rate that makes net present value equal 0; the discount rate that makes the present value of an investment's costs (outflows) equal to the present value of the investment's benefits (inflows).
definition_or_explanation: The discount rate that makes net present value equal 0; the discount rate that makes the present value of an investment's costs (outflows) equal to the present value of the investment's benefits (inflows).

original_glossary_extracted: Internet of Things  A network arrangement of structures and devices whereby the objects on the network are able to interact and share information.
definition_or_explanation: A network arrangement of structures and devices whereby the objects on the network are able to interact and share information.

original_glossary_extracted: Interpolated spread  The yield spread of a specific bond over the standard swap rate in that currency of the same tenor.
definition_or_explanation: The yield spread of a specific bond over the standard swap rate in that currency of the same tenor.

original_glossary_extracted: Interquartile range  The difference between the third and first quartiles of a dataset.
definition_or_explanation: The difference between the third and first quartiles of a dataset.

original_glossary_extracted: Interval  With reference to grouped data, a set of values within which an observation falls.
definition_or_explanation: With reference to grouped data, a set of values within which an observation falls.

original_glossary_extracted: Interval scale  A measurement scale that not only ranks data but also gives assurance that the differences between scale values are equal.
definition_or_explanation: A measurement scale that not only ranks data but also gives assurance that the differences between scale values are equal.

original_glossary_extracted: Intrinsic value  See exercise value.
definition_or_explanation: See exercise value.

original_glossary_extracted: Inventory blanket lien  The use of inventory as collateral for a loan. Though the lender has claim to some or all of the company's inventory, the company may still sell or use the inventory in the ordinary course of business.
definition_or_explanation: The use of inventory as collateral for a loan. Though the lender has claim to some or all of the company's inventory, the company may still sell or use the inventory in the ordinary course of business.

original_glossary_extracted: Inventory investment  Net change in business inventory.
definition_or_explanation: Net change in business inventory.

original_glossary_extracted: Inventory turnover  An activity ratio calculated as cost of goods sold divided by average inventory.
definition_or_explanation: An activity ratio calculated as cost of goods sold divided by average inventory.

original_glossary_extracted: Inverse demand function  A restatement of the demand function in which price is stated as a function of quantity.
definition_or_explanation: A restatement of the demand function in which price is stated as a function of quantity.

original_glossary_extracted: Inverse floater  A type of leveraged structured financial instru-ment. The cash flows are adjusted periodically and move in the opposite direction of changes in the reference rate.
definition_or_explanation: A type of leveraged structured financial instru-ment. The cash flows are adjusted periodically and move in the opposite direction of changes in the reference rate.

original_glossary_extracted: Investing activities  Activities which are associated with the acquisition and disposal of property, plant, and equipment; intangible assets; other long-term assets; and both long-term and short-term investments in the equity and debt (bonds and loans) issued by other companies.
definition_or_explanation: Activities which are associated with the acquisition and disposal of property, plant, and equipment; intangible assets; other long-term assets; and both long-term and short-term investments in the equity and debt (bonds and loans) issued by other companies.

original_glossary_extracted: Investment banks  Financial intermediaries that provide advice to their mostly corporate clients and help them arrange transactions such as initial and seasoned securities offerings.
definition_or_explanation: Financial intermediaries that provide advice to their mostly corporate clients and help them arrange transactions such as initial and seasoned securities offerings.

original_glossary_extracted: Investment opportunity schedule  A graphical depiction of a company's investment opportunities ordered from highest to lowest expected return. A company's optimal capital budget is found where the investment opportunity schedule intersects with the company's marginal cost of capital.
definition_or_explanation: A graphical depiction of a company's investment opportunities ordered from highest to lowest expected return. A company's optimal capital budget is found where the investment opportunity schedule intersects with the company's marginal cost of capital.

original_glossary_extracted: Investment policy statement  (IPS) A written planning doc-ument that describes a client's investment objectives and risk tolerance over a relevant time horizon, along with constraints that apply to the client's portfolio.
definition_or_explanation: A written planning doc-ument that describes a client's investment objectives and risk tolerance over a relevant time horizon, along with constraints that apply to the client's portfolio.

original_glossary_extracted: Investment property  Property used to earn rental income or capital appreciation (or both).
definition_or_explanation: Property used to earn rental income or capital appreciation (or both).

original_glossary_extracted: IRR rule  An investment decision rule that accepts projects or investments for which the IRR is greater than the oppor-tunity cost of capital.
definition_or_explanation: An investment decision rule that accepts projects or investments for which the IRR is greater than the oppor-tunity cost of capital.

original_glossary_extracted: January effect  Calendar anomaly that stock market returns in January are significantly higher compared to the rest of the months of the year, with most of the abnormal returns reported during the first five trading days in January. Also called turn-of-the-year effect.
definition_or_explanation: Calendar anomaly that stock market returns in January are significantly higher compared to the rest of the months of the year, with most of the abnormal returns reported during the first five trading days in January. Also called turn-of-the-year effect.

original_glossary_extracted: Joint probability  The probability of the joint occurrence of stated events.
definition_or_explanation: The probability of the joint occurrence of stated events.

original_glossary_extracted: Joint probability function  A function giving the probability of joint occurrences of values of stated random variables.
definition_or_explanation: A function giving the probability of joint occurrences of values of stated random variables.

original_glossary_extracted: Just-in-time (JIT) method  Method of managing inventory that minimizes in-process inventory stocks.
definition_or_explanation: Method of managing inventory that minimizes in-process inventory stocks.

original_glossary_extracted: Key rate duration  A method of measuring the interest rate sensitivities of a fixed-income instrument or portfolio to shifts in key points along the yield curve.
definition_or_explanation: A method of measuring the interest rate sensitivities of a fixed-income instrument or portfolio to shifts in key points along the yield curve.

original_glossary_extracted: Keynesians  Economists who believe that fiscal policy can have powerful effects on aggregate demand, output, and employment when there is substantial spare capacity in an economy.
definition_or_explanation: Economists who believe that fiscal policy can have powerful effects on aggregate demand, output, and employment when there is substantial spare capacity in an economy.

original_glossary_extracted: Kondratieff wave  A 54-year long economic cycle postulated by Nikolai Kondratieff.
definition_or_explanation: A 54-year long economic cycle postulated by Nikolai Kondratieff.

original_glossary_extracted: Kurtosis  The statistical measure that indicates the combined weight of the tails of a distribution relative to the rest of the distribution.
definition_or_explanation: The statistical measure that indicates the combined weight of the tails of a distribution relative to the rest of the distribution.

original_glossary_extracted: Labor force  The portion of the working age population (over the age of 16) that is employed or is available for work but not working (unemployed).
definition_or_explanation: The portion of the working age population (over the age of 16) that is employed or is available for work but not working (unemployed).

original_glossary_extracted: Labor productivity  The quantity of goods and services (real GDP) that a worker can produce in one hour of work.
definition_or_explanation: The quantity of goods and services (real GDP) that a worker can produce in one hour of work.

original_glossary_extracted: Laddering strategy  A form of active strategy which entails scheduling maturities on a systematic basis within the investment portfolio such that investments are spread out equally over the term of the ladder.
definition_or_explanation: A form of active strategy which entails scheduling maturities on a systematic basis within the investment portfolio such that investments are spread out equally over the term of the ladder.

original_glossary_extracted: Lagging economic indicators  Turning points that take place later than those of the overall economy; they are believed to have value in identifying the economy's past condition.
definition_or_explanation: Turning points that take place later than those of the overall economy; they are believed to have value in identifying the economy's past condition.

original_glossary_extracted: Laspeyres index  A price index created by holding the com-position of the consumption basket constant.
definition_or_explanation: A price index created by holding the com-position of the consumption basket constant.

original_glossary_extracted: Law of demand  The principle that as the price of a good rises, buyers will choose to buy less of it, and as its price falls, they will buy more.
definition_or_explanation: The principle that as the price of a good rises, buyers will choose to buy less of it, and as its price falls, they will buy more.

original_glossary_extracted: Law of diminishing marginal returns  The observation that a variable factor's marginal product must eventually fall as more of it is added to a fixed amount of the other factors.
definition_or_explanation: The observation that a variable factor's marginal product must eventually fall as more of it is added to a fixed amount of the other factors.

original_glossary_extracted: Law of diminishing returns  The smallest output that a firm can produce such that its long run average costs are minimized.
definition_or_explanation: The smallest output that a firm can produce such that its long run average costs are minimized.

original_glossary_extracted: Law of one price  The condition in a financial market in which two equivalent financial instruments or combinations of financial instruments can sell for only one price. Equivalent to the principle that no arbitrage opportunities are possible.
definition_or_explanation: The condition in a financial market in which two equivalent financial instruments or combinations of financial instruments can sell for only one price. Equivalent to the principle that no arbitrage opportunities are possible.

original_glossary_extracted: Lead underwriter  The lead investment bank in a syndicate of investment banks and broker-dealers involved in a securities underwriting.
definition_or_explanation: The lead investment bank in a syndicate of investment banks and broker-dealers involved in a securities underwriting.

original_glossary_extracted: Leading economic indicators  Turning points that usually precede those of the overall economy; they are believed to have value for predicting the economy's future state, usually near-term.
definition_or_explanation: Turning points that usually precede those of the overall economy; they are believed to have value for predicting the economy's future state, usually near-term.

original_glossary_extracted: Legal tender  Something that must be accepted when offered in exchange for goods and services.
definition_or_explanation: Something that must be accepted when offered in exchange for goods and services.

original_glossary_extracted: Lender of last resort  An entity willing to lend money when no other entity is ready to do so.
definition_or_explanation: An entity willing to lend money when no other entity is ready to do so.

original_glossary_extracted: Leptokurtic  Describes a distribution that has fatter tails than a normal distribution.
definition_or_explanation: Describes a distribution that has fatter tails than a normal distribution.

original_glossary_extracted: Lessee  The party obtaining the use of an asset through a lease.
definition_or_explanation: The party obtaining the use of an asset through a lease.

original_glossary_extracted: Lessor  The owner of an asset that grants the right to use the asset to another party.
definition_or_explanation: The owner of an asset that grants the right to use the asset to another party.
