definition_or_explanation: A specification of what instrument to trade, how much to trade, and whether to buy or sell.

original_glossary_extracted: Order-driven markets  A market (generally an auction market) that uses rules to arrange trades based on the orders that traders submit; in their pure form, such markets do not make use of dealers.
definition_or_explanation: A market (generally an auction market) that uses rules to arrange trades based on the orders that traders submit; in their pure form, such markets do not make use of dealers.

original_glossary_extracted: Order precedence hierarchy  With respect to the execution of orders to trade, a set of rules that determines which orders execute before other orders.
definition_or_explanation: With respect to the execution of orders to trade, a set of rules that determines which orders execute before other orders.

original_glossary_extracted: Ordinal scale  A measurement scale that sorts data into cat-egories that are ordered (ranked) with respect to some characteristic.
definition_or_explanation: A measurement scale that sorts data into cat-egories that are ordered (ranked) with respect to some characteristic.

original_glossary_extracted: Ordinary annuity  An annuity with a first cash flow that is paid one period from the present.
definition_or_explanation: An annuity with a first cash flow that is paid one period from the present.

original_glossary_extracted: Ordinary shares  Equity shares that are subordinate to all other types of equity (e.g., preferred equity). Also called common stock or common shares.
definition_or_explanation: Equity shares that are subordinate to all other types of equity (e.g., preferred equity). Also called common stock or common shares.

original_glossary_extracted: Organized exchange  A securities marketplace where buyers and seller can meet to arrange their trades.
definition_or_explanation: A securities marketplace where buyers and seller can meet to arrange their trades.

original_glossary_extracted: Other comprehensive income  Items of comprehensive income that are not reported on the income statement; comprehensive income minus net income.
definition_or_explanation: Items of comprehensive income that are not reported on the income statement; comprehensive income minus net income.

original_glossary_extracted: Out-of-sample test  A test of a strategy or model using a sample outside the time period on which the strategy or model was developed.
definition_or_explanation: A test of a strategy or model using a sample outside the time period on which the strategy or model was developed.

original_glossary_extracted: Out of the money  Options that, if exercised, would require the payment of more money than the value received and therefore would not be currently exercised.
definition_or_explanation: Options that, if exercised, would require the payment of more money than the value received and therefore would not be currently exercised.

original_glossary_extracted: Outcome  A possible value of a random variable.
definition_or_explanation: A possible value of a random variable.

original_glossary_extracted: Over-the-counter (OTC) markets  A decentralized market where buy and sell orders initiated from various locations are matched through a communications network.
definition_or_explanation: A decentralized market where buy and sell orders initiated from various locations are matched through a communications network.

original_glossary_extracted: Overbought  A market condition in which market sentiment is thought to be unsustainably bullish.
definition_or_explanation: A market condition in which market sentiment is thought to be unsustainably bullish.

original_glossary_extracted: Overcollateralization  Form of internal credit enhancement that refers to the process of posting more collateral than needed to obtain or secure financing.
definition_or_explanation: Form of internal credit enhancement that refers to the process of posting more collateral than needed to obtain or secure financing.

original_glossary_extracted: Overfitting  An undesirable result from fitting a model so closely to a dataset that it does not perform well on new data.
definition_or_explanation: An undesirable result from fitting a model so closely to a dataset that it does not perform well on new data.

original_glossary_extracted: Oversold  A market condition in which market sentiment is thought to be unsustainably bearish.
definition_or_explanation: A market condition in which market sentiment is thought to be unsustainably bearish.

original_glossary_extracted: Own price  The price of a good or service itself (as opposed to the price of something else).
definition_or_explanation: The price of a good or service itself (as opposed to the price of something else).

original_glossary_extracted: Own-price elasticity of demand  The percentage change in quantity demanded for a percentage change in good's own price, holding all other things constant.
definition_or_explanation: The percentage change in quantity demanded for a percentage change in good's own price, holding all other things constant.

original_glossary_extracted: Owners' equity  The excess of assets over liabilities; the resid-ual interest of shareholders in the assets of an entity after deducting the entity's liabilities. Also called shareholders' equity.
definition_or_explanation: The excess of assets over liabilities; the resid-ual interest of shareholders in the assets of an entity after deducting the entity's liabilities. Also called shareholders' equity.

original_glossary_extracted: Paasche index  An index formula using the current compo-sition of a basket of products.
definition_or_explanation: An index formula using the current compo-sition of a basket of products.

original_glossary_extracted: Paired comparisons test  A statistical test for differences based on paired observations drawn from samples that are dependent on each other.
definition_or_explanation: A statistical test for differences based on paired observations drawn from samples that are dependent on each other.

original_glossary_extracted: Paired observations  Observations that are dependent on each other.
definition_or_explanation: Observations that are dependent on each other.

original_glossary_extracted: Pairs arbitrage trade  A trade in two closely related stocks involving the short sale of one and the purchase of the other.
definition_or_explanation: A trade in two closely related stocks involving the short sale of one and the purchase of the other.

original_glossary_extracted: Panel data  Observations through time on a single character-istic of multiple observational units.
definition_or_explanation: Observations through time on a single character-istic of multiple observational units.

original_glossary_extracted: Par curve  A sequence of yields-to-maturity such that each bond is priced at par value. The bonds are assumed to have the same currency, credit risk, liquidity, tax status, and annual yields stated for the same periodicity.
definition_or_explanation: A sequence of yields-to-maturity such that each bond is priced at par value. The bonds are assumed to have the same currency, credit risk, liquidity, tax status, and annual yields stated for the same periodicity.

original_glossary_extracted: Par value  The amount of principal on a bond.
definition_or_explanation: The amount of principal on a bond.

original_glossary_extracted: Parallel shift  A parallel yield curve shift implies that all rates change by the same amount in the same direction.
definition_or_explanation: A parallel yield curve shift implies that all rates change by the same amount in the same direction.

original_glossary_extracted: Parameter  A descriptive measure computed from or used to describe a population of data, conventionally represented by Greek letters.
definition_or_explanation: A descriptive measure computed from or used to describe a population of data, conventionally represented by Greek letters.

original_glossary_extracted: Parametric test  Any test (or procedure) concerned with parameters or whose validity depends on assumptions concerning the population generating the sample.
definition_or_explanation: Any test (or procedure) concerned with parameters or whose validity depends on assumptions concerning the population generating the sample.

original_glossary_extracted: Pari passu  On an equal footing.
definition_or_explanation: On an equal footing.

original_glossary_extracted: Partial duration  See key rate duration.
definition_or_explanation: See key rate duration.

original_glossary_extracted: Participating preference shares  Preference shares that entitle shareholders to receive the standard preferred dividend plus the opportunity to receive an additional dividend if the company's profits exceed a pre-specified level.
definition_or_explanation: Preference shares that entitle shareholders to receive the standard preferred dividend plus the opportunity to receive an additional dividend if the company's profits exceed a pre-specified level.

original_glossary_extracted: Pass-through rate  The coupon rate of a mortgage pass-through security.
definition_or_explanation: The coupon rate of a mortgage pass-through security.

original_glossary_extracted: Passive investment  A buy and hold approach in which an investor does not make portfolio changes based on short-term expectations of changing market or security performance.
definition_or_explanation: A buy and hold approach in which an investor does not make portfolio changes based on short-term expectations of changing market or security performance.

original_glossary_extracted: Passive strategy  In reference to short-term cash management, it is an investment strategy characterized by simple decision rules for making daily investments.
definition_or_explanation: In reference to short-term cash management, it is an investment strategy characterized by simple decision rules for making daily investments.

original_glossary_extracted: Payable date  The day that the company actually mails out (or electronically transfers) a dividend payment.
definition_or_explanation: The day that the company actually mails out (or electronically transfers) a dividend payment.

original_glossary_extracted: Payment date  The day that the company actually mails out (or electronically transfers) a dividend payment.
definition_or_explanation: The day that the company actually mails out (or electronically transfers) a dividend payment.

original_glossary_extracted: Payments system  The system for the transfer of money.
definition_or_explanation: The system for the transfer of money.

original_glossary_extracted: Peak  The highest point of a business cycle.
definition_or_explanation: The highest point of a business cycle.

original_glossary_extracted: Peer group  A group of companies engaged in similar business activities whose economics and valuation are influenced by closely related factors.
definition_or_explanation: A group of companies engaged in similar business activities whose economics and valuation are influenced by closely related factors.

original_glossary_extracted: Pennants  A technical analysis continuation pattern formed by trendlines that converge to form a triangle, typically over a short period.
definition_or_explanation: A technical analysis continuation pattern formed by trendlines that converge to form a triangle, typically over a short period.

original_glossary_extracted: Per capita real GDP  Real GDP divided by the size of the pop-ulation, often used as a measure of the average standard of living in a country.
definition_or_explanation: Real GDP divided by the size of the pop-ulation, often used as a measure of the average standard of living in a country.

original_glossary_extracted: Per unit contribution margin  The amount that each unit sold contributes to covering fixed costs-that is, the difference between the price per unit and the variable cost per unit.
definition_or_explanation: The amount that each unit sold contributes to covering fixed costs-that is, the difference between the price per unit and the variable cost per unit.

original_glossary_extracted: Percentage-of-completion  A method of revenue recogni-tion in which, in each accounting period, the company estimates what percentage of the contract is complete and then reports that percentage of the total contract revenue in its income statement.
definition_or_explanation: A method of revenue recogni-tion in which, in each accounting period, the company estimates what percentage of the contract is complete and then reports that percentage of the total contract revenue in its income statement.

original_glossary_extracted: Percentiles  Quantiles that divide a distribution into 100 equal parts.
definition_or_explanation: Quantiles that divide a distribution into 100 equal parts.

original_glossary_extracted: Perfect competition  A market structure in which the individ-ual firm has virtually no impact on market price, because it is assumed to be a very small seller among a very large number of firms selling essentially identical products.
definition_or_explanation: A market structure in which the individ-ual firm has virtually no impact on market price, because it is assumed to be a very small seller among a very large number of firms selling essentially identical products.

original_glossary_extracted: Perfectly elastic  When the quantity demanded or supplied of a given good is infinitely sensitive to a change in the value of a specified variable (e.g., price).
definition_or_explanation: When the quantity demanded or supplied of a given good is infinitely sensitive to a change in the value of a specified variable (e.g., price).

original_glossary_extracted: Perfectly inelastic  When the quantity demanded or supplied of a given good is completely insensitive to a change in the value of a specified variable (e.g., price).
definition_or_explanation: When the quantity demanded or supplied of a given good is completely insensitive to a change in the value of a specified variable (e.g., price).

original_glossary_extracted: Performance appraisal  The evaluation of risk-adjusted per-formance; the evaluation of investment skill.
definition_or_explanation: The evaluation of risk-adjusted per-formance; the evaluation of investment skill.

original_glossary_extracted: Performance bond  See margin bond.
definition_or_explanation: See margin bond.

original_glossary_extracted: Performance evaluation  The measurement and assessment of the outcomes of investment management decisions.
definition_or_explanation: The measurement and assessment of the outcomes of investment management decisions.

original_glossary_extracted: Performance fee  Fees paid to the general partner from the limited partner(s) based on realized profits.
definition_or_explanation: Fees paid to the general partner from the limited partner(s) based on realized profits.

original_glossary_extracted: Performance measurement  The calculation of returns in a logical and consistent manner.
definition_or_explanation: The calculation of returns in a logical and consistent manner.

original_glossary_extracted: Period costs  Costs (e.g., executives' salaries) that cannot be directly matched with the timing of revenues and which are thus expensed immediately.
definition_or_explanation: Costs (e.g., executives' salaries) that cannot be directly matched with the timing of revenues and which are thus expensed immediately.

original_glossary_extracted: Periodicity  The assumed number of periods in the year, typ-ically matches the frequency of coupon payments.
definition_or_explanation: The assumed number of periods in the year, typ-ically matches the frequency of coupon payments.

original_glossary_extracted: Permanent differences  Differences between tax and financial reporting of revenue (expenses) that will not be reversed at some future date. These result in a difference between the company's effective tax rate and statutory tax rate and do not result in a deferred tax item.
definition_or_explanation: Differences between tax and financial reporting of revenue (expenses) that will not be reversed at some future date. These result in a difference between the company's effective tax rate and statutory tax rate and do not result in a deferred tax item.

original_glossary_extracted: Permissioned networks  Networks that are fully open only to select participants on a DLT network.
definition_or_explanation: Networks that are fully open only to select participants on a DLT network.

original_glossary_extracted: Permissionless networks  Networks that are fully open to any user on a DLT network.
definition_or_explanation: Networks that are fully open to any user on a DLT network.

original_glossary_extracted: Permutation  An ordered listing.
definition_or_explanation: An ordered listing.

original_glossary_extracted: Perpetual bonds  Bonds with no stated maturity date.
definition_or_explanation: Bonds with no stated maturity date.

original_glossary_extracted: Perpetuity  A perpetual annuity, or a set of never-ending level sequential cash flows, with the first cash flow occurring one period from now. A bond that does not mature.
definition_or_explanation: A perpetual annuity, or a set of never-ending level sequential cash flows, with the first cash flow occurring one period from now. A bond that does not mature.

original_glossary_extracted: Personal consumption expenditures  All domestic personal consumption; the basis for a price index for such consump-tion called the PCE price index.
definition_or_explanation: All domestic personal consumption; the basis for a price index for such consump-tion called the PCE price index.

original_glossary_extracted: Personal disposable income  Equal to personal income less personal taxes.
definition_or_explanation: Equal to personal income less personal taxes.

original_glossary_extracted: Personal income  A broad measure of household income that includes all income received by households, whether earned or unearned; measures the ability of consumers to make purchases.
definition_or_explanation: A broad measure of household income that includes all income received by households, whether earned or unearned; measures the ability of consumers to make purchases.

original_glossary_extracted: Plain vanilla bond  Bond that makes periodic, fixed coupon payments during the bond's life and a lump-sum payment of principal at maturity. Also called conventional bond.
definition_or_explanation: Bond that makes periodic, fixed coupon payments during the bond's life and a lump-sum payment of principal at maturity. Also called conventional bond.

original_glossary_extracted: Platykurtic  Describes a distribution that has relatively less weight in the tails than the normal distribution.
definition_or_explanation: Describes a distribution that has relatively less weight in the tails than the normal distribution.

original_glossary_extracted: Point and figure chart  A technical analysis chart that is con-structed with columns of X's alternating with columns of O's such that the horizontal axis represents only the num-ber of changes in price without reference to time or volume.
definition_or_explanation: A technical analysis chart that is con-structed with columns of X's alternating with columns of O's such that the horizontal axis represents only the num-ber of changes in price without reference to time or volume.

original_glossary_extracted: Point estimate  A single numerical estimate of an unknown quantity, such as a population parameter.
definition_or_explanation: A single numerical estimate of an unknown quantity, such as a population parameter.

original_glossary_extracted: Point of sale (POS)  Systems that capture transaction data at the physical location in which the sale is made.
definition_or_explanation: Systems that capture transaction data at the physical location in which the sale is made.

original_glossary_extracted: Policy rate  An interest rate that a central bank sets and announces publicly; normally the rate at which it is willing to lend money to the commercial banks.
definition_or_explanation: An interest rate that a central bank sets and announces publicly; normally the rate at which it is willing to lend money to the commercial banks.

original_glossary_extracted: Population  All members of a specified group.
definition_or_explanation: All members of a specified group.

original_glossary_extracted: Population mean  The arithmetic mean value of a population; the arithmetic mean of all the observations or values in the population.
definition_or_explanation: The arithmetic mean value of a population; the arithmetic mean of all the observations or values in the population.

original_glossary_extracted: Population standard deviation  A measure of dispersion relating to a population in the same unit of measurement as the observations, calculated as the positive square root of the population variance.
definition_or_explanation: A measure of dispersion relating to a population in the same unit of measurement as the observations, calculated as the positive square root of the population variance.

original_glossary_extracted: Population variance  A measure of dispersion relating to a population, calculated as the mean of the squared devia-tions around the population mean.
definition_or_explanation: A measure of dispersion relating to a population, calculated as the mean of the squared devia-tions around the population mean.

original_glossary_extracted: Portfolio company  In private equity, the company in which the private equity fund is investing.
definition_or_explanation: In private equity, the company in which the private equity fund is investing.

original_glossary_extracted: Portfolio demand for money  The demand to hold specula-tive money balances based on the potential opportunities or risks that are inherent in other financial instruments.
definition_or_explanation: The demand to hold specula-tive money balances based on the potential opportunities or risks that are inherent in other financial instruments.

original_glossary_extracted: Portfolio planning  The process of creating a plan for building a portfolio that is expected to satisfy a client's investment objectives.
definition_or_explanation: The process of creating a plan for building a portfolio that is expected to satisfy a client's investment objectives.

original_glossary_extracted: Position  The quantity of an asset that an entity owns or owes.
definition_or_explanation: The quantity of an asset that an entity owns or owes.

original_glossary_extracted: Positive screening  An ESG implementation approach that seeks to identify companies that embrace desired ESG-related principles.
definition_or_explanation: An ESG implementation approach that seeks to identify companies that embrace desired ESG-related principles.

original_glossary_extracted: Posterior probability  An updated probability that reflects or comes after new information.
definition_or_explanation: An updated probability that reflects or comes after new information.

original_glossary_extracted: Potential GDP  The level of real GDP that can be produced at full employment; measures the productive capacity of the economy.
definition_or_explanation: The level of real GDP that can be produced at full employment; measures the productive capacity of the economy.

original_glossary_extracted: Power of a test  The probability of correctly rejecting the null-that is, rejecting the null hypothesis when it is false.
definition_or_explanation: The probability of correctly rejecting the null-that is, rejecting the null hypothesis when it is false.

original_glossary_extracted: Precautionary money balances  Money held to provide a buffer against unforeseen events that might require money.
definition_or_explanation: Money held to provide a buffer against unforeseen events that might require money.

original_glossary_extracted: Precautionary stocks  A level of inventory beyond anticipated needs that provides a cushion in the event that it takes longer to replenish inventory than expected or in the case of greater than expected demand.
definition_or_explanation: A level of inventory beyond anticipated needs that provides a cushion in the event that it takes longer to replenish inventory than expected or in the case of greater than expected demand.

original_glossary_extracted: Preference shares  A type of equity interest which ranks above common shares with respect to the payment of dividends and the distribution of the company's net assets upon liquidation. They have characteristics of both debt and equity securities. Also called preferred stock.
definition_or_explanation: A type of equity interest which ranks above common shares with respect to the payment of dividends and the distribution of the company's net assets upon liquidation. They have characteristics of both debt and equity securities. Also called preferred stock.

original_glossary_extracted: Preferred stock  See preference shares.
definition_or_explanation: See preference shares.

original_glossary_extracted: Premium  In the case of bonds, premium refers to the amount by which a bond is priced above its face (par) value. In the case of an option, the amount paid for the option contract.
definition_or_explanation: In the case of bonds, premium refers to the amount by which a bond is priced above its face (par) value. In the case of an option, the amount paid for the option contract.

original_glossary_extracted: Prepaid expense  A normal operating expense that has been paid in advance of when it is due.
definition_or_explanation: A normal operating expense that has been paid in advance of when it is due.

original_glossary_extracted: Prepayment option  Contractual provision that entitles the borrower to prepay all or part of the outstanding mortgage principal prior to the scheduled due date when the prin-cipal must be repaid. Also called early repayment option.
definition_or_explanation: Contractual provision that entitles the borrower to prepay all or part of the outstanding mortgage principal prior to the scheduled due date when the prin-cipal must be repaid. Also called early repayment option.

original_glossary_extracted: Prepayment penalty mortgages  Mortgages that stipulate a monetary penalty if a borrower prepays within a certain time period after the mortgage is originated.
definition_or_explanation: Mortgages that stipulate a monetary penalty if a borrower prepays within a certain time period after the mortgage is originated.

original_glossary_extracted: Prepayment risk  The uncertainty that the timing of the actual cash flows will be different from the scheduled cash flows as set forth in the loan agreement due to the borrowers' ability to alter payments, usually to take advantage of interest rate movements.
definition_or_explanation: The uncertainty that the timing of the actual cash flows will be different from the scheduled cash flows as set forth in the loan agreement due to the borrowers' ability to alter payments, usually to take advantage of interest rate movements.

original_glossary_extracted: Present value (PV)  The present discounted value of future cash flows: For assets, the present discounted value of the future net cash inflows that the asset is expected to generate; for liabilities, the present discounted value of the future net cash outflows that are expected to be required to settle the liabilities.
definition_or_explanation: The present discounted value of future cash flows: For assets, the present discounted value of the future net cash inflows that the asset is expected to generate; for liabilities, the present discounted value of the future net cash outflows that are expected to be required to settle the liabilities.

original_glossary_extracted: Present value models  Valuation models that estimate the intrinsic value of a security as the present value of the future benefits expected to be received from the security. Also called discounted cash flow models.
definition_or_explanation: Valuation models that estimate the intrinsic value of a security as the present value of the future benefits expected to be received from the security. Also called discounted cash flow models.

original_glossary_extracted: Pretax margin  A profitability ratio calculated as earnings before taxes divided by revenue.
definition_or_explanation: A profitability ratio calculated as earnings before taxes divided by revenue.

original_glossary_extracted: Price elasticity of demand  Measures the percentage change in the quantity demanded, given a percentage change in the price of a given product.
definition_or_explanation: Measures the percentage change in the quantity demanded, given a percentage change in the price of a given product.

original_glossary_extracted: Price index  Represents the average prices of a basket of goods and services.
definition_or_explanation: Represents the average prices of a basket of goods and services.

original_glossary_extracted: Price limits  Limits imposed by a futures exchange on the price change that can occur from one day to the next.
definition_or_explanation: Limits imposed by a futures exchange on the price change that can occur from one day to the next.

original_glossary_extracted: Price multiple  A ratio that compares the share price with some sort of monetary flow or value to allow evaluation of the relative worth of a company's stock.
definition_or_explanation: A ratio that compares the share price with some sort of monetary flow or value to allow evaluation of the relative worth of a company's stock.

original_glossary_extracted: Price priority  The principle that the highest priced buy orders and the lowest priced sell orders execute first.
definition_or_explanation: The principle that the highest priced buy orders and the lowest priced sell orders execute first.

original_glossary_extracted: Price relative  A ratio of an ending price over a beginning price; it is equal to 1 plus the holding period return on the asset.
definition_or_explanation: A ratio of an ending price over a beginning price; it is equal to 1 plus the holding period return on the asset.

original_glossary_extracted: Price return  Measures only the price appreciation or percent-age change in price of the securities in an index or portfolio.
definition_or_explanation: Measures only the price appreciation or percent-age change in price of the securities in an index or portfolio.

original_glossary_extracted: Price return index  An index that reflects only the price appre-ciation or percentage change in price of the constituent securities. Also called price index.
definition_or_explanation: An index that reflects only the price appre-ciation or percentage change in price of the constituent securities. Also called price index.

original_glossary_extracted: Price stability  In economics, refers to an inflation rate that is low on average and not subject to wide fluctuation.
definition_or_explanation: In economics, refers to an inflation rate that is low on average and not subject to wide fluctuation.

original_glossary_extracted: Price takers  Producers that must accept whatever price the market dictates.
definition_or_explanation: Producers that must accept whatever price the market dictates.

original_glossary_extracted: Price to book value  A valuation ratio calculated as price per share divided by book value per share.
definition_or_explanation: A valuation ratio calculated as price per share divided by book value per share.

original_glossary_extracted: Price to cash flow  A valuation ratio calculated as price per share divided by cash flow per share.
definition_or_explanation: A valuation ratio calculated as price per share divided by cash flow per share.

original_glossary_extracted: Price to earnings ratio  (P/E ratio or P/E) The ratio of share price to earnings per share.
definition_or_explanation: (P/E ratio or P/E) The ratio of share price to earnings per share.

original_glossary_extracted: Price to sales  A valuation ratio calculated as price per share divided by sales per share.
definition_or_explanation: A valuation ratio calculated as price per share divided by sales per share.

original_glossary_extracted: Price value of a basis point  A version of money duration, it is an estimate of the change in the full price of a bond given a 1 basis point change in the yield-to-maturity.
key_phrase: Price value of a basis point
definition_or_explanation: A version of money duration, it is an estimate of the change in the full price of a bond given a 1 basis point change in the yield-to-maturity.

original_glossary_extracted: Price weighting  An index weighting method in which the weight assigned to each constituent security is determined by dividing its price by the sum of all the prices of the constituent securities.
definition_or_explanation: An index weighting method in which the weight assigned to each constituent security is determined by dividing its price by the sum of all the prices of the constituent securities.

original_glossary_extracted: Priced risk  Risk for which investors demand compensation for bearing (e.g. equity risk, company-specific factors, macroeconomic factors).
definition_or_explanation: Risk for which investors demand compensation for bearing (e.g. equity risk, company-specific factors, macroeconomic factors).

original_glossary_extracted: Primary bond markets  Markets in which issuers first sell bonds to investors to raise capital.
definition_or_explanation: Markets in which issuers first sell bonds to investors to raise capital.

original_glossary_extracted: Primary capital markets (primary markets)  The market where securities are first sold and the issuers receive the proceeds.
definition_or_explanation: The market where securities are first sold and the issuers receive the proceeds.

original_glossary_extracted: Primary dealers  Financial institutions that are authorized to deal in new issues of sovereign bonds and that serve primarily as trading counterparties of the office responsible for issuing sovereign bonds.
definition_or_explanation: Financial institutions that are authorized to deal in new issues of sovereign bonds and that serve primarily as trading counterparties of the office responsible for issuing sovereign bonds.

original_glossary_extracted: Primary market  The market where securities are first sold and the issuers receive the proceeds.
definition_or_explanation: The market where securities are first sold and the issuers receive the proceeds.

original_glossary_extracted: Prime brokers  Brokers that provide services including custody, administration, lending, short borrowing, and trading.
definition_or_explanation: Brokers that provide services including custody, administration, lending, short borrowing, and trading.

original_glossary_extracted: Principal  The amount of funds originally invested in a project or instrument; the face value to be paid at maturity.
definition_or_explanation: The amount of funds originally invested in a project or instrument; the face value to be paid at maturity.

original_glossary_extracted: Principal-agent relationship  A relationship in which a prin-cipal hires an agent to perform a particular task or service; also known as an agency relationship.
definition_or_explanation: A relationship in which a prin-cipal hires an agent to perform a particular task or service; also known as an agency relationship.

original_glossary_extracted: Principal amount  Amount that an issuer agrees to repay the debt holders on the maturity date.
definition_or_explanation: Amount that an issuer agrees to repay the debt holders on the maturity date.

original_glossary_extracted: Principal business activity  The business activity from which a company derives a majority of its revenues and/or earnings.
definition_or_explanation: The business activity from which a company derives a majority of its revenues and/or earnings.

original_glossary_extracted: Principal value  Amount that an issuer agrees to repay the debt holders on the maturity date.
definition_or_explanation: Amount that an issuer agrees to repay the debt holders on the maturity date.

original_glossary_extracted: Principle of no arbitrage  See arbitrage-free pricing.
definition_or_explanation: See arbitrage-free pricing.

original_glossary_extracted: Prior probabilities  Probabilities reflecting beliefs prior to the arrival of new information.
definition_or_explanation: Probabilities reflecting beliefs prior to the arrival of new information.

original_glossary_extracted: Priority of claims  Priority of payment, with the most senior or highest ranking debt having the first claim on the cash flows and assets of the issuer.
definition_or_explanation: Priority of payment, with the most senior or highest ranking debt having the first claim on the cash flows and assets of the issuer.

original_glossary_extracted: Private equity securities  Securities that are not listed on public exchanges and have no active secondary market. They are issued primarily to institutional investors via non-public offerings, such as private placements.
definition_or_explanation: Securities that are not listed on public exchanges and have no active secondary market. They are issued primarily to institutional investors via non-public offerings, such as private placements.

original_glossary_extracted: Private investment in public equity  An investment in the equity of a publicly traded firm that is made at a discount to the market value of the firm's shares.
definition_or_explanation: An investment in the equity of a publicly traded firm that is made at a discount to the market value of the firm's shares.

original_glossary_extracted: Private placement  Typically a non-underwritten, unregis-tered offering of securities that are sold only to an inves-tor or a small group of investors. It can be accomplished directly between the issuer and the investor(s) or through an investment bank.
definition_or_explanation: Typically a non-underwritten, unregis-tered offering of securities that are sold only to an inves-tor or a small group of investors. It can be accomplished directly between the issuer and the investor(s) or through an investment bank.

original_glossary_extracted: Probability  A number between 0 and 1 describing the chance that a stated event will occur.
definition_or_explanation: A number between 0 and 1 describing the chance that a stated event will occur.

original_glossary_extracted: Probability density function  A function with non-negative values such that probability can be described by areas under the curve graphing the function.
definition_or_explanation: A function with non-negative values such that probability can be described by areas under the curve graphing the function.

original_glossary_extracted: Probability distribution  A distribution that specifies the probabilities of a random variable's possible outcomes.
definition_or_explanation: A distribution that specifies the probabilities of a random variable's possible outcomes.

original_glossary_extracted: Probability function  A function that specifies the probability that the random variable takes on a specific value.
definition_or_explanation: A function that specifies the probability that the random variable takes on a specific value.

original_glossary_extracted: Producer price index  Reflects the price changes experienced by domestic producers in a country.
definition_or_explanation: Reflects the price changes experienced by domestic producers in a country.

original_glossary_extracted: Production function  Provides the quantitative link between the level of output that the economy can produce and the inputs used in the production process.
definition_or_explanation: Provides the quantitative link between the level of output that the economy can produce and the inputs used in the production process.

original_glossary_extracted: Productivity  The amount of output produced by workers in a given period of time-for example, output per hour worked; measures the efficiency of labor.
definition_or_explanation: The amount of output produced by workers in a given period of time-for example, output per hour worked; measures the efficiency of labor.

original_glossary_extracted: Profit  The return that owners of a company receive for the use of their capital and the assumption of financial risk when making their investments.
definition_or_explanation: The return that owners of a company receive for the use of their capital and the assumption of financial risk when making their investments.

original_glossary_extracted: Profit and loss (P&L) statement  A financial statement that provides information about a company's profitability over a stated period of time.
definition_or_explanation: A financial statement that provides information about a company's profitability over a stated period of time.

original_glossary_extracted: Profit margin  An indicator of profitability, calculated as net income divided by revenue; indicates how much of each dollar of revenues is left after all costs and expenses.
definition_or_explanation: An indicator of profitability, calculated as net income divided by revenue; indicates how much of each dollar of revenues is left after all costs and expenses.

original_glossary_extracted: Profitability ratios  Ratios that measure a company's ability to generate profitable sales from its resources (assets).
definition_or_explanation: Ratios that measure a company's ability to generate profitable sales from its resources (assets).

original_glossary_extracted: Project sequencing  To defer the decision to invest in a future project until the outcome of some or all of a current project is known. Projects are sequenced through time, so that investing in a project creates the option to invest in future projects.
definition_or_explanation: To defer the decision to invest in a future project until the outcome of some or all of a current project is known. Projects are sequenced through time, so that investing in a project creates the option to invest in future projects.

original_glossary_extracted: Promissory note  A written promise to pay a certain amount of money on demand.
definition_or_explanation: A written promise to pay a certain amount of money on demand.

original_glossary_extracted: Property, plant, and equipment  Tangible assets that are expected to be used for more than one period in either the production or supply of goods or services, or for admin-istrative purposes.
definition_or_explanation: Tangible assets that are expected to be used for more than one period in either the production or supply of goods or services, or for admin-istrative purposes.

original_glossary_extracted: Prospectus  The document that describes the terms of a new bond issue and helps investors perform their analysis on the issue.
definition_or_explanation: The document that describes the terms of a new bond issue and helps investors perform their analysis on the issue.

original_glossary_extracted: Protective put  An option strategy in which a long position in an asset is combined with a long position in a put.
definition_or_explanation: An option strategy in which a long position in an asset is combined with a long position in a put.

original_glossary_extracted: Proxy contest  Corporate takeover mechanism in which shareholders are persuaded to vote for a group seeking a controlling position on a company's board of directors.
definition_or_explanation: Corporate takeover mechanism in which shareholders are persuaded to vote for a group seeking a controlling position on a company's board of directors.

original_glossary_extracted: Proxy voting  A process that enables shareholders who are unable to attend a meeting to authorize another individual to vote on their behalf.
definition_or_explanation: A process that enables shareholders who are unable to attend a meeting to authorize another individual to vote on their behalf.

original_glossary_extracted: Pseudo-random numbers  Numbers produced by random number generators.
definition_or_explanation: Numbers produced by random number generators.

original_glossary_extracted: Public offer  See public offering.
definition_or_explanation: See public offering.

original_glossary_extracted: Public offering  An offering of securities in which any member of the public may buy the securities. Also called public offer.
definition_or_explanation: An offering of securities in which any member of the public may buy the securities. Also called public offer.

original_glossary_extracted: Pull on liquidity  When disbursements are paid too quickly or trade credit availability is limited, requiring companies to expend funds before they receive funds from sales that could cover the liability.
definition_or_explanation: When disbursements are paid too quickly or trade credit availability is limited, requiring companies to expend funds before they receive funds from sales that could cover the liability.

original_glossary_extracted: Pure discount bonds  See zero-coupon bonds.
definition_or_explanation: See zero-coupon bonds.

original_glossary_extracted: Pure discount instruments  Instruments that pay interest as the difference between the amount borrowed and the amount paid back.
definition_or_explanation: Instruments that pay interest as the difference between the amount borrowed and the amount paid back.

original_glossary_extracted: Pure-play method  A method for estimating the beta for a company or project; it requires using a comparable compa-ny's beta and adjusting it for financial leverage differences.
definition_or_explanation: A method for estimating the beta for a company or project; it requires using a comparable compa-ny's beta and adjusting it for financial leverage differences.

original_glossary_extracted: Put  An option that gives the holder the right to sell an under-lying asset to another party at a fixed price over a specific period of time.
definition_or_explanation: An option that gives the holder the right to sell an under-lying asset to another party at a fixed price over a specific period of time.

original_glossary_extracted: Put-call-forward parity  The relationship among puts, calls, and forward contracts.
definition_or_explanation: The relationship among puts, calls, and forward contracts.

original_glossary_extracted: Put-call parity  An equation expressing the equivalence (par-ity) of a portfolio of a call and a bond with a portfolio of a put and the underlying, which leads to the relationship between put and call prices.
definition_or_explanation: An equation expressing the equivalence (par-ity) of a portfolio of a call and a bond with a portfolio of a put and the underlying, which leads to the relationship between put and call prices.

original_glossary_extracted: Put/call ratio  A technical analysis indicator that evaluates market sentiment based upon the volume of put options traded divided by the volume of call options traded for a particular financial instrument.
definition_or_explanation: A technical analysis indicator that evaluates market sentiment based upon the volume of put options traded divided by the volume of call options traded for a particular financial instrument.

original_glossary_extracted: Put option  An option that gives the holder the right to sell an underlying asset to another party at a fixed price over a specific period of time.
definition_or_explanation: An option that gives the holder the right to sell an underlying asset to another party at a fixed price over a specific period of time.

original_glossary_extracted: Putable bonds  Bonds that give the bondholder the right to sell the bond back to the issuer at a predetermined price on specified dates.
definition_or_explanation: Bonds that give the bondholder the right to sell the bond back to the issuer at a predetermined price on specified dates.

original_glossary_extracted: Putable common shares  Common shares that give investors the option (or right) to sell their shares (i.e., "put" them) back to the issuing company at a price that is specified when the shares are originally issued.
definition_or_explanation: Common shares that give investors the option (or right) to sell their shares (i.e., "put" them) back to the issuing company at a price that is specified when the shares are originally issued.

original_glossary_extracted: Quantile  A value at or below which a stated fraction of the data lies. Also called fractile.
definition_or_explanation: A value at or below which a stated fraction of the data lies. Also called fractile.

original_glossary_extracted: Quantitative easing  An expansionary monetary policy based on aggressive open market purchase operations.
definition_or_explanation: An expansionary monetary policy based on aggressive open market purchase operations.

original_glossary_extracted: Quantity equation of exchange  An expression that over a given period, the amount of money used to purchase all goods and services in an economy, M × V, is equal to monetary value of this output, P × Y.
definition_or_explanation: An expression that over a given period, the amount of money used to purchase all goods and services in an economy, M × V, is equal to monetary value of this output, P × Y.

original_glossary_extracted: Quantity theory of money  Asserts that total spending (in money terms) is proportional to the quantity of money.
definition_or_explanation: Asserts that total spending (in money terms) is proportional to the quantity of money.

original_glossary_extracted: Quartiles  Quantiles that divide a distribution into four equal parts.
definition_or_explanation: Quantiles that divide a distribution into four equal parts.

original_glossary_extracted: Quasi-fixed cost  A cost that stays the same over a range of production but can change to another constant level when production moves outside of that range.
definition_or_explanation: A cost that stays the same over a range of production but can change to another constant level when production moves outside of that range.

original_glossary_extracted: Quasi-government bonds  A bond issued by an entity that is either owned or sponsored by a national government. Also called agency bond.
definition_or_explanation: A bond issued by an entity that is either owned or sponsored by a national government. Also called agency bond.

original_glossary_extracted: Quick assets  Assets that can be most readily converted to cash (e.g., cash, short-term marketable investments, receivables).
definition_or_explanation: Assets that can be most readily converted to cash (e.g., cash, short-term marketable investments, receivables).

original_glossary_extracted: Quick ratio  A stringent measure of liquidity that indicates a company's ability to satisfy current liabilities with its most liquid assets, calculated as (cash + short-term marketable investments + receivables) divided by current liabilities.
definition_or_explanation: A stringent measure of liquidity that indicates a company's ability to satisfy current liabilities with its most liquid assets, calculated as (cash + short-term marketable investments + receivables) divided by current liabilities.

original_glossary_extracted: Quintiles  Quantiles that divide a distribution into five equal parts.
definition_or_explanation: Quantiles that divide a distribution into five equal parts.

original_glossary_extracted: Quota rents  Profits that foreign producers can earn by raising the price of their goods higher than they would without a quota.
definition_or_explanation: Profits that foreign producers can earn by raising the price of their goods higher than they would without a quota.

original_glossary_extracted: Quotas  Government policies that restrict the quantity of a good that can be imported into a country, generally for a specified period of time.
definition_or_explanation: Government policies that restrict the quantity of a good that can be imported into a country, generally for a specified period of time.

original_glossary_extracted: Quote-driven market  A market in which dealers acting as principals facilitate trading.
definition_or_explanation: A market in which dealers acting as principals facilitate trading.

original_glossary_extracted: Quoted interest rate  A quoted interest rate that does not account for compounding within the year. Also called stated annual interest rate.
definition_or_explanation: A quoted interest rate that does not account for compounding within the year. Also called stated annual interest rate.

original_glossary_extracted: Quoted margin  The specified yield spread over the reference rate, used to compensate an investor for the difference in the credit risk of the issuer and that implied by the reference rate.
definition_or_explanation: The specified yield spread over the reference rate, used to compensate an investor for the difference in the credit risk of the issuer and that implied by the reference rate.

original_glossary_extracted: Random number  An observation drawn from a uniform distribution.
definition_or_explanation: An observation drawn from a uniform distribution.

original_glossary_extracted: Random number generator  An algorithm that produces uniformly distributed random numbers between 0 and 1.
definition_or_explanation: An algorithm that produces uniformly distributed random numbers between 0 and 1.

original_glossary_extracted: Random variable  A quantity whose future outcomes are uncertain.
definition_or_explanation: A quantity whose future outcomes are uncertain.

original_glossary_extracted: Range  The difference between the maximum and minimum values in a dataset.
definition_or_explanation: The difference between the maximum and minimum values in a dataset.

original_glossary_extracted: Ratio scales  A measurement scale that has all the character-istics of interval measurement scales as well as a true zero point as the origin.
definition_or_explanation: A measurement scale that has all the character-istics of interval measurement scales as well as a true zero point as the origin.

original_glossary_extracted: Real GDP  The value of goods and services produced, measured at base year prices.
definition_or_explanation: The value of goods and services produced, measured at base year prices.

original_glossary_extracted: Real income  Income adjusted for the effect of inflation on the purchasing power of money. Also known as the purchasing power of income. If income remains constant and a good's price falls, real income is said to rise, even though the num-ber of monetary units (e.g., dollars) remains unchanged.
definition_or_explanation: Income adjusted for the effect of inflation on the purchasing power of money. Also known as the purchasing power of income. If income remains constant and a good's price falls, real income is said to rise, even though the num-ber of monetary units (e.g., dollars) remains unchanged.

original_glossary_extracted: Real interest rate  Nominal interest rate minus the expected rate of inflation.
definition_or_explanation: Nominal interest rate minus the expected rate of inflation.

original_glossary_extracted: Real risk-free interest rate  The single-period interest rate for a completely risk-free security if no inflation were expected.
definition_or_explanation: The single-period interest rate for a completely risk-free security if no inflation were expected.

original_glossary_extracted: Realizable (settlement) value  With reference to assets, the amount of cash or cash equivalents that could currently be obtained by selling the asset in an orderly disposal; with reference to liabilities, the undiscounted amount of cash or cash equivalents expected to be paid to satisfy the liabilities in the normal course of business.
definition_or_explanation: With reference to assets, the amount of cash or cash equivalents that could currently be obtained by selling the asset in an orderly disposal; with reference to liabilities, the undiscounted amount of cash or cash equivalents expected to be paid to satisfy the liabilities in the normal course of business.

original_glossary_extracted: Rebalancing  Adjusting the weights of the constituent secu-rities in an index.
definition_or_explanation: Adjusting the weights of the constituent secu-rities in an index.

original_glossary_extracted: Rebalancing policy  The set of rules that guide the process of restoring a portfolio's asset class weights to those specified in the strategic asset allocation.
definition_or_explanation: The set of rules that guide the process of restoring a portfolio's asset class weights to those specified in the strategic asset allocation.

original_glossary_extracted: Recession  A period during which real GDP decreases (i.e., negative growth) for at least two successive quarters, or a period of significant decline in total output, income, employment, and sales usually lasting from six months to a year.
definition_or_explanation: A period during which real GDP decreases (i.e., negative growth) for at least two successive quarters, or a period of significant decline in total output, income, employment, and sales usually lasting from six months to a year.

original_glossary_extracted: Recognition lag  The lag in government response to an eco-nomic problem resulting from the delay in confirming a change in the state of the economy.
definition_or_explanation: The lag in government response to an eco-nomic problem resulting from the delay in confirming a change in the state of the economy.

original_glossary_extracted: Recourse loan  Loan in which the lender has a claim against the borrower for any shortfall between the outstanding mortgage balance and the proceeds received from the sale of the property.
definition_or_explanation: Loan in which the lender has a claim against the borrower for any shortfall between the outstanding mortgage balance and the proceeds received from the sale of the property.

original_glossary_extracted: Redemption yield  See yield to maturity.
definition_or_explanation: See yield to maturity.

original_glossary_extracted: Redemptions  Withdrawals of funds by investors.
definition_or_explanation: Withdrawals of funds by investors.

original_glossary_extracted: Refinancing rate  A type of central bank policy rate.
definition_or_explanation: A type of central bank policy rate.

original_glossary_extracted: Registered bonds  Bonds for which ownership is recorded by either name or serial number.
definition_or_explanation: Bonds for which ownership is recorded by either name or serial number.

original_glossary_extracted: Relative dispersion  The amount of dispersion relative to a reference value or benchmark.
definition_or_explanation: The amount of dispersion relative to a reference value or benchmark.

original_glossary_extracted: Relative frequency  With reference to an interval of grouped data, the number of observations in the interval divided by the total number of observations in the sample.
definition_or_explanation: With reference to an interval of grouped data, the number of observations in the interval divided by the total number of observations in the sample.

original_glossary_extracted: Relative price  The price of a specific good or service in com-parison with those of other goods and services.
definition_or_explanation: The price of a specific good or service in com-parison with those of other goods and services.

original_glossary_extracted: Relative strength analysis  A comparison of the performance of one asset with the performance of another asset or a benchmark based on changes in the ratio of the securities' respective prices over time.
definition_or_explanation: A comparison of the performance of one asset with the performance of another asset or a benchmark based on changes in the ratio of the securities' respective prices over time.

original_glossary_extracted: Relative strength index  A technical analysis momentum oscillator that compares a security's gains with its losses over a set period.
definition_or_explanation: A technical analysis momentum oscillator that compares a security's gains with its losses over a set period.

original_glossary_extracted: Renewable resources  Resources that can be replenished, such as a forest.
definition_or_explanation: Resources that can be replenished, such as a forest.

original_glossary_extracted: Rent  Payment for the use of property.
definition_or_explanation: Payment for the use of property.

original_glossary_extracted: Reorganization  Agreements made by a company in bank-ruptcy under which a company's capital structure is altered and/or alternative arrangements are made for debt repay-ment; US Chapter 11 bankruptcy. The company emerges from bankruptcy as a going concern.
definition_or_explanation: Agreements made by a company in bank-ruptcy under which a company's capital structure is altered and/or alternative arrangements are made for debt repay-ment; US Chapter 11 bankruptcy. The company emerges from bankruptcy as a going concern.

original_glossary_extracted: Replication  The creation of an asset or portfolio from another asset, portfolio, and/or derivative.
definition_or_explanation: The creation of an asset or portfolio from another asset, portfolio, and/or derivative.

original_glossary_extracted: Repo  A form of collateralized loan involving the sale of a security with a simultaneous agreement by the seller to buy the same security back from the purchaser at an agreed-on price and future date. The party who sells the security at the inception of the repurchase agreement and buys it back at maturity is borrowing money from the other party, and the security sold and subsequently repurchased represents the collateral.
definition_or_explanation: A form of collateralized loan involving the sale of a security with a simultaneous agreement by the seller to buy the same security back from the purchaser at an agreed-on price and future date. The party who sells the security at the inception of the repurchase agreement and buys it back at maturity is borrowing money from the other party, and the security sold and subsequently repurchased represents the collateral.

original_glossary_extracted: Repo margin  The difference between the market value of the security used as collateral and the value of the loan. Also called haircut.
definition_or_explanation: The difference between the market value of the security used as collateral and the value of the loan. Also called haircut.

original_glossary_extracted: Repo rate  The interest rate on a repurchase agreement.
definition_or_explanation: The interest rate on a repurchase agreement.

original_glossary_extracted: Repurchase agreement  A form of collateralized loan involv-ing the sale of a security with a simultaneous agreement by the seller to buy the same security back from the purchaser at an agreed-on price and future date. The party who sells the security at the inception of the repurchase agreement and buys it back at maturity is borrowing money from the other party, and the security sold and subsequently repurchased represents the collateral.
definition_or_explanation: A form of collateralized loan involv-ing the sale of a security with a simultaneous agreement by the seller to buy the same security back from the purchaser at an agreed-on price and future date. The party who sells the security at the inception of the repurchase agreement and buys it back at maturity is borrowing money from the other party, and the security sold and subsequently repurchased represents the collateral.

original_glossary_extracted: Repurchase date  The date when the party who sold the secu-rity at the inception of a repurchase agreement buys the security back from the cash lending counterparty.
definition_or_explanation: The date when the party who sold the secu-rity at the inception of a repurchase agreement buys the security back from the cash lending counterparty.

original_glossary_extracted: Repurchase price  The price at which the party who sold the security at the inception of the repurchase agreement buys the security back from the cash lending counterparty.
definition_or_explanation: The price at which the party who sold the security at the inception of the repurchase agreement buys the security back from the cash lending counterparty.

original_glossary_extracted: Required margin  The yield spread over, or under, the ref-erence rate such that an FRN is priced at par value on a rate reset date.
definition_or_explanation: The yield spread over, or under, the ref-erence rate such that an FRN is priced at par value on a rate reset date.

original_glossary_extracted: Required rate of return  See market discount rate.
definition_or_explanation: See market discount rate.

original_glossary_extracted: Required yield  See market discount rate.
definition_or_explanation: See market discount rate.

original_glossary_extracted: Required yield spread  The difference between the yield-to-maturity on a new bond and the benchmark rate; additional compensation required by investors for the difference in risk and tax status of a bond relative to a government bond. Sometimes called the spread over the benchmark.
definition_or_explanation: The difference between the yield-to-maturity on a new bond and the benchmark rate; additional compensation required by investors for the difference in risk and tax status of a bond relative to a government bond. Sometimes called the spread over the benchmark.

original_glossary_extracted: Reserve accounts  Form of internal credit enhancement that relies on creating accounts and depositing in these accounts cash that can be used to absorb losses. Also called reserve funds.
definition_or_explanation: Form of internal credit enhancement that relies on creating accounts and depositing in these accounts cash that can be used to absorb losses. Also called reserve funds.

original_glossary_extracted: Reserve funds  See reserve accounts.
definition_or_explanation: See reserve accounts.

original_glossary_extracted: Reserve requirement  The requirement for banks to hold reserves in proportion to the size of deposits.
definition_or_explanation: The requirement for banks to hold reserves in proportion to the size of deposits.

original_glossary_extracted: Resistance  In technical analysis, a price range in which selling activity is sufficient to stop the rise in the price of a security.
definition_or_explanation: In technical analysis, a price range in which selling activity is sufficient to stop the rise in the price of a security.

original_glossary_extracted: Responsible investing  The practice of identifying companies that can efficiently manage their financial, environmental, and human capital resoruces to generate attractive long-term profitability; often synonymous with sustainable investing.
definition_or_explanation: The practice of identifying companies that can efficiently manage their financial, environmental, and human capital resoruces to generate attractive long-term profitability; often synonymous with sustainable investing.

original_glossary_extracted: Restricted payments  A bond covenant meant to protect creditors by limiting how much cash can be paid out to shareholders over time.
definition_or_explanation: A bond covenant meant to protect creditors by limiting how much cash can be paid out to shareholders over time.

original_glossary_extracted: Retail method  An inventory accounting method in which the sales value of an item is reduced by the gross margin to calculate the item's cost.
definition_or_explanation: An inventory accounting method in which the sales value of an item is reduced by the gross margin to calculate the item's cost.

original_glossary_extracted: Retracement  In technical analysis, a reversal in the movement of a security's price such that it is counter to the prevailing longerterm price trend.
definition_or_explanation: In technical analysis, a reversal in the movement of a security's price such that it is counter to the prevailing longerterm price trend.

original_glossary_extracted: Return-generating model  A model that can provide an esti-mate of the expected return of a security given certain parameters and estimates of the values of the independent variables in the model.
definition_or_explanation: A model that can provide an esti-mate of the expected return of a security given certain parameters and estimates of the values of the independent variables in the model.

original_glossary_extracted: Return on assets (ROA)  A profitability ratio calculated as net income divided by average total assets; indicates a compa-ny's net profit generated per dollar invested in total assets.
definition_or_explanation: A profitability ratio calculated as net income divided by average total assets; indicates a compa-ny's net profit generated per dollar invested in total assets.

original_glossary_extracted: Return on equity (ROE)  A profitability ratio calculated as net income divided by average shareholders' equity.
definition_or_explanation: A profitability ratio calculated as net income divided by average shareholders' equity.

original_glossary_extracted: Return on sales  An indicator of profitability, calculated as net income divided by revenue; indicates how much of each dollar of revenues is left after all costs and expenses.
definition_or_explanation: An indicator of profitability, calculated as net income divided by revenue; indicates how much of each dollar of revenues is left after all costs and expenses.

original_glossary_extracted: Return on total capital  A profitability ratio calculated as EBIT divided by the sum of short-and long-term debt and equity.
definition_or_explanation: A profitability ratio calculated as EBIT divided by the sum of short-and long-term debt and equity.

original_glossary_extracted: Revaluation model  The process of valuing long-lived assets at fair value, rather than at cost less accumulated depreciation. Any resulting profit or loss is either reported on the income statement and/or through equity under revaluation surplus.
definition_or_explanation: The process of valuing long-lived assets at fair value, rather than at cost less accumulated depreciation. Any resulting profit or loss is either reported on the income statement and/or through equity under revaluation surplus.

original_glossary_extracted: Revenue  The amount charged for the delivery of goods or services in the ordinary activities of a business over a stated period; the inflows of economic resources to a company over a stated period.
definition_or_explanation: The amount charged for the delivery of goods or services in the ordinary activities of a business over a stated period; the inflows of economic resources to a company over a stated period.

original_glossary_extracted: Reversal patterns  A type of pattern used in technical analysis to predict the end of a trend and a change in direction of the security's price.
definition_or_explanation: A type of pattern used in technical analysis to predict the end of a trend and a change in direction of the security's price.

original_glossary_extracted: Reverse repo  A repurchase agreement viewed from the per-spective of the cash lending counterparty.
definition_or_explanation: A repurchase agreement viewed from the per-spective of the cash lending counterparty.

original_glossary_extracted: Reverse repurchase agreement  A repurchase agree-ment viewed from the perspective of the cash lending counterparty.
definition_or_explanation: A repurchase agree-ment viewed from the perspective of the cash lending counterparty.

original_glossary_extracted: Reverse stock split  A reduction in the number of shares outstanding with a corresponding increase in share price, but no change to the company's underlying fundamentals.
definition_or_explanation: A reduction in the number of shares outstanding with a corresponding increase in share price, but no change to the company's underlying fundamentals.

original_glossary_extracted: Revolving credit agreements  The strongest form of short-term bank borrowing facilities; they are in effect for multi-ple years (e.g., 3-5 years) and may have optional medium-term loan features.
definition_or_explanation: The strongest form of short-term bank borrowing facilities; they are in effect for multi-ple years (e.g., 3-5 years) and may have optional medium-term loan features.

original_glossary_extracted: Rho  The sensitivity of the option price to the risk-free rate.
definition_or_explanation: The sensitivity of the option price to the risk-free rate.

original_glossary_extracted: Ricardian equivalence  An economic theory that implies that it makes no difference whether a government finances a deficit by increasing taxes or issuing debt.
definition_or_explanation: An economic theory that implies that it makes no difference whether a government finances a deficit by increasing taxes or issuing debt.

original_glossary_extracted: Risk  Exposure to uncertainty. The chance of a loss or adverse outcome as a result of an action, inaction, or external event.
definition_or_explanation: Exposure to uncertainty. The chance of a loss or adverse outcome as a result of an action, inaction, or external event.

original_glossary_extracted: Risk averse  The assumption that an investor will choose the least risky alternative.
definition_or_explanation: The assumption that an investor will choose the least risky alternative.

original_glossary_extracted: Risk aversion  The degree of an investor's inability and unwill-ingness to take risk.
definition_or_explanation: The degree of an investor's inability and unwill-ingness to take risk.

original_glossary_extracted: Risk budgeting  The establishment of objectives for individ-uals, groups, or divisions of an organization that takes into account the allocation of an acceptable level of risk.
definition_or_explanation: The establishment of objectives for individ-uals, groups, or divisions of an organization that takes into account the allocation of an acceptable level of risk.

original_glossary_extracted: Risk exposure  The state of being exposed or vulnerable to a risk. The extent to which an entity is sensitive to under-lying risks.
definition_or_explanation: The state of being exposed or vulnerable to a risk. The extent to which an entity is sensitive to under-lying risks.

original_glossary_extracted: Risk governance  The top-down process and guidance that directs risk management activities to align with and support the overall enterprise.
definition_or_explanation: The top-down process and guidance that directs risk management activities to align with and support the overall enterprise.

original_glossary_extracted: Risk management  The process of identifying the level of risk an entity wants, measuring the level of risk the entity currently has, taking actions that bring the actual level of risk to the desired level of risk, and monitoring the new actual level of risk so that it continues to be aligned with the desired level of risk.
definition_or_explanation: The process of identifying the level of risk an entity wants, measuring the level of risk the entity currently has, taking actions that bring the actual level of risk to the desired level of risk, and monitoring the new actual level of risk so that it continues to be aligned with the desired level of risk.

original_glossary_extracted: Risk management framework  The infrastructure, process, and analytics needed to support effective risk management in an organization.
definition_or_explanation: The infrastructure, process, and analytics needed to support effective risk management in an organization.

original_glossary_extracted: Risk-neutral pricing  Sometimes said of derivatives pricing, uses the fact that arbitrage opportunities guarantee that a risk-free portfolio consisting of the underlying and the derivative must earn the risk-free rate.
definition_or_explanation: Sometimes said of derivatives pricing, uses the fact that arbitrage opportunities guarantee that a risk-free portfolio consisting of the underlying and the derivative must earn the risk-free rate.

original_glossary_extracted: Risk-neutral probabilities  Weights that are used to compute a binomial option price. They are the probabilities that would apply if a risk-neutral investor valued an option.
definition_or_explanation: Weights that are used to compute a binomial option price. They are the probabilities that would apply if a risk-neutral investor valued an option.

original_glossary_extracted: Risk premium  An extra return expected by investors for bearing some specified risk.
definition_or_explanation: An extra return expected by investors for bearing some specified risk.

original_glossary_extracted: Risk shifting  Actions to change the distribution of risk outcomes.
definition_or_explanation: Actions to change the distribution of risk outcomes.

original_glossary_extracted: Risk tolerance  The amount of risk an investor is willing and able to bear to achieve an investment goal.
definition_or_explanation: The amount of risk an investor is willing and able to bear to achieve an investment goal.

original_glossary_extracted: Risk transfer  Actions to pass on a risk to another party, often, but not always, in the form of an insurance policy.
definition_or_explanation: Actions to pass on a risk to another party, often, but not always, in the form of an insurance policy.

original_glossary_extracted: Robo-adviser  A machine-based analytical tool or service that provides technology-driven investment solutions through online platforms.
definition_or_explanation: A machine-based analytical tool or service that provides technology-driven investment solutions through online platforms.

original_glossary_extracted: Robust  The quality of being relatively unaffected by a violation of assumptions.
definition_or_explanation: The quality of being relatively unaffected by a violation of assumptions.

original_glossary_extracted: Rule of 72  The principle that the approximate number of years necessary for an investment to double is 72 divided by the stated interest rate.
definition_or_explanation: The principle that the approximate number of years necessary for an investment to double is 72 divided by the stated interest rate.

original_glossary_extracted: Running yield  See current yield.
definition_or_explanation: See current yield.

original_glossary_extracted: Safety-first rules  Rules for portfolio selection that focus on the risk that portfolio value will fall below some minimum acceptable level over some time horizon.
definition_or_explanation: Rules for portfolio selection that focus on the risk that portfolio value will fall below some minimum acceptable level over some time horizon.

original_glossary_extracted: Safety stock  A level of inventory beyond anticipated needs that provides a cushion in the event that it takes longer to replenish inventory than expected or in the case of greater than expected demand.
definition_or_explanation: A level of inventory beyond anticipated needs that provides a cushion in the event that it takes longer to replenish inventory than expected or in the case of greater than expected demand.

original_glossary_extracted: Sales  Generally, a synonym for revenue; "sales" is generally understood to refer to the sale of goods, whereas "revenue" is understood to include the sale of goods or services.
definition_or_explanation: Generally, a synonym for revenue; "sales" is generally understood to refer to the sale of goods, whereas "revenue" is understood to include the sale of goods or services.
