original_glossary_extracted: Sales risk  Uncertainty with respect to the quantity of goods and services that a company is able to sell and the price it is able to achieve; the risk related to the uncertainty of revenues.
definition_or_explanation: Uncertainty with respect to the quantity of goods and services that a company is able to sell and the price it is able to achieve; the risk related to the uncertainty of revenues.

original_glossary_extracted: Sales-type leases  A type of finance lease, from a lessor per-spective, where the present value of the lease payments (lease receivable) exceeds the carrying value of the leased asset. The revenues earned by the lessor are operating (the profit on the sale) and financing (interest) in nature.
definition_or_explanation: A type of finance lease, from a lessor per-spective, where the present value of the lease payments (lease receivable) exceeds the carrying value of the leased asset. The revenues earned by the lessor are operating (the profit on the sale) and financing (interest) in nature.

original_glossary_extracted: Sample  A subset of a population.
definition_or_explanation: A subset of a population.

original_glossary_extracted: Sample excess kurtosis  A sample measure of the degree of a distribution's kurtosis in excess of the normal distribu-tion's kurtosis.
definition_or_explanation: A sample measure of the degree of a distribution's kurtosis in excess of the normal distribu-tion's kurtosis.

original_glossary_extracted: Sample kurtosis  A sample measure of the degree of a distri-bution's peakedness.
definition_or_explanation: A sample measure of the degree of a distri-bution's peakedness.

original_glossary_extracted: Sample mean  The sum of the sample observations, divided by the sample size.
definition_or_explanation: The sum of the sample observations, divided by the sample size.

original_glossary_extracted: Sample selection bias  Bias introduced by systematically excluding some members of the population according to a particular attribute-for example, the bias introduced when data availability leads to certain observations being excluded from the analysis.
definition_or_explanation: Bias introduced by systematically excluding some members of the population according to a particular attribute-for example, the bias introduced when data availability leads to certain observations being excluded from the analysis.

original_glossary_extracted: Sample skewness  A sample measure of degree of asymmetry of a distribution.
definition_or_explanation: A sample measure of degree of asymmetry of a distribution.

original_glossary_extracted: Sample standard deviation  The positive square root of the sample variance.
definition_or_explanation: The positive square root of the sample variance.

original_glossary_extracted: Sample statistic  A quantity computed from or used to describe a sample.
definition_or_explanation: A quantity computed from or used to describe a sample.

original_glossary_extracted: Sample variance  A sample measure of the degree of dis-persion of a distribution, calculated by dividing the sum of the squared deviations from the sample mean by the sample size minus 1.
definition_or_explanation: A sample measure of the degree of dis-persion of a distribution, calculated by dividing the sum of the squared deviations from the sample mean by the sample size minus 1.

original_glossary_extracted: Sampling  The process of obtaining a sample.
definition_or_explanation: The process of obtaining a sample.

original_glossary_extracted: Sampling distribution  The distribution of all distinct possible values that a statistic can assume when computed from samples of the same size randomly drawn from the same population.
definition_or_explanation: The distribution of all distinct possible values that a statistic can assume when computed from samples of the same size randomly drawn from the same population.

original_glossary_extracted: Sampling error  The difference between the observed value of a statistic and the quantity it is intended to estimate.
definition_or_explanation: The difference between the observed value of a statistic and the quantity it is intended to estimate.

original_glossary_extracted: Sampling plan  The set of rules used to select a sample.
definition_or_explanation: The set of rules used to select a sample.

original_glossary_extracted: Say on pay  A process whereby shareholders may vote on executive remuneration (compensation) matters.
definition_or_explanation: A process whereby shareholders may vote on executive remuneration (compensation) matters.

original_glossary_extracted: Say's law  Named for French economist J.B. Say: All that is pro-duced will be sold because supply creates its own demand.
definition_or_explanation: Named for French economist J.B. Say: All that is pro-duced will be sold because supply creates its own demand.

original_glossary_extracted: Scenario analysis  Analysis that shows the changes in key financial quantities that result from given (economic) events, such as the loss of customers, the loss of a sup-ply source, or a catastrophic event; a risk management technique involving examination of the performance of a portfolio under specified situations. Closely related to stress testing.
definition_or_explanation: Analysis that shows the changes in key financial quantities that result from given (economic) events, such as the loss of customers, the loss of a sup-ply source, or a catastrophic event; a risk management technique involving examination of the performance of a portfolio under specified situations. Closely related to stress testing.

original_glossary_extracted: Screening  The application of a set of criteria to reduce a set of potential investments to a smaller set having certain desired characteristics.
definition_or_explanation: The application of a set of criteria to reduce a set of potential investments to a smaller set having certain desired characteristics.

original_glossary_extracted: Seasoned offering  An offering in which an issuer sells addi-tional units of a previously issued security.
definition_or_explanation: An offering in which an issuer sells addi-tional units of a previously issued security.

original_glossary_extracted: Second-degree price discrimination  When the monopolist charges different per-unit prices using the quantity pur-chased as an indicator of how highly the customer values the product.
definition_or_explanation: When the monopolist charges different per-unit prices using the quantity pur-chased as an indicator of how highly the customer values the product.

original_glossary_extracted: Second lien  A secured interest in the pledged assets that ranks below first lien debt in both collateral protection and priority of payment.
definition_or_explanation: A secured interest in the pledged assets that ranks below first lien debt in both collateral protection and priority of payment.

original_glossary_extracted: Secondary bond markets  Markets in which existing bonds are traded among investors.
definition_or_explanation: Markets in which existing bonds are traded among investors.

original_glossary_extracted: Secondary market  The market where securities are traded among investors.
definition_or_explanation: The market where securities are traded among investors.

original_glossary_extracted: Secondary precedence rules  Rules that determine how to rank orders placed at the same time.
definition_or_explanation: Rules that determine how to rank orders placed at the same time.

original_glossary_extracted: Sector  A group of related industries.
definition_or_explanation: A group of related industries.

original_glossary_extracted: Sector indexes  Indexes that represent and track different eco-nomic sectors-such as consumer goods, energy, finance, health care, and technology-on either a national, regional, or global basis.
definition_or_explanation: Indexes that represent and track different eco-nomic sectors-such as consumer goods, energy, finance, health care, and technology-on either a national, regional, or global basis.

original_glossary_extracted: Secured bonds  Bonds secured by assets or financial guaran-tees pledged to ensure debt repayment in case of default.
definition_or_explanation: Bonds secured by assets or financial guaran-tees pledged to ensure debt repayment in case of default.

original_glossary_extracted: Secured debt  Debt in which the debtholder has a direct claim-a pledge from the issuer-on certain assets and their associated cash flows.
definition_or_explanation: Debt in which the debtholder has a direct claim-a pledge from the issuer-on certain assets and their associated cash flows.

original_glossary_extracted: Securitization  A process that involves moving assets into a special legal entity, which then uses the assets as guarantees to secure a bond issue.
definition_or_explanation: A process that involves moving assets into a special legal entity, which then uses the assets as guarantees to secure a bond issue.

original_glossary_extracted: Securitized assets  Assets that are typically used to create asset-backed bonds; for example, when a bank securitizes a pool of loans, the loans are said to be securitized.
definition_or_explanation: Assets that are typically used to create asset-backed bonds; for example, when a bank securitizes a pool of loans, the loans are said to be securitized.

original_glossary_extracted: Security characteristic line  A plot of the excess return of a security on the excess return of the market.
definition_or_explanation: A plot of the excess return of a security on the excess return of the market.

original_glossary_extracted: Security market index  A portfolio of securities representing a given security market, market segment, or asset class.
definition_or_explanation: A portfolio of securities representing a given security market, market segment, or asset class.

original_glossary_extracted: Security market line  (SML) The graph of the capital asset pricing model.
definition_or_explanation: The graph of the capital asset pricing model.

original_glossary_extracted: Security selection  The process of selecting individual secu-rities; typically, security selection has the objective of generating superior risk-adjusted returns relative to a portfolio's benchmark.
definition_or_explanation: The process of selecting individual secu-rities; typically, security selection has the objective of generating superior risk-adjusted returns relative to a portfolio's benchmark.

original_glossary_extracted: Self-investment limits  With respect to investment limitations applying to pension plans, restrictions on the percentage of assets that can be invested in securities issued by the pension plan sponsor.
definition_or_explanation: With respect to investment limitations applying to pension plans, restrictions on the percentage of assets that can be invested in securities issued by the pension plan sponsor.

original_glossary_extracted: Sell-side firm  A broker or dealer that sells securities to and provides independent investment research and recommen-dations to investment management companies.
definition_or_explanation: A broker or dealer that sells securities to and provides independent investment research and recommen-dations to investment management companies.

original_glossary_extracted: Semi-strong-form efficient market  A market in which security prices reflect all publicly known and available information.
definition_or_explanation: A market in which security prices reflect all publicly known and available information.

original_glossary_extracted: Semiannual bond basis yield  An annual rate having a peri-odicity of two; also known as a semiannual bond equiv-alent yield.
definition_or_explanation: An annual rate having a peri-odicity of two; also known as a semiannual bond equiv-alent yield.

original_glossary_extracted: Semiannual bond equivalent yield  See semiannual bond basis yield.
definition_or_explanation: See semiannual bond basis yield.

original_glossary_extracted: Semideviation  The positive square root of semivariance (sometimes called semistandard deviation).
definition_or_explanation: The positive square root of semivariance (sometimes called semistandard deviation).

original_glossary_extracted: Semilogarithmic  Describes a scale constructed so that equal intervals on the vertical scale represent equal rates of change, and equal intervals on the horizontal scale repre-sent equal amounts of change.
definition_or_explanation: Describes a scale constructed so that equal intervals on the vertical scale represent equal rates of change, and equal intervals on the horizontal scale repre-sent equal amounts of change.

original_glossary_extracted: Semivariance  The average squared deviation below the mean.
definition_or_explanation: The average squared deviation below the mean.

original_glossary_extracted: Seniority ranking  Priority of payment of various debt obligations.
definition_or_explanation: Priority of payment of various debt obligations.

original_glossary_extracted: Sensitivity analysis  Analysis that shows the range of possible outcomes as specific assumptions are changed.
definition_or_explanation: Analysis that shows the range of possible outcomes as specific assumptions are changed.

original_glossary_extracted: Separately managed account  (SMA) An investment port-folio managed exclusively for the benefit of an individual or institution.
definition_or_explanation: An investment port-folio managed exclusively for the benefit of an individual or institution.

original_glossary_extracted: Serial maturity structure  Structure for a bond issue in which the maturity dates are spread out during the bond's life; a stated number of bonds mature and are paid off each year before final maturity.
definition_or_explanation: Structure for a bond issue in which the maturity dates are spread out during the bond's life; a stated number of bonds mature and are paid off each year before final maturity.

original_glossary_extracted: Settlement  The process that occurs after a trade is completed, the securities are passed to the buyer, and payment is received by the seller.
definition_or_explanation: The process that occurs after a trade is completed, the securities are passed to the buyer, and payment is received by the seller.

original_glossary_extracted: Settlement date  Date when the buyer makes cash payment and the seller delivers the security.
definition_or_explanation: Date when the buyer makes cash payment and the seller delivers the security.

original_glossary_extracted: Settlement price  The official price, designated by the clearing-house, from which daily gains and losses will be determined and marked to market.
definition_or_explanation: The official price, designated by the clearing-house, from which daily gains and losses will be determined and marked to market.

original_glossary_extracted: Share repurchase  A transaction in which a company buys back its own shares. Unlike stock dividends and stock splits, share repurchases use corporate cash.
definition_or_explanation: A transaction in which a company buys back its own shares. Unlike stock dividends and stock splits, share repurchases use corporate cash.

original_glossary_extracted: Shareholder activism  Strategies used by shareholders to attempt to compel a company to act in a desired manner.
definition_or_explanation: Strategies used by shareholders to attempt to compel a company to act in a desired manner.

original_glossary_extracted: Shareholder engagement  The process whereby companies engage with their shareholders.
definition_or_explanation: The process whereby companies engage with their shareholders.

original_glossary_extracted: Shareholders' equity  Assets less liabilities; the residual inter-est in the assets after subtracting the liabilities.
definition_or_explanation: Assets less liabilities; the residual inter-est in the assets after subtracting the liabilities.

original_glossary_extracted: Sharpe ratio  The average return in excess of the risk-free rate divided by the standard deviation of return; a measure of the average excess return earned per unit of standard deviation of return.
definition_or_explanation: The average return in excess of the risk-free rate divided by the standard deviation of return; a measure of the average excess return earned per unit of standard deviation of return.

original_glossary_extracted: Shelf registration  Type of public offering that allows the issuer to file a single, all-encompassing offering circular that covers a series of bond issues.
definition_or_explanation: Type of public offering that allows the issuer to file a single, all-encompassing offering circular that covers a series of bond issues.

original_glossary_extracted: Short  The seller of an asset or derivative contract. Also refers to the position of being short an asset or derivative contract.
definition_or_explanation: The seller of an asset or derivative contract. Also refers to the position of being short an asset or derivative contract.

original_glossary_extracted: Short position  A position in an asset or contract in which one has sold an asset one does not own, or in which a right under a contract can be exercised against oneself.
definition_or_explanation: A position in an asset or contract in which one has sold an asset one does not own, or in which a right under a contract can be exercised against oneself.

original_glossary_extracted: Short-run average total cost  The curve describing average total cost when some costs are considered fixed.
definition_or_explanation: The curve describing average total cost when some costs are considered fixed.

original_glossary_extracted: Short selling  A transaction in which borrowed securities are sold with the intention to repurchase them at a lower price at a later date and return them to the lender.
definition_or_explanation: A transaction in which borrowed securities are sold with the intention to repurchase them at a lower price at a later date and return them to the lender.

original_glossary_extracted: Shortfall risk  The risk that portfolio value will fall below some minimum acceptable level over some time horizon.
definition_or_explanation: The risk that portfolio value will fall below some minimum acceptable level over some time horizon.

original_glossary_extracted: Shutdown point  The point at which average revenue is equal to the firm's average variable cost.
definition_or_explanation: The point at which average revenue is equal to the firm's average variable cost.

original_glossary_extracted: Simple interest  The interest earned each period on the orig-inal investment; interest calculated on the principal only.
definition_or_explanation: The interest earned each period on the orig-inal investment; interest calculated on the principal only.

original_glossary_extracted: Simple random sample  A subset of a larger population cre-ated in such a way that each element of the population has an equal probability of being selected to the subset.
definition_or_explanation: A subset of a larger population cre-ated in such a way that each element of the population has an equal probability of being selected to the subset.

original_glossary_extracted: Simple random sampling  The procedure of drawing a sample to satisfy the definition of a simple random sample.
definition_or_explanation: The procedure of drawing a sample to satisfy the definition of a simple random sample.

original_glossary_extracted: Simple yield  The sum of the coupon payments plus the straight-line amortized share of the gain or loss, divided by the flat price.
definition_or_explanation: The sum of the coupon payments plus the straight-line amortized share of the gain or loss, divided by the flat price.

original_glossary_extracted: Simulation  Computer-generated sensitivity or scenario anal-ysis that is based on probability models for the factors that drive outcomes.
definition_or_explanation: Computer-generated sensitivity or scenario anal-ysis that is based on probability models for the factors that drive outcomes.

original_glossary_extracted: Simulation trial  A complete pass through the steps of a simulation.
definition_or_explanation: A complete pass through the steps of a simulation.

original_glossary_extracted: Single-step format  With respect to the format of the income statement, a format that does not subtotal for gross profit (revenue minus cost of goods sold).
definition_or_explanation: With respect to the format of the income statement, a format that does not subtotal for gross profit (revenue minus cost of goods sold).

original_glossary_extracted: Sinking fund arrangement  Provision that reduces the credit risk of a bond issue by requiring the issuer to retire a por-tion of the bond's principal outstanding each year.
definition_or_explanation: Provision that reduces the credit risk of a bond issue by requiring the issuer to retire a por-tion of the bond's principal outstanding each year.

original_glossary_extracted: Situational influences  External factors, such as environmental or cultural elements, that shape our behavior.
definition_or_explanation: External factors, such as environmental or cultural elements, that shape our behavior.

original_glossary_extracted: Skewed  Not symmetrical.
definition_or_explanation: Not symmetrical.

original_glossary_extracted: Skewness  A quantitative measure of skew (lack of symmetry); a synonym of skew.
definition_or_explanation: A quantitative measure of skew (lack of symmetry); a synonym of skew.

original_glossary_extracted: Small country  A country that is a price taker in the world market for a product and cannot influence the world market price.
definition_or_explanation: A country that is a price taker in the world market for a product and cannot influence the world market price.

original_glossary_extracted: Smart contract  A computer program that is designed to self-execute on the basis of pre-specified terms and conditions agreed to by parties to a contract.
definition_or_explanation: A computer program that is designed to self-execute on the basis of pre-specified terms and conditions agreed to by parties to a contract.

original_glossary_extracted: Socially responsible investing  An investment approach that excludes investments in companies or industries that devi-ate from an organization's beliefs and sometimes includes investments with favorable environmental or social profiles.
definition_or_explanation: An investment approach that excludes investments in companies or industries that devi-ate from an organization's beliefs and sometimes includes investments with favorable environmental or social profiles.

original_glossary_extracted: Solvency  With respect to financial statement analysis, the ability of a company to fulfill its long-term obligations.
definition_or_explanation: With respect to financial statement analysis, the ability of a company to fulfill its long-term obligations.

original_glossary_extracted: Solvency ratios  Ratios that measure a company's ability to meet its long-term obligations.
definition_or_explanation: Ratios that measure a company's ability to meet its long-term obligations.

original_glossary_extracted: Solvency risk  The risk that an entity does not survive or succeed because it runs out of cash, even though it might otherwise be solvent.
definition_or_explanation: The risk that an entity does not survive or succeed because it runs out of cash, even though it might otherwise be solvent.

original_glossary_extracted: Sovereign bonds  A bond issued by a national government.
definition_or_explanation: A bond issued by a national government.

original_glossary_extracted: Sovereign yield spread  An estimate of the country spread (country equity premium) for a developing nation that is based on a comparison of bonds yields in country being analyzed and a developed country. The sovereign yield spread is the difference between a government bond yield in the country being analyzed, denominated in the currency of the developed country, and the Treasury bond yield on a similar maturity bond in the developed country.
definition_or_explanation: An estimate of the country spread (country equity premium) for a developing nation that is based on a comparison of bonds yields in country being analyzed and a developed country. The sovereign yield spread is the difference between a government bond yield in the country being analyzed, denominated in the currency of the developed country, and the Treasury bond yield on a similar maturity bond in the developed country.

original_glossary_extracted: Sovereigns  A bond issued by a national government.
definition_or_explanation: A bond issued by a national government.

original_glossary_extracted: Spearman rank correlation coefficient  A measure of cor-relation applied to ranked data.
definition_or_explanation: A measure of cor-relation applied to ranked data.

original_glossary_extracted: Special dividend  A dividend paid by a company that does not pay dividends on a regular schedule, or a dividend that supplements regular cash dividends with an extra payment.
definition_or_explanation: A dividend paid by a company that does not pay dividends on a regular schedule, or a dividend that supplements regular cash dividends with an extra payment.

original_glossary_extracted: Special purpose entity  A non-operating entity created to carry out a specified purpose, such as leasing assets or securitizing receivables; can be a corporation, partnership, trust, limited liability, or partnership formed to facilitate a specific type of business activity. Also called special purpose vehicle or variable interest entity.
definition_or_explanation: A non-operating entity created to carry out a specified purpose, such as leasing assets or securitizing receivables; can be a corporation, partnership, trust, limited liability, or partnership formed to facilitate a specific type of business activity. Also called special purpose vehicle or variable interest entity.

original_glossary_extracted: Special purpose vehicle  See special purpose entity.
definition_or_explanation: See special purpose entity.

original_glossary_extracted: Specific identification method  An inventory accounting method that identifies which specific inventory items were sold and which remained in inventory to be carried over to later periods.
definition_or_explanation: An inventory accounting method that identifies which specific inventory items were sold and which remained in inventory to be carried over to later periods.

original_glossary_extracted: Speculative demand for money  The demand to hold specu-lative money balances based on the potential opportunities or risks that are inherent in other financial instruments. Also called portfolio demand for money.
definition_or_explanation: The demand to hold specu-lative money balances based on the potential opportunities or risks that are inherent in other financial instruments. Also called portfolio demand for money.

original_glossary_extracted: Speculative money balances  Monies held in anticipation that other assets will decline in value.
definition_or_explanation: Monies held in anticipation that other assets will decline in value.

original_glossary_extracted: Split coupon bond  See deferred coupon bond.
definition_or_explanation: See deferred coupon bond.

original_glossary_extracted: Sponsored  A type of depository receipt in which the foreign company whose shares are held by the depository has a direct involvement in the issuance of the receipts.
definition_or_explanation: A type of depository receipt in which the foreign company whose shares are held by the depository has a direct involvement in the issuance of the receipts.

original_glossary_extracted: Spot curve  A sequence of yields-to-maturity on zero-coupon bonds. Sometimes called zero or strip curve because coupon payments are "stripped" off of the bonds.
definition_or_explanation: A sequence of yields-to-maturity on zero-coupon bonds. Sometimes called zero or strip curve because coupon payments are "stripped" off of the bonds.

original_glossary_extracted: Spot markets  Markets in which assets are traded for imme-diate delivery.
definition_or_explanation: Markets in which assets are traded for imme-diate delivery.

original_glossary_extracted: Spot prices  The price of an asset for immediately delivery.
definition_or_explanation: The price of an asset for immediately delivery.

original_glossary_extracted: Spot rates  A sequence of market discount rates that cor-respond to the cash flow dates; yields-to-maturity on zero-coupon bonds maturing at the date of each cash flow.
definition_or_explanation: A sequence of market discount rates that cor-respond to the cash flow dates; yields-to-maturity on zero-coupon bonds maturing at the date of each cash flow.

original_glossary_extracted: Spread  In general, the difference in yield between different fixed income securities. Often used to refer to the differ-ence between the yield-to-maturity and the benchmark.
definition_or_explanation: In general, the difference in yield between different fixed income securities. Often used to refer to the differ-ence between the yield-to-maturity and the benchmark.

original_glossary_extracted: Spread over the benchmark  See required yield spread.
definition_or_explanation: See required yield spread.

original_glossary_extracted: Spread risk  Bond price risk arising from changes in the yield spread on credit-risky bonds; reflects changes in the mar-ket's assessment and/or pricing of credit migration (or downgrade) risk and market liquidity risk.
definition_or_explanation: Bond price risk arising from changes in the yield spread on credit-risky bonds; reflects changes in the mar-ket's assessment and/or pricing of credit migration (or downgrade) risk and market liquidity risk.

original_glossary_extracted: Stackelberg model  A prominent model of strategic deci-sionmaking in which firms are assumed to make their decisions sequentially.
definition_or_explanation: A prominent model of strategic deci-sionmaking in which firms are assumed to make their decisions sequentially.

original_glossary_extracted: Stagflation  When a high inflation rate is combined with a high level of unemployment and a slowdown of the economy.
definition_or_explanation: When a high inflation rate is combined with a high level of unemployment and a slowdown of the economy.

original_glossary_extracted: Staggered boards  Election process whereby directors are typically divided into multiple classes that are elected sep-arately in consecutive years-that is, one class every year.
definition_or_explanation: Election process whereby directors are typically divided into multiple classes that are elected sep-arately in consecutive years-that is, one class every year.

original_glossary_extracted: Stakeholder management  The identification, prioritization, and understanding of the interests of stakeholder groups, and managing the company's relationships with these groups.
definition_or_explanation: The identification, prioritization, and understanding of the interests of stakeholder groups, and managing the company's relationships with these groups.

original_glossary_extracted: Stakeholders  Individuals or groups of individuals who may be affected either directly or indirectly by a decision and thus have an interest, or stake, in the decision.
definition_or_explanation: Individuals or groups of individuals who may be affected either directly or indirectly by a decision and thus have an interest, or stake, in the decision.

original_glossary_extracted: Standard cost  With respect to inventory accounting, the planned or target unit cost of inventory items or services.
definition_or_explanation: With respect to inventory accounting, the planned or target unit cost of inventory items or services.

original_glossary_extracted: Standard deviation  The positive square root of the variance; a measure of dispersion in the same units as the original data.
definition_or_explanation: The positive square root of the variance; a measure of dispersion in the same units as the original data.

original_glossary_extracted: Standard normal distribution  The normal density with mean (μ) equal to 0 and standard deviation (σ) equal to 1.
definition_or_explanation: The normal density with mean (μ) equal to 0 and standard deviation (σ) equal to 1.

original_glossary_extracted: Standardizing  A transformation that involves subtracting the mean and dividing the result by the standard deviation.
definition_or_explanation: A transformation that involves subtracting the mean and dividing the result by the standard deviation.

original_glossary_extracted: Standards of conduct  Behaviors required by a group; estab-lished benchmarks that clarify or enhance a group's code of ethics.
definition_or_explanation: Behaviors required by a group; estab-lished benchmarks that clarify or enhance a group's code of ethics.

original_glossary_extracted: Standing limit orders  A limit order at a price below market and which therefore is waiting to trade.
definition_or_explanation: A limit order at a price below market and which therefore is waiting to trade.

original_glossary_extracted: Stated annual interest rate  A quoted interest rate that does not account for compounding within the year. Also called quoted interest rate.
definition_or_explanation: A quoted interest rate that does not account for compounding within the year. Also called quoted interest rate.

original_glossary_extracted: Statement of changes in equity  (statement of owners' equity) A financial statement that reconciles the beginning-of-period and end-of-period balance sheet values of share-holders' equity; provides information about all factors affecting shareholders' equity. Also called statement of owners' equity.
definition_or_explanation: (statement of owners' equity) A financial statement that reconciles the beginning-of-period and end-of-period balance sheet values of share-holders' equity; provides information about all factors affecting shareholders' equity. Also called statement of owners' equity.

original_glossary_extracted: Statement of financial condition  The financial statement that presents an entity's current financial position by disclosing resources the entity controls (its assets) and the claims on those resources (its liabilities and equity claims), as of a particular point in time (the date of the balance sheet).
definition_or_explanation: The financial statement that presents an entity's current financial position by disclosing resources the entity controls (its assets) and the claims on those resources (its liabilities and equity claims), as of a particular point in time (the date of the balance sheet).

original_glossary_extracted: Statement of financial position  The financial statement that presents an entity's current financial position by disclosing resources the entity controls (its assets) and the claims on those resources (its liabilities and equity claims), as of a particular point in time (the date of the balance sheet).
definition_or_explanation: The financial statement that presents an entity's current financial position by disclosing resources the entity controls (its assets) and the claims on those resources (its liabilities and equity claims), as of a particular point in time (the date of the balance sheet).

original_glossary_extracted: Statement of operations  A financial statement that provides information about a company's profitability over a stated period of time.
definition_or_explanation: A financial statement that provides information about a company's profitability over a stated period of time.

original_glossary_extracted: Statistic  A quantity computed from or used to describe a sample of data.
definition_or_explanation: A quantity computed from or used to describe a sample of data.

original_glossary_extracted: Statistical inference  Making forecasts, estimates, or judg-ments about a larger group from a smaller group actually observed; using a sample statistic to infer the value of an unknown population parameter.
definition_or_explanation: Making forecasts, estimates, or judg-ments about a larger group from a smaller group actually observed; using a sample statistic to infer the value of an unknown population parameter.

original_glossary_extracted: Statistically significant  A result indicating that the null hypothesis can be rejected; with reference to an estimated regression coefficient, frequently understood to mean a result indicating that the corresponding population regres-sion coefficient is different from 0.
definition_or_explanation: A result indicating that the null hypothesis can be rejected; with reference to an estimated regression coefficient, frequently understood to mean a result indicating that the corresponding population regres-sion coefficient is different from 0.

original_glossary_extracted: Statutory voting  A common method of voting where each share represents one vote.
definition_or_explanation: A common method of voting where each share represents one vote.

original_glossary_extracted: Step-up coupon bond  Bond for which the coupon, which may be fixed or floating, increases by specified margins at specified dates.
definition_or_explanation: Bond for which the coupon, which may be fixed or floating, increases by specified margins at specified dates.

original_glossary_extracted: Stock dividend  A type of dividend in which a company distrib-utes additional shares of its common stock to shareholders instead of cash.
definition_or_explanation: A type of dividend in which a company distrib-utes additional shares of its common stock to shareholders instead of cash.

original_glossary_extracted: Stock-out losses  Profits lost from not having sufficient inven-tory on hand to satisfy demand.
definition_or_explanation: Profits lost from not having sufficient inven-tory on hand to satisfy demand.

original_glossary_extracted: Stock split  An increase in the number of shares outstanding with a consequent decrease in share price, but no change to the company's underlying fundamentals.
definition_or_explanation: An increase in the number of shares outstanding with a consequent decrease in share price, but no change to the company's underlying fundamentals.

original_glossary_extracted: Stop-loss order  See stop order.
definition_or_explanation: See stop order.

original_glossary_extracted: Stop order  An order in which a trader has specified a stop price condition. Also called stop-loss order.
definition_or_explanation: An order in which a trader has specified a stop price condition. Also called stop-loss order.

original_glossary_extracted: Store of value  The quality of tending to preserve value.
definition_or_explanation: The quality of tending to preserve value.

original_glossary_extracted: Store of wealth  Goods that depend on the fact that they do not perish physically over time, and on the belief that others would always value the good.
definition_or_explanation: Goods that depend on the fact that they do not perish physically over time, and on the belief that others would always value the good.

original_glossary_extracted: Straight-line method  A depreciation method that allocates evenly the cost of a long-lived asset less its estimated residual value over the estimated useful life of the asset.
definition_or_explanation: A depreciation method that allocates evenly the cost of a long-lived asset less its estimated residual value over the estimated useful life of the asset.

original_glossary_extracted: Straight voting  A shareholder voting process in which share-holders receive one vote for each share owned.
definition_or_explanation: A shareholder voting process in which share-holders receive one vote for each share owned.

original_glossary_extracted: Strategic analysis  Analysis of the competitive environment with an emphasis on the implications of the environment for corporate strategy.
definition_or_explanation: Analysis of the competitive environment with an emphasis on the implications of the environment for corporate strategy.

original_glossary_extracted: Strategic asset allocation  The set of exposures to IPS-permissible asset classes that is expected to achieve the client's long-term objectives given the client's investment constraints.
definition_or_explanation: The set of exposures to IPS-permissible asset classes that is expected to achieve the client's long-term objectives given the client's investment constraints.

original_glossary_extracted: Strategic groups  Groups sharing distinct business models or catering to specific market segments in an industry.
definition_or_explanation: Groups sharing distinct business models or catering to specific market segments in an industry.

original_glossary_extracted: Street convention  Yield measure that neglects weekends and holidays; the internal rate of return on cash flows assuming payments are made on the scheduled dates, even when the scheduled date falls on a weekend or holiday.
definition_or_explanation: Yield measure that neglects weekends and holidays; the internal rate of return on cash flows assuming payments are made on the scheduled dates, even when the scheduled date falls on a weekend or holiday.

original_glossary_extracted: Stress testing  A specific type of scenario analysis that esti-mates losses in rare and extremely unfavorable combina-tions of events or scenarios.
definition_or_explanation: A specific type of scenario analysis that esti-mates losses in rare and extremely unfavorable combina-tions of events or scenarios.

original_glossary_extracted: Strong-form efficient market  A market in which security prices reflect all public and private information.
definition_or_explanation: A market in which security prices reflect all public and private information.

original_glossary_extracted: Structural (or cyclically adjusted) budget deficit  The deficit that would exist if the economy was at full employment (or full potential output).
definition_or_explanation: The deficit that would exist if the economy was at full employment (or full potential output).

original_glossary_extracted: Structural subordination  Arises in a holding company struc-ture when the debt of operating subsidiaries is serviced by the cash flow and assets of the subsidiaries before funds can be passed to the holding company to service debt at the parent level.
definition_or_explanation: Arises in a holding company struc-ture when the debt of operating subsidiaries is serviced by the cash flow and assets of the subsidiaries before funds can be passed to the holding company to service debt at the parent level.

original_glossary_extracted: Structured financial instruments  Financial instruments that share the common attribute of repackaging risks. Structured financial instruments include asset-backed securities, collateralized debt obligations, and other struc-tured financial instruments such as capital protected, yield enhancement, participation and leveraged instruments.
definition_or_explanation: Financial instruments that share the common attribute of repackaging risks. Structured financial instruments include asset-backed securities, collateralized debt obligations, and other struc-tured financial instruments such as capital protected, yield enhancement, participation and leveraged instruments.

original_glossary_extracted: Subjective probability  A probability drawing on personal or subjective judgment.
definition_or_explanation: A probability drawing on personal or subjective judgment.

original_glossary_extracted: Subordinated debt  A class of unsecured debt that ranks below a firm's senior unsecured obligations.
definition_or_explanation: A class of unsecured debt that ranks below a firm's senior unsecured obligations.

original_glossary_extracted: Subordination  Form of internal credit enhancement that relies on creating more than one bond tranche and ordering the claim priorities for ownership or interest in an asset between the tranches. The ordering of the claim priorities is called a senior/subordinated structure, where the tranches of highest seniority are called senior followed by subor-dinated or junior tranches. Also called credit tranching.
definition_or_explanation: Form of internal credit enhancement that relies on creating more than one bond tranche and ordering the claim priorities for ownership or interest in an asset between the tranches. The ordering of the claim priorities is called a senior/subordinated structure, where the tranches of highest seniority are called senior followed by subor-dinated or junior tranches. Also called credit tranching.

original_glossary_extracted: Substitutes  Said of two goods or services such that if the price of one increases the demand for the other tends to increase, holding all other things equal (e.g., butter and margarine).
definition_or_explanation: Said of two goods or services such that if the price of one increases the demand for the other tends to increase, holding all other things equal (e.g., butter and margarine).

original_glossary_extracted: Sunk cost  A cost that has already been incurred.
definition_or_explanation: A cost that has already been incurred.

original_glossary_extracted: Supervised learning  A machine learning approach that makes use of labeled training data.
definition_or_explanation: A machine learning approach that makes use of labeled training data.

original_glossary_extracted: Supply shock  A typically unexpected disturbance to supply.
definition_or_explanation: A typically unexpected disturbance to supply.

original_glossary_extracted: Support  In technical analysis, a price range in which buying activity is sufficient to stop the decline in the price of a security.
definition_or_explanation: In technical analysis, a price range in which buying activity is sufficient to stop the decline in the price of a security.

original_glossary_extracted: Support tranche  A class or tranche in a CMO that protects the PAC tranche from prepayment risk.
definition_or_explanation: A class or tranche in a CMO that protects the PAC tranche from prepayment risk.

original_glossary_extracted: Supranational bonds  A bond issued by a supranational agency such as the World Bank.
definition_or_explanation: A bond issued by a supranational agency such as the World Bank.

original_glossary_extracted: Surety bond  Form of external credit enhancement whereby a rated and regulated insurance company guarantees to reimburse bondholders for any losses incurred up to a maximum amount if the issuer defaults.
definition_or_explanation: Form of external credit enhancement whereby a rated and regulated insurance company guarantees to reimburse bondholders for any losses incurred up to a maximum amount if the issuer defaults.

original_glossary_extracted: Survey approach  An estimate of the equity risk premium that is based upon estimates provided by a panel of finance experts.
definition_or_explanation: An estimate of the equity risk premium that is based upon estimates provided by a panel of finance experts.

original_glossary_extracted: Survivorship bias  The bias resulting from a test design that fails to account for companies that have gone bankrupt, merged, or are otherwise no longer reported in a database.
definition_or_explanation: The bias resulting from a test design that fails to account for companies that have gone bankrupt, merged, or are otherwise no longer reported in a database.

original_glossary_extracted: Sustainable growth rate  The rate of dividend (and earnings) growth that can be sustained over time for a given level of return on equity, keeping the capital structure constant and without issuing additional common stock.
definition_or_explanation: The rate of dividend (and earnings) growth that can be sustained over time for a given level of return on equity, keeping the capital structure constant and without issuing additional common stock.

original_glossary_extracted: Sustainable investing  The practice of identifying companies that can efficiently manage their financial, environmen-tal, and human capital resources to generate attractive long-term profitability; often synonymous with responsible investing.
definition_or_explanation: The practice of identifying companies that can efficiently manage their financial, environmen-tal, and human capital resources to generate attractive long-term profitability; often synonymous with responsible investing.

original_glossary_extracted: Sustainable rate of economic growth  The rate of increase in the economy's productive capacity or potential GDP.
definition_or_explanation: The rate of increase in the economy's productive capacity or potential GDP.

original_glossary_extracted: Swap contract  An agreement between two parties to exchange a series of future cash flows.
definition_or_explanation: An agreement between two parties to exchange a series of future cash flows.

original_glossary_extracted: Syndicated loans  Loans from a group of lenders to a single borrower.
definition_or_explanation: Loans from a group of lenders to a single borrower.

original_glossary_extracted: Syndicated offering  A bond issue that is underwritten by a group of investment banks.
definition_or_explanation: A bond issue that is underwritten by a group of investment banks.

original_glossary_extracted: Synthetic lease  A lease that is structured to provide a com-pany with the tax benefits of ownership while not requir-ing the asset to be reflected on the company's financial statements.
definition_or_explanation: A lease that is structured to provide a com-pany with the tax benefits of ownership while not requir-ing the asset to be reflected on the company's financial statements.

original_glossary_extracted: Systematic risk  Risk that affects the entire market or econ-omy; it cannot be avoided and is inherent in the overall market. Systematic risk is also known as non-diversifiable or market risk.
definition_or_explanation: Risk that affects the entire market or econ-omy; it cannot be avoided and is inherent in the overall market. Systematic risk is also known as non-diversifiable or market risk.

original_glossary_extracted: Systematic sampling  A procedure of selecting every kth member until reaching a sample of the desired size. The sample that results from this procedure should be approx-imately random.
definition_or_explanation: A procedure of selecting every kth member until reaching a sample of the desired size. The sample that results from this procedure should be approx-imately random.

original_glossary_extracted: t-Test  A hypothesis test using a statistic (t-statistic) that follows a t-distribution.
definition_or_explanation: A hypothesis test using a statistic (t-statistic) that follows a t-distribution.

original_glossary_extracted: Tactical asset allocation  The decision to deliberately deviate from the strategic asset allocation in an attempt to add value based on forecasts of the near-term relative perfor-mance of asset classes.
definition_or_explanation: The decision to deliberately deviate from the strategic asset allocation in an attempt to add value based on forecasts of the near-term relative perfor-mance of asset classes.

original_glossary_extracted: Target balance  A minimum level of cash to be held avail-able-estimated in advance and adjusted for known funds transfers, seasonality, or other factors.
definition_or_explanation: A minimum level of cash to be held avail-able-estimated in advance and adjusted for known funds transfers, seasonality, or other factors.

original_glossary_extracted: Target capital structure  A company's chosen proportions of debt and equity.
definition_or_explanation: A company's chosen proportions of debt and equity.

original_glossary_extracted: Target independent  A bank's ability to determine the defi-nition of inflation that they target, the rate of inflation that they target, and the horizon over which the target is to be achieved.
definition_or_explanation: A bank's ability to determine the defi-nition of inflation that they target, the rate of inflation that they target, and the horizon over which the target is to be achieved.

original_glossary_extracted: Target semideviation  The positive square root of target semivariance.
definition_or_explanation: The positive square root of target semivariance.

original_glossary_extracted: Target semivariance  The average squared deviation below a target value.
definition_or_explanation: The average squared deviation below a target value.

original_glossary_extracted: Tariffs  Taxes that a government levies on imported goods.
definition_or_explanation: Taxes that a government levies on imported goods.

original_glossary_extracted: Tax base  The amount at which an asset or liability is valued for tax purposes.
definition_or_explanation: The amount at which an asset or liability is valued for tax purposes.

original_glossary_extracted: Tax expense  An aggregate of an entity's income tax payable (or recoverable in the case of a tax benefit) and any changes in deferred tax assets and liabilities. It is essentially the income tax payable or recoverable if these had been determined based on accounting profit rather than taxable income.
definition_or_explanation: An aggregate of an entity's income tax payable (or recoverable in the case of a tax benefit) and any changes in deferred tax assets and liabilities. It is essentially the income tax payable or recoverable if these had been determined based on accounting profit rather than taxable income.

original_glossary_extracted: Tax loss carry forward  A taxable loss in the current period that may be used to reduce future taxable income.
definition_or_explanation: A taxable loss in the current period that may be used to reduce future taxable income.

original_glossary_extracted: Taxable income  The portion of an entity's income that is sub-ject to income taxes under the tax laws of its jurisdiction.
definition_or_explanation: The portion of an entity's income that is sub-ject to income taxes under the tax laws of its jurisdiction.

original_glossary_extracted: Taxable temporary differences  Temporary differences that result in a taxable amount in a future period when deter-mining the taxable profit as the balance sheet item is recovered or settled.
definition_or_explanation: Temporary differences that result in a taxable amount in a future period when deter-mining the taxable profit as the balance sheet item is recovered or settled.

original_glossary_extracted: Technical analysis  A form of security analysis that uses price and volume data, which is often displayed graphically, in decision making.
definition_or_explanation: A form of security analysis that uses price and volume data, which is often displayed graphically, in decision making.

original_glossary_extracted: Technology  The process a company uses to transform inputs into outputs.
definition_or_explanation: The process a company uses to transform inputs into outputs.

original_glossary_extracted: Tender offer  Corporate takeover mechanism which involves shareholders selling their interests directly to the group seeking to gain control.
definition_or_explanation: Corporate takeover mechanism which involves shareholders selling their interests directly to the group seeking to gain control.

original_glossary_extracted: Tenor  The time-to-maturity for a bond or derivative contract. Also called term to maturity.
definition_or_explanation: The time-to-maturity for a bond or derivative contract. Also called term to maturity.

original_glossary_extracted: Term maturity structure  Structure for a bond issue in which the bond's notional principal is paid off in a lump sum at maturity.
definition_or_explanation: Structure for a bond issue in which the bond's notional principal is paid off in a lump sum at maturity.

original_glossary_extracted: Term structure  See maturity structure.
definition_or_explanation: See maturity structure.

original_glossary_extracted: Term structure of credit spreads  The relationship between the spreads over the "risk-free" (or benchmark) rates and times-to-maturity.
definition_or_explanation: The relationship between the spreads over the "risk-free" (or benchmark) rates and times-to-maturity.

original_glossary_extracted: Term structure of yield volatility  The relationship between the volatility of bond yields-to-maturity and times-to-maturity.
definition_or_explanation: The relationship between the volatility of bond yields-to-maturity and times-to-maturity.

original_glossary_extracted: Terminal stock value  The expected value of a share at the end of the investment horizon-in effect, the expected selling price. Also called terminal value.
definition_or_explanation: The expected value of a share at the end of the investment horizon-in effect, the expected selling price. Also called terminal value.

original_glossary_extracted: Terminal value  The expected value of a share at the end of the investment horizon-in effect, the expected selling price.
definition_or_explanation: The expected value of a share at the end of the investment horizon-in effect, the expected selling price.

original_glossary_extracted: Terms of trade  The ratio of the price of exports to the price of imports, representing those prices by export and import price indexes, respectively.
definition_or_explanation: The ratio of the price of exports to the price of imports, representing those prices by export and import price indexes, respectively.

original_glossary_extracted: Text analytics  The use of computer programs to analyze and derive meaning from typically large, unstructured text-or voice-based datasets.
definition_or_explanation: The use of computer programs to analyze and derive meaning from typically large, unstructured text-or voice-based datasets.

original_glossary_extracted: Thematic investing  An ESG implementation approach that focuses on investing in companies within a specific sector or industry theme.
definition_or_explanation: An ESG implementation approach that focuses on investing in companies within a specific sector or industry theme.

original_glossary_extracted: Third-degree price discrimination  When the monopolist segregates customers into groups based on demographic or other characteristics and offers different pricing to each group.
definition_or_explanation: When the monopolist segregates customers into groups based on demographic or other characteristics and offers different pricing to each group.

original_glossary_extracted: Time-period bias  The possibility that when we use a time-series sample, our statistical conclusion may be sensitive to the starting and ending dates of the sample.
definition_or_explanation: The possibility that when we use a time-series sample, our statistical conclusion may be sensitive to the starting and ending dates of the sample.

original_glossary_extracted: Time-series data  Observations of a variable over time.
definition_or_explanation: Observations of a variable over time.

original_glossary_extracted: Time tranching  The creation of classes or tranches in an ABS/MBS that possess different (expected) maturities.
definition_or_explanation: The creation of classes or tranches in an ABS/MBS that possess different (expected) maturities.

original_glossary_extracted: Time value  The difference between the market price of the option and its intrinsic value.
definition_or_explanation: The difference between the market price of the option and its intrinsic value.

original_glossary_extracted: Time value decay  Said of an option when, at expiration, no time value remains and the option is worth only its exercise value.
definition_or_explanation: Said of an option when, at expiration, no time value remains and the option is worth only its exercise value.

original_glossary_extracted: Time value of money  The principles governing equivalence relationships between cash flows with different dates.
definition_or_explanation: The principles governing equivalence relationships between cash flows with different dates.

original_glossary_extracted: Time-weighted rate of return  The compound rate of growth of one unit of currency invested in a portfolio during a stated measurement period; a measure of investment per-formance that is not sensitive to the timing and amount of withdrawals or additions to the portfolio.
definition_or_explanation: The compound rate of growth of one unit of currency invested in a portfolio during a stated measurement period; a measure of investment per-formance that is not sensitive to the timing and amount of withdrawals or additions to the portfolio.

original_glossary_extracted: Tokenization  The process of representing ownership rights to physical assets on a blockchain or distributed ledger.
definition_or_explanation: The process of representing ownership rights to physical assets on a blockchain or distributed ledger.

original_glossary_extracted: Top-down analysis  With reference to investment selection processes, an approach that starts with macro selection (i.e., identifying attractive geographic segments and/or industry segments) and then addresses selection of the most attractive investments within those segments.
definition_or_explanation: With reference to investment selection processes, an approach that starts with macro selection (i.e., identifying attractive geographic segments and/or industry segments) and then addresses selection of the most attractive investments within those segments.

original_glossary_extracted: Total comprehensive income  The change in equity during a period resulting from transaction and other events, other than those changes resulting from transactions with owners in their capacity as owners.
definition_or_explanation: The change in equity during a period resulting from transaction and other events, other than those changes resulting from transactions with owners in their capacity as owners.

original_glossary_extracted: Total cost  The summation of all costs, for which costs are classified as fixed or variable.
definition_or_explanation: The summation of all costs, for which costs are classified as fixed or variable.

original_glossary_extracted: Total factor productivity  A scale factor that reflects the por-tion of growth that is not accounted for by explicit factor inputs (e.g. capital and labor).
definition_or_explanation: A scale factor that reflects the por-tion of growth that is not accounted for by explicit factor inputs (e.g. capital and labor).

original_glossary_extracted: Total fixed cost  The summation of all expenses that do not change as the level of production varies.
definition_or_explanation: The summation of all expenses that do not change as the level of production varies.

original_glossary_extracted: Total invested capital  The sum of market value of common equity, book value of preferred equity, and face value of debt.
definition_or_explanation: The sum of market value of common equity, book value of preferred equity, and face value of debt.

original_glossary_extracted: Total probability rule  A rule explaining the unconditional probability of an event in terms of probabilities of the event conditional on mutually exclusive and exhaustive scenarios.
definition_or_explanation: A rule explaining the unconditional probability of an event in terms of probabilities of the event conditional on mutually exclusive and exhaustive scenarios.

original_glossary_extracted: Total probability rule for expected value  A rule explain-ing the expected value of a random variable in terms of expected values of the random variable conditional on mutually exclusive and exhaustive scenarios.
key_phrase: Total probability rule for expected value
definition_or_explanation: A rule explain-ing the expected value of a random variable in terms of expected values of the random variable conditional on mutually exclusive and exhaustive scenarios.

original_glossary_extracted: Total return  Measures the price appreciation, or percentage change in price of the securities in an index or portfolio, plus any income received over the period.
definition_or_explanation: Measures the price appreciation, or percentage change in price of the securities in an index or portfolio, plus any income received over the period.

original_glossary_extracted: Total return index  An index that reflects the price appreciation or percentage change in price of the constituent securities plus any income received since inception.
definition_or_explanation: An index that reflects the price appreciation or percentage change in price of the constituent securities plus any income received since inception.

original_glossary_extracted: Total return swap  A swap in which one party agrees to pay the total return on a security. Often used as a credit derivative, in which the underlying is a bond.
definition_or_explanation: A swap in which one party agrees to pay the total return on a security. Often used as a credit derivative, in which the underlying is a bond.

original_glossary_extracted: Total variable cost  The summation of all variable expenses.
definition_or_explanation: The summation of all variable expenses.

original_glossary_extracted: Tracking error  The standard deviation of the differences between a portfolio's returns and its benchmark's returns; a synonym of active risk.
definition_or_explanation: The standard deviation of the differences between a portfolio's returns and its benchmark's returns; a synonym of active risk.

original_glossary_extracted: Tracking risk  The standard deviation of the differences between a portfolio's returns and its benchmark's returns; a synonym of active risk. Also called tracking error.
definition_or_explanation: The standard deviation of the differences between a portfolio's returns and its benchmark's returns; a synonym of active risk. Also called tracking error.

original_glossary_extracted: Trade creation  When regional integration results in the replacement of higher cost domestic production by lower cost imports from other members.
definition_or_explanation: When regional integration results in the replacement of higher cost domestic production by lower cost imports from other members.

original_glossary_extracted: Trade credit  A spontaneous form of credit in which a pur-chaser of the goods or service is financing its purchase by delaying the date on which payment is made.
definition_or_explanation: A spontaneous form of credit in which a pur-chaser of the goods or service is financing its purchase by delaying the date on which payment is made.

original_glossary_extracted: Trade diversion  When regional integration results in lower-cost imports from non-member countries being replaced with higher-cost imports from members.
definition_or_explanation: When regional integration results in lower-cost imports from non-member countries being replaced with higher-cost imports from members.

original_glossary_extracted: Trade payables  Amounts that a business owes to its vendors for goods and services that were purchased from them but which have not yet been paid.
definition_or_explanation: Amounts that a business owes to its vendors for goods and services that were purchased from them but which have not yet been paid.

original_glossary_extracted: Trade protection  Government policies that impose restric-tions on trade, such as tariffs and quotas.
definition_or_explanation: Government policies that impose restric-tions on trade, such as tariffs and quotas.

original_glossary_extracted: Trade surplus (deficit)  When the value of exports is greater (less) than the value of imports.
definition_or_explanation: When the value of exports is greater (less) than the value of imports.

original_glossary_extracted: Trading securities  Securities held by a company with the intent to trade them. Also called held-for-trading securities.
definition_or_explanation: Securities held by a company with the intent to trade them. Also called held-for-trading securities.

original_glossary_extracted: Traditional investment markets  Markets for traditional investments, which include all publicly traded debts and equities and shares in pooled investment vehicles that hold publicly traded debts and/or equities.
definition_or_explanation: Markets for traditional investments, which include all publicly traded debts and equities and shares in pooled investment vehicles that hold publicly traded debts and/or equities.

original_glossary_extracted: Transactions money balances  Money balances that are held to finance transactions.
definition_or_explanation: Money balances that are held to finance transactions.

original_glossary_extracted: Transactions motive  In the context of inventory management, the need for inventory as part of the routine production-sales cycle.
definition_or_explanation: In the context of inventory management, the need for inventory as part of the routine production-sales cycle.

original_glossary_extracted: Transfer payments  Welfare payments made through the social security system that exist to provide a basic minimum level of income for low-income households.
definition_or_explanation: Welfare payments made through the social security system that exist to provide a basic minimum level of income for low-income households.

original_glossary_extracted: Transparency  Said of something (e.g., a market) in which infor-mation is fully disclosed to the public and/or regulators.
definition_or_explanation: Said of something (e.g., a market) in which infor-mation is fully disclosed to the public and/or regulators.

original_glossary_extracted: Treasury Inflation-Protected Securities  A bond issued by the United States Treasury Department that is designed to protect the investor from inflation by adjusting the principal of the bond for changes in inflation.
definition_or_explanation: A bond issued by the United States Treasury Department that is designed to protect the investor from inflation by adjusting the principal of the bond for changes in inflation.

original_glossary_extracted: Treasury stock method  A method for accounting for the effect of options (and warrants) on earnings per share (EPS) that specifies what EPS would have been if the options and warrants had been exercised and the company had used the proceeds to repurchase common stock.
definition_or_explanation: A method for accounting for the effect of options (and warrants) on earnings per share (EPS) that specifies what EPS would have been if the options and warrants had been exercised and the company had used the proceeds to repurchase common stock.

original_glossary_extracted: Tree diagram  A diagram with branches emanating from nodes representing either mutually exclusive chance events or mutually exclusive decisions.
definition_or_explanation: A diagram with branches emanating from nodes representing either mutually exclusive chance events or mutually exclusive decisions.

original_glossary_extracted: Trend  A long-term pattern of movement in a particular direction.
definition_or_explanation: A long-term pattern of movement in a particular direction.

original_glossary_extracted: Treynor ratio  A measure of risk-adjusted performance that relates a portfolio's excess returns to the portfolio's beta.
definition_or_explanation: A measure of risk-adjusted performance that relates a portfolio's excess returns to the portfolio's beta.

original_glossary_extracted: Triangle patterns  In technical analysis, a continuation chart pattern that forms as the range between high and low prices narrows, visually forming a triangle.
definition_or_explanation: In technical analysis, a continuation chart pattern that forms as the range between high and low prices narrows, visually forming a triangle.

original_glossary_extracted: Trimmed mean  A mean computed after excluding a stated small percentage of the lowest and highest observations.
definition_or_explanation: A mean computed after excluding a stated small percentage of the lowest and highest observations.

original_glossary_extracted: TRIN  A flow of funds indicator applied to a broad stock market index to measure the relative extent to which money is moving into or out of rising and declining stocks.
definition_or_explanation: A flow of funds indicator applied to a broad stock market index to measure the relative extent to which money is moving into or out of rising and declining stocks.

original_glossary_extracted: Triple bottoms  In technical analysis, a reversal pattern that is formed when the price forms three troughs at roughly the same price level; used to predict a change from a downtrend to an uptrend.
definition_or_explanation: In technical analysis, a reversal pattern that is formed when the price forms three troughs at roughly the same price level; used to predict a change from a downtrend to an uptrend.

original_glossary_extracted: Triple tops  In technical analysis, a reversal pattern that is formed when the price forms three peaks at roughly the same price level; used to predict a change from an uptrend to a downtrend.
definition_or_explanation: In technical analysis, a reversal pattern that is formed when the price forms three peaks at roughly the same price level; used to predict a change from an uptrend to a downtrend.

original_glossary_extracted: Trough  The lowest point of a business cycle.
definition_or_explanation: The lowest point of a business cycle.

original_glossary_extracted: True yield  The internal rate of return on cash flows using the actual calendar including weekends and bank holidays.
definition_or_explanation: The internal rate of return on cash flows using the actual calendar including weekends and bank holidays.

original_glossary_extracted: Trust deed  The governing legal credit agreement, typically incorporated by reference in the prospectus. Also called bond indenture.
definition_or_explanation: The governing legal credit agreement, typically incorporated by reference in the prospectus. Also called bond indenture.

original_glossary_extracted: Trust receipt arrangement  The use of inventory as collateral for a loan. The inventory is segregated and held in trust, and the proceeds of any sale must be remitted to the lender immediately.
definition_or_explanation: The use of inventory as collateral for a loan. The inventory is segregated and held in trust, and the proceeds of any sale must be remitted to the lender immediately.

original_glossary_extracted: Turn-of-the-year effect  Calendar anomaly that stock mar-ket returns in January are significantly higher compared to the rest of the months of the year, with most of the abnormal returns reported during the first five trading days in January.
definition_or_explanation: Calendar anomaly that stock mar-ket returns in January are significantly higher compared to the rest of the months of the year, with most of the abnormal returns reported during the first five trading days in January.

original_glossary_extracted: Two-fund separation theorem  The theory that all investors regardless of taste, risk preferences, and initial wealth will hold a combination of two portfolios or funds: a risk-free asset and an optimal portfolio of risky assets.
definition_or_explanation: The theory that all investors regardless of taste, risk preferences, and initial wealth will hold a combination of two portfolios or funds: a risk-free asset and an optimal portfolio of risky assets.

original_glossary_extracted: Two-sided hypothesis test  A test in which the null hypoth-esis is rejected in favor of the alternative hypothesis if the evidence indicates that the population parameter is either smaller or larger than a hypothesized value.
definition_or_explanation: A test in which the null hypoth-esis is rejected in favor of the alternative hypothesis if the evidence indicates that the population parameter is either smaller or larger than a hypothesized value.

original_glossary_extracted: Two-tailed hypothesis test  A test in which the null hypoth-esis is rejected in favor of the alternative hypothesis if the evidence indicates that the population parameter is either smaller or larger than a hypothesized value.
definition_or_explanation: A test in which the null hypoth-esis is rejected in favor of the alternative hypothesis if the evidence indicates that the population parameter is either smaller or larger than a hypothesized value.

original_glossary_extracted: Two-week repo rate  The interest rate on a two-week repur-chase agreement; may be used as a policy rate by a central bank.
definition_or_explanation: The interest rate on a two-week repur-chase agreement; may be used as a policy rate by a central bank.

original_glossary_extracted: Type I error  The error of rejecting a true null hypothesis.
definition_or_explanation: The error of rejecting a true null hypothesis.

original_glossary_extracted: Type II error  The error of not rejecting a false null hypothesis.
definition_or_explanation: The error of not rejecting a false null hypothesis.

original_glossary_extracted: Unanticipated (unexpected) inflation  The component of inflation that is a surprise.
definition_or_explanation: The component of inflation that is a surprise.

original_glossary_extracted: Unconditional probability  The probability of an event not conditioned on another event.
definition_or_explanation: The probability of an event not conditioned on another event.

original_glossary_extracted: Underemployed  A person who has a job but has the qualifi-cations to work a significantly higher-paying job.
definition_or_explanation: A person who has a job but has the qualifi-cations to work a significantly higher-paying job.

original_glossary_extracted: Underlying  An asset that trades in a market in which buyers and sellers meet, decide on a price, and the seller then delivers the asset to the buyer and receives payment. The underlying is the asset or other derivative on which a par-ticular derivative is based. The market for the underlying is also referred to as the spot market.
definition_or_explanation: An asset that trades in a market in which buyers and sellers meet, decide on a price, and the seller then delivers the asset to the buyer and receives payment. The underlying is the asset or other derivative on which a par-ticular derivative is based. The market for the underlying is also referred to as the spot market.

original_glossary_extracted: Underwriter  A firm, usually an investment bank, that takes the risk of buying the newly issued securities from the issuer, and then reselling them to investors or to dealers, thus guaranteeing the sale of the securities at the offering price negotiated with the issuer.
definition_or_explanation: A firm, usually an investment bank, that takes the risk of buying the newly issued securities from the issuer, and then reselling them to investors or to dealers, thus guaranteeing the sale of the securities at the offering price negotiated with the issuer.

original_glossary_extracted: Underwritten offering  A type of securities issue mechanism in which the investment bank guarantees the sale of the securities at an offering price that is negotiated with the issuer. Also known as firm commitment offering.
definition_or_explanation: A type of securities issue mechanism in which the investment bank guarantees the sale of the securities at an offering price that is negotiated with the issuer. Also known as firm commitment offering.
