original_glossary_extracted: Unearned revenue  A liability account for money that has been collected for goods or services that have not yet been delivered; payment received in advance of providing a good or service. Also called deferred revenue or deferred income.
definition_or_explanation: A liability account for money that has been collected for goods or services that have not yet been delivered; payment received in advance of providing a good or service. Also called deferred revenue or deferred income.

original_glossary_extracted: Unemployed  People who are actively seeking employment but are currently without a job.
definition_or_explanation: People who are actively seeking employment but are currently without a job.

original_glossary_extracted: Unemployment rate  The ratio of unemployed to the labor force.
definition_or_explanation: The ratio of unemployed to the labor force.

original_glossary_extracted: Unexpected inflation  The component of inflation that is a surprise.
definition_or_explanation: The component of inflation that is a surprise.

original_glossary_extracted: Unit elastic  An elasticity with a magnitude of negative one. Also called unitary elastic.
definition_or_explanation: An elasticity with a magnitude of negative one. Also called unitary elastic.

original_glossary_extracted: Unit labor cost  The average labor cost to produce one unit of output.
definition_or_explanation: The average labor cost to produce one unit of output.

original_glossary_extracted: Unit normal distribution  The normal density with mean (μ) equal to 0 and standard deviation (σ) equal to 1.
definition_or_explanation: The normal density with mean (μ) equal to 0 and standard deviation (σ) equal to 1.

original_glossary_extracted: Units-of-production method  A depreciation method that allocates the cost of a long-lived asset based on actual usage during the period.
definition_or_explanation: A depreciation method that allocates the cost of a long-lived asset based on actual usage during the period.

original_glossary_extracted: Univariate distribution  A distribution that specifies the prob-abilities for a single random variable.
definition_or_explanation: A distribution that specifies the prob-abilities for a single random variable.

original_glossary_extracted: Universal owners  Long-term investors, such as pension funds, that have significant assets invested in globally diversified portfolios.
definition_or_explanation: Long-term investors, such as pension funds, that have significant assets invested in globally diversified portfolios.

original_glossary_extracted: Unlimited funds  An unlimited funds environment assumes that the company can raise the funds it wants for all prof-itable projects simply by paying the required rate of return.
definition_or_explanation: An unlimited funds environment assumes that the company can raise the funds it wants for all prof-itable projects simply by paying the required rate of return.

original_glossary_extracted: Unsecured debt  Debt which gives the debtholder only a general claim on an issuer's assets and cash flow.
definition_or_explanation: Debt which gives the debtholder only a general claim on an issuer's assets and cash flow.

original_glossary_extracted: Unsponsored  A type of depository receipt in which the foreign company whose shares are held by the depository has no involvement in the issuance of the receipts.
definition_or_explanation: A type of depository receipt in which the foreign company whose shares are held by the depository has no involvement in the issuance of the receipts.

original_glossary_extracted: Unsupervised learning  A machine learning approach that does not make use of labeled training data.
definition_or_explanation: A machine learning approach that does not make use of labeled training data.

original_glossary_extracted: Up transition probability  The probability that an asset's value moves up.
definition_or_explanation: The probability that an asset's value moves up.

original_glossary_extracted: Validity instructions  Instructions which indicate when the order may be filled.
definition_or_explanation: Instructions which indicate when the order may be filled.

original_glossary_extracted: Valuation allowance  A reserve created against deferred tax assets, based on the likelihood of realizing the deferred tax assets in future accounting periods.
definition_or_explanation: A reserve created against deferred tax assets, based on the likelihood of realizing the deferred tax assets in future accounting periods.

original_glossary_extracted: Valuation ratios  Ratios that measure the quantity of an asset or flow (e.g., earnings) in relation to the price associated with a specified claim (e.g., a share or ownership of the enterprise).
definition_or_explanation: Ratios that measure the quantity of an asset or flow (e.g., earnings) in relation to the price associated with a specified claim (e.g., a share or ownership of the enterprise).

original_glossary_extracted: Value at risk  (VaR) A money measure of the minimum value of losses expected during a specified time period at a given level of probability.
definition_or_explanation: (VaR) A money measure of the minimum value of losses expected during a specified time period at a given level of probability.

original_glossary_extracted: Value investors  With reference to equity investors, investors who are focused on paying a relatively low share price in relation to earnings or assets per share.
definition_or_explanation: With reference to equity investors, investors who are focused on paying a relatively low share price in relation to earnings or assets per share.

original_glossary_extracted: VaR  See value at risk.
definition_or_explanation: See value at risk.

original_glossary_extracted: Variable costs  Costs that fluctuate with the level of produc-tion and sales.
definition_or_explanation: Costs that fluctuate with the level of produc-tion and sales.

original_glossary_extracted: Variable-rate note  Similar to a floating-rate note, except that the spread is variable rather than constant.
definition_or_explanation: Similar to a floating-rate note, except that the spread is variable rather than constant.

original_glossary_extracted: Variance  The expected value (the probability-weighted average) of squared deviations from a random variable's expected value.
definition_or_explanation: The expected value (the probability-weighted average) of squared deviations from a random variable's expected value.

original_glossary_extracted: Variation margin  Additional margin that must be deposited in an amount sufficient to bring the balance up to the initial margin requirement.
definition_or_explanation: Additional margin that must be deposited in an amount sufficient to bring the balance up to the initial margin requirement.

original_glossary_extracted: Veblen goods  Goods that increase in desirability with increas-ing price.
definition_or_explanation: Goods that increase in desirability with increas-ing price.

original_glossary_extracted: Vega  A measure of the sensitivity of an option's price to changes in the underlying's volatility.
definition_or_explanation: A measure of the sensitivity of an option's price to changes in the underlying's volatility.

original_glossary_extracted: Venture capital  Investments that provide "seed" or start-up capital, early-stage financing, or later-stage financing (including mezzanine-stage financing) to companies that are in early development stages and require additional capital for expansion or preparation for an initial public offering.
definition_or_explanation: Investments that provide "seed" or start-up capital, early-stage financing, or later-stage financing (including mezzanine-stage financing) to companies that are in early development stages and require additional capital for expansion or preparation for an initial public offering.

original_glossary_extracted: Venture capital fund  A fund for private equity investors that provides financing for development-stage companies.
definition_or_explanation: A fund for private equity investors that provides financing for development-stage companies.

original_glossary_extracted: Vertical analysis  Common-size analysis using only one report-ing period or one base financial statement; for example, an income statement in which all items are stated as per-centages of sales.
definition_or_explanation: Common-size analysis using only one report-ing period or one base financial statement; for example, an income statement in which all items are stated as per-centages of sales.

original_glossary_extracted: Vertical demand schedule  Implies that some fixed quantity is demanded, regardless of price.
definition_or_explanation: Implies that some fixed quantity is demanded, regardless of price.

original_glossary_extracted: Volatility  As used in option pricing, the standard deviation of the continuously compounded returns on the under-lying asset.
definition_or_explanation: As used in option pricing, the standard deviation of the continuously compounded returns on the under-lying asset.

original_glossary_extracted: Voluntarily unemployed  A person voluntarily outside the labor force, such as a jobless worker refusing an available vacancy.
definition_or_explanation: A person voluntarily outside the labor force, such as a jobless worker refusing an available vacancy.

original_glossary_extracted: Voluntary export restraint  A trade barrier under which the exporting country agrees to limit its exports of the good to its trading partners to a specific number of units.
definition_or_explanation: A trade barrier under which the exporting country agrees to limit its exports of the good to its trading partners to a specific number of units.

original_glossary_extracted: Vote by proxy  A mechanism that allows a designated party-such as another shareholder, a shareholder representative, or management-to vote on the shareholder's behalf.
definition_or_explanation: A mechanism that allows a designated party-such as another shareholder, a shareholder representative, or management-to vote on the shareholder's behalf.

original_glossary_extracted: Warehouse receipt arrangement  The use of inventory as collateral for a loan; similar to a trust receipt arrangement except there is a third party (i.e., a warehouse company) that supervises the inventory.
definition_or_explanation: The use of inventory as collateral for a loan; similar to a trust receipt arrangement except there is a third party (i.e., a warehouse company) that supervises the inventory.

original_glossary_extracted: Warrant  Attached option that gives its holder the right to buy the underlying stock of the issuing company at a fixed exercise price until the expiration date.
definition_or_explanation: Attached option that gives its holder the right to buy the underlying stock of the issuing company at a fixed exercise price until the expiration date.

original_glossary_extracted: Weak-form efficient market hypothesis  The belief that secu-rity prices fully reflect all past market data, which refers to all historical price and volume trading information.
definition_or_explanation: The belief that secu-rity prices fully reflect all past market data, which refers to all historical price and volume trading information.

original_glossary_extracted: Wealth effect  An increase (decrease) in household wealth increases (decreases) consumer spending out of a given level of current income.
definition_or_explanation: An increase (decrease) in household wealth increases (decreases) consumer spending out of a given level of current income.

original_glossary_extracted: Weighted average cost method  An inventory accounting method that averages the total cost of available inventory items over the total units available for sale.
definition_or_explanation: An inventory accounting method that averages the total cost of available inventory items over the total units available for sale.

original_glossary_extracted: Weighted average cost of capital  A weighted average of the aftertax required rates of return on a company's common stock, preferred stock, and long-term debt, where the weights are the fraction of each source of financing in the company's target capital structure.
definition_or_explanation: A weighted average of the aftertax required rates of return on a company's common stock, preferred stock, and long-term debt, where the weights are the fraction of each source of financing in the company's target capital structure.

original_glossary_extracted: Weighted average coupon rate  Weighting the mortgage rate of each mortgage loan in the pool by the percentage of the mortgage outstanding relative to the outstanding amount of all the mortgages in the pool.
definition_or_explanation: Weighting the mortgage rate of each mortgage loan in the pool by the percentage of the mortgage outstanding relative to the outstanding amount of all the mortgages in the pool.

original_glossary_extracted: Weighted average life  A measure that gives investors an indication of how long they can expect to hold the MBS before it is paid off; the convention-based average time to receipt of all principal repayments. Also called average life.
definition_or_explanation: A measure that gives investors an indication of how long they can expect to hold the MBS before it is paid off; the convention-based average time to receipt of all principal repayments. Also called average life.

original_glossary_extracted: Weighted average maturity  Weighting the remaining num-ber of months to maturity for each mortgage loan in the pool by the amount of the outstanding mortgage balance.
definition_or_explanation: Weighting the remaining num-ber of months to maturity for each mortgage loan in the pool by the amount of the outstanding mortgage balance.

original_glossary_extracted: Weighted mean  An average in which each observation is weighted by an index of its relative importance.
definition_or_explanation: An average in which each observation is weighted by an index of its relative importance.

original_glossary_extracted: Wholesale price index  Reflects the price changes experienced by domestic producers in a country.
definition_or_explanation: Reflects the price changes experienced by domestic producers in a country.

original_glossary_extracted: Winsorized mean  A mean computed after assigning a stated percent of the lowest values equal to one specified low value, and a stated percent of the highest values equal to one specified high value.
definition_or_explanation: A mean computed after assigning a stated percent of the lowest values equal to one specified low value, and a stated percent of the highest values equal to one specified high value.

original_glossary_extracted: Working capital  The difference between current assets and current liabilities.
definition_or_explanation: The difference between current assets and current liabilities.

original_glossary_extracted: Working capital management  The management of a compa-ny's short-term assets (such as inventory) and short-term liabilities (such as money owed to suppliers).
definition_or_explanation: The management of a compa-ny's short-term assets (such as inventory) and short-term liabilities (such as money owed to suppliers).

original_glossary_extracted: World price  The price prevailing in the world market.
definition_or_explanation: The price prevailing in the world market.

original_glossary_extracted: Yield  The actual return on a debt security if it is held to maturity.
definition_or_explanation: The actual return on a debt security if it is held to maturity.

original_glossary_extracted: Yield duration  The sensitivity of the bond price with respect to the bond's own yield-to-maturity.
definition_or_explanation: The sensitivity of the bond price with respect to the bond's own yield-to-maturity.

original_glossary_extracted: Yield to maturity  Annual return that an investor earns on a bond if the investor purchases the bond today and holds it until maturity. It is the discount rate that equates the pres-ent value of the bond's expected cash flows until maturity with the bond's price. Also called yield-to-redemption or redemption yield.
definition_or_explanation: Annual return that an investor earns on a bond if the investor purchases the bond today and holds it until maturity. It is the discount rate that equates the pres-ent value of the bond's expected cash flows until maturity with the bond's price. Also called yield-to-redemption or redemption yield.

original_glossary_extracted: Yield to redemption  See yield to maturity.
definition_or_explanation: See yield to maturity.

original_glossary_extracted: Yield-to-worst  The lowest of the sequence of yields-to-call and the yield-to-maturity.
definition_or_explanation: The lowest of the sequence of yields-to-call and the yield-to-maturity.

original_glossary_extracted: Zero-coupon bonds  Bonds that do not pay interest during the bond's life. It is issued at a discount to par value and redeemed at par. Also called pure discount bonds.
definition_or_explanation: Bonds that do not pay interest during the bond's life. It is issued at a discount to par value and redeemed at par. Also called pure discount bonds.

original_glossary_extracted: Zero volatility spread (Z-spread)  Calculates a constant yield spread over a government (or interest rate swap) spot curve.
definition_or_explanation: Calculates a constant yield spread over a government (or interest rate swap) spot curve.
